review: TITLE: Holiday Tea at The Adolphus | TEXT: Carlos, Jitendra, and their entire team provided our group of 14 with an amazing Holiday High Tea experience  The treats were delicious, and Carlos‚Äôs commentary added to the overall atmosphere‚Äîan absolutely perfect afternoon.

TITLE: Consistent excellence | TEXT: This was our third visit to this always busy restaurant. The food was again excellent. Our wait person was excellent and provided valuable advice. Every dish was special and will return again soon!

TITLE: Stockton's finest | TEXT: I recently visited Stockton visiting  family and friends after being away for 10 years a must have is Arroyos  restaurant. I have been a loyal customer since the 70's and have followed them when they relocated. Yes the food is that good,the homemade  tortillas fresh salsa available in medium and hot. This food is made with love of three generations. I recommend  the combination plate with the beef taco,chili relleno and beef enchilada,the gravy is good enough to jump through a plate glass window without breaking it. Over the years I have tried every dish at least twice and have  come to this choice.If your in a rush try the beef,bean and cheese burrito filling and fast made with love.I have been to thousands of restaurants all over the world tried cuisine in Mexico and Arroyos is 5 star in satisfaction and taste bud joy
TITLE: Exceptional all around | TEXT: We went to visit our kids. Saison experience was beyond expectations. Staff game us exceptional service. Food and drinks were well presented and delicious.

TITLE: Busy, delicious to-go options in the heart of downtown Philly | TEXT: Crowded and bustling, between the tight fits amid the narrow aisles, you can find some amazing greasy-spoon lunch options frequented by tourists and locals alike.  There are several great options for cheesesteak and various Asian fare.  Best to get anything to-go, though, because tables are hard to come by and packed in tightly together where they do exist.

TITLE: Calming and amazing! | TEXT: I got the black & white cookie for dessert and it was great! The quality of their service was amazing because they gave out dishes to your table. The interior was also very calming and dim (but not pitch black) and vintage-like. They had a variety of many foods for different times (breakfast, brunch, lunch, dinner, dessert, and drinks). I suggest you go here with your friends for a nice chat or small meal!

TITLE: Love it here! | TEXT: My sister and I started going to this venue at the beginning of 2025 and have since become regulars.  The food is fantastic, the staff are incredibly kind and welcoming (from the front door to the wait staff) and the entertainment is over the top. The jazz artists they manage to get are the best!   I cannot wait to see what 2026 brings to this fantastic venue.  And a shout out to the emcee Mr. Kenny - he is a very cool person.
TITLE: Best restorant in Miami | TEXT: I have to write another review for Sexy fish. The only restaurant in Miami that has a smoking section with gold ashtrays. Rating 100/10. The dessert was perfect
TITLE: Excellent | TEXT: Came here for dinner with my Philly family - food was excellent  - very nicely prepared & presented!  Great service - would highly recommend to anyone visiting Philadelphia.

TITLE: If the locals are always here, it‚Äôs got to be good. And it was great! | TEXT: Rustic environment with excellent food and lots of options. We‚Äôve driven by multiple times on our way to Jacksonville and were determined to stop this time. We got there around 11:45am, hoping to beat the rush, which we did. By the time we left, both the parking lot and restaurant were full. It was very obvious that the vast majority of the folks inside were locals. My wife had fried shrimp - about a dozen large shrimp with a very light coating of batter. Excellent! I wanted something not fried and opted for the full pot of the chowder. Also excellent! They say it‚Äôs made fresh daily, and it was. A medium sized pan filled with a tomato based, thick soup with fresh potatoes, celery and large chunks of tuna and diced shrimp. Highly recommend. Also available in a ‚Äúhalf pot‚Äù if you‚Äôre not really hungry. Don‚Äôt drive by - go in and enjoy great food and service.

TITLE: Birthday luncheon | TEXT: With an old coworker was a wonderful time because the food here is so delicious & the atmosphere lively. We want to thank Jordan M who was truly lovely & made our time even more joyful,

TITLE: We love this place!! We travel miles to get to OUR FAVORITE ITALIAN RESTAURANT. | TEXT: Bestie came and we introduced them to our favorite Italian place. We also go every year for his birthday.  We tried: The goat cheese ball appetizer- Excellent sauce with the bread to dip with.ü§å The food truck favorite- good flavor ‚ù§Ô∏è pesto. The limoncello "smooth & creamy"ü§§. The orange cake tastes like a grandma made it with love & the pecans were lighty toasted/ crunchy & the carmel was smooth & sweet like honey OMG! The owner suggested the chocolate mousse. WOW!! üôÉ I instantly turned into the Kool-aid man "OH YEAH" it was so good. We all give it 5 stars.ü§©üòç

TITLE: Avoid‚Ä¶don‚Äôt be thrown by Michelin star! | TEXT: Drinks took 20 minutes to get and they arrived only because we had to remind them we ordered them. Food was simply awful. The leek dish did not taste like leeks at all. Not sure what was inside the tortilla. The presentation is ugly. We ordered four dishes and left after two‚Ä¶90 minutes later‚Ä¶yes service was that bad! Skip this restaurant and go to Kokos down the street!

TITLE: Thankful for Panda for opening up for us during the Coronavirus outbreak | TEXT: After trying hard to find Chinese restaurants that will allow patrons to dine inside I was lucky to find Panda open and being careful to keep diners social distanced while serving a well stocked buffet of fresh tasty food.  This seems to be the least critical review of all written about Panda although most found the food good.  Sure the place doesn't look as fancy as others but it also isn't pretentious as some buffets and if it keeps costs down, I have absolutely no complaints and everyone agrees it is well worth the price.  I'm not foolish enough to think I can have it both ways, fancy decorations and extras with the lowest prices, especially because it was a clean place, the waiter brought our drinks three times, was courteous, wore a mask as all the staff and I felt safe and taken care of.  The watermelon was sweet and juicy, ice cream was the real kind, not soft serve and I enjoyed and finished every dish I took.  They were cooked and seasoned perfectly.  The vegetable dishes were fresh and crispy, never overcooked to a mush like some southern vegetables tend to be.  None of the food was old or lacked freshness.  It was all well done and very tasteful to me and my companion who was glad I found a place so nice, compared to another  that was not open for dining in.

TITLE: Thank you! | TEXT: This was just the loveliest freakin' experience. I brought my wife here for a (belated, because it takes awhile to get a reservation!ü§£) birthday dinner, just the other night. I've rarely experienced such a warm, welcoming and pleasant atmosphere. It really was just like a dinner party. Every single person in this place seemed to be having a blast. The food was wonderful, of course (when I die, let it be by drowning in a pool of white truffle sabayon). What really made the difference though? The complete lack of pretension or stuffiness. This place is run and operated by a group of folks who clearly love the heck out of what they do. You can tell they're like a family. I simply had a wonderful time. That's it! I would happily go back and cannot wait for the opportunity. I am a father of two. I do not get nights out. I do not have a life. Not really. I am very thankful for the staff at the Kitchen for giving us another lovely memory and another dining experience to look forward to repeating. Thank you!

TITLE: Overhyped and overpriced | TEXT: Very average food. Much of the seafood plater was over salted or mushy. The other small plates we had (fried oysters, crab capellini and ground shrimp with noodles) were either bland or over spiced. I tried to order a bottle of white wine (the list is very overpriced) and the first bottle ended up being a red that was listed on the white menu and the second couldn‚Äôt be located. Service was good but the food was poor and well below New Orleans seafood standards.

TITLE: Perfect Asian fusion experience | TEXT: Benu is an over the top Asian fusion restaurant in downtown San Francisco.  The meal is a prix fixe experience with 3-4 pre‚Äîmeal appetizers.   Then the menu is superb, it includes pheasant, lobster, quail and abalone.   Dessert is a yuja sorbet with chocolate swirls.  The service is the best ever - everything was done perfectly and every dish was explained perfectly.  A good wonderful dinner and experience.
TITLE: Great experience | TEXT: It was a great experience I went there with my family and we love it. It was amazing hospitality and super fresh food. Highly recommended

TITLE: Excellent | TEXT: Excellent In-N-Out Burger. Reasonably fast and very friendly service. I see no point in the Drive-Thru. Cars were lined up on to the main road. I walked in, ordered, and was served within 6 minutes.

TITLE: Decadent Italian small dishes | TEXT: The menu is full of very well prepared Italian plates for sharing.   Dishes were a hit and served hot out of the kitchen - the polpette meatballs were savory and flavorful, and we loved the polenta, squash, clams, gnocchi, bucatini and balanzoni.   Perhaps the rigatoni was the only unimpressive dish we would pass on next time.   The tiramisu is decadent and enough to share across 4-6 people!   Tart cherry sorbetto was a serious treat!!   Our server was welcoming and attentive, very familiar with the menu and recommended an excellent wine.  They do tack on 3% kitchen admin - not to say the kitchen was any less than superb, but we are beyond unusual circumstances of Covid.   Consumers prefer simplicity and transparency and it would come off well to price the menu as you need to.
TITLE: Affordable Latin fusion | TEXT: Great place for a Latin fusion cuisine. Ceviches are to die for! Cuban empanadas are delicious üòã drinks great and Albert the host manager a GEM !
TITLE: Fantastic brunch spot | TEXT: This was probably our favourite meal in San Francisco‚Ä¶ great range of brunch options and fantastic friendly service- highly recommend

TITLE: BEST MEAL SO FAR! | TEXT: My wife and I have been visiting TURUNC for many years,if fact we stayed at the Es for a month 10 yrs ago,but we have not visited the restaurant for a few years,we went tonight,to be met by Mehmet,who was there 10 yrs ago, We booked a table the night before,tonight we a free starter of homemade bread and an olive oil dip,followed by chicken in bacon sauce and chicken with salmon & almond,both meals were excellent as was the service and great views and good value for money,we both said the best meal of our month long stay,we will be back

TITLE: Outstanding Place for Breakfast/Brunch | TEXT: The Dutch has changed a bit since some of these pictures.  It has upgraded the atmosphere, and the food continues to be outstanding. The wait staff is fast, friendly and efficient.  We had a egg white omelet and 3-Egg breakfast.  I recommend the sausage; its some of the best I've have had in a while (but spicy).   Great local place, quiet and good for talking.
TITLE: What a dinner‚Ä¶ | TEXT: Excellent food, drink, ambience and service. Couple that with an old school vibe and an amazing view, and it makes for a great dinner.  We loved it and would return.

TITLE: Wet Behind the Bear's Ears | TEXT: Week long educational outing with a small group that was really educational and fun.  Seeing Bear's Ears National Monument for the first time was breathtaking.  The depth of knowledge from the scholars and coordinators on the excursion was very helpful.  Our native cultures are still alive and well and we all should explore while we have the opportunity.  Crow Canyon respects our Native American lands and wants to preserve and share with everyone.

TITLE: A love letter to Kann | TEXT: This place was an EXPERIENCE to say the least.  Let‚Äôs start with the service our server made our experience very unique to us, understanding my personal dietary restrictions and explaining the restaurant and it‚Äôs entirety to us and the culture how the food works and is intended to be eaten (that being shared of personal meals).   Now let‚Äôs talk about the food. The food itself felt like comfort all while still remaining sophisticated. It was extremely well portioned for you to be able to experience from starter meals to the actual entr√©es all the way to dessert. The best way to describe the food experience I had was the comfort of going to eat at my Nina‚Äôs and being served my favorite meal but at an elevated experience with great drinks and service.   One thing I normally don‚Äôt review is atmosphere because I love hole in the walls, but the atmosphere of the restaurant itself was organized without feeling so modern and also very busy while also feeling very warm and that says quite a bit, considering that we sat at the communal counter, which you would imagine would feel like like a very individualized experience, yet, it was! I felt as though I was in my own bubble and loved seeing what others were ordering (I‚Äôm nosey like that). So don‚Äôt shy away from the chef‚Äôs counter if you can‚Äôt get your own table. Oh and cleanliness was a 11/10.   The price point was fair.   I would 10000% recommend this as not only a restaurant but as an experience.

TITLE: Above | TEXT: Another amazing experience today. Had tofu tacos and a latte. View of the bay from my seat only a few yards from the west shore of Treasure Island. And as always the staff was so friendly and helpful to this senior.

TITLE: Great birthday surprise | TEXT: I booked a surprise birthday gift for my husband to 'fly' a simulator Spitfire. It was amazing. My husband was thrilled with this experience as his late mother built these planes during the war. Lovely welcoming staff who helped make this a remarkable memory.

TITLE: Absolutely loved this iconic place | TEXT: If you like Jazz this is an essential bar to visit.  The decor is amazing dating from 1934 and the jazz music was incredible. The drink prices were excellent too.  Very good cocktails for just $8.  Also really liked the bar staff.  This is definitely worth a visit

TITLE: Exceptional Experience | TEXT: This was my third or fourth time dining at Friday Saturday Sunday, and I think it gets better each time! The detail to every aspect of the food preparation is evident, along with the variety and uniqueness of every dish.  The servers are very approachable and extremely knowledgeable about every dish. The meal starts with seasonal snacks and progresses through vegetable tastings and a variety of proteins.  The meal ends with a dessert or two that in a perfect ending to a magnificent culinary experience!  I visit Philadelphia solo and never feel awkward or out of place dining by myself at this restaurant.  This is definitely a very upscale restaurant but pulls that off without being pretentious or snobby.  The upstairs tasting menu dining room is cozy yet comfortable.  I really can't say enough about the restaurant!  It is expensive, but should be thought of as an experience more than just a dinner.  In my opinion, the quality justifies the experience.  An added bonus to the tasting menu is the great wine and cocktail selections.  Friday Saturday Sunday really cares about it's patrons.  I look forward to seeing the hostess when I walk in, as she remembers me from previous visits.  That's pretty amazing considering the number of people that walk through that door.
TITLE: Bring your appetite | TEXT: Stopped for lunch and was stuffed for the rest of the day! Huge portions, good food, friendly staff. The chicken enchilada soup was my favorite.

TITLE: Not the old Ola | TEXT: Used to really enjoy but just had a very disappointing lunch.  The ceviche was far too acidic, overpowering the fish, and the shrimp overcooked and tough.  Fortunately the mojitos were very good
TITLE: [no title] | TEXT: Favorite breakfast and short order place.  Food,  service and price is great!  Best of all is the friendly "hometown" atmosphere.

TITLE: Order to go??? | TEXT: Love the food - never missed yet on the three times that I have been there.  The only problem is the lack of sufficient parking. Most of the street parking require resident stickers or are limited to 15 minutes or 1 hour at the most.  Parking lots holds 8  (?) cars? Go with someone with a resident parking sticker.

TITLE: It was walking into a ToysRus store | TEXT: I had read many reviews online and asked staff at my hotel all the food market. It was a 10-15 walk from my hotel and walking to the Reading Terminal Market was like walking into a toy store and not knowing what toy you want buy first.  There was so much  choices  of food available.  After walking round the market for around 10 minutes looking to see what I fancied I eventually chose a vender and had my first Philly cheesesteak.  Delicious, will defo go back again before I leave. Must do place for a visit.

TITLE: Harding Presidential Sites | TEXT: We had a great visit to the Warren G Harding Presidential Library and Memorial. The Library (aka Museum) is quite small compared to other presidential libraries, but does a good job telling the story of Harding's short presidency. Tours of his home are only offered on the hour, so we had to miss that, but did take photos from the outside. We also visited the Harding Memorial in the cemetery, which was quite impressive. If you're passing by Marion, Ohio, take a break from your drive and stop by to see the presidential sites.
TITLE: Good but garlic everywhere | TEXT: The food and the service are good. But so much garlic everywhere‚Ä¶drinks were also good. I would go back but not my first choice.
TITLE: Great drinks by Sabina | TEXT: This place is always fun to come back to. I enjoy my time at the bar usually and servie by Sabina is great! She is a very lovely lady and always good to talk to.

TITLE: Clap and bow at every bite | TEXT: This is an experience in dining like no other! I have dined here 4 times since 2008. We always had unique savory food in small bites coupled with an entertaining chef. Cuisine masterpieces are presented like a show. Bravo! Standing ovation!

TITLE: Flavor party in every bite | TEXT: One of the best restaurants ever! If you enjoy flavor and creativity and great service, this place hits all the marks! The chefs choice tasting menu was fantastic!

TITLE: Great food, great staff and a different experience! | TEXT: There were 4 of us and one person could not tolerate garlic and our server really helped to determine the dishes that were free of it and which ones could be modified. I knew we were in a great restaurant ! Lots in the menu to choose from and the concept was to share the plates. We decided to do that but we also chose to have one as our main dish each. All the dishes were fantastic and too many to individually comment on. My main was the black cod and it was very good. I also had a bite of the pork chop and it was rich in flavour, moist and actually heavenly.  Overall a great culinary outing ! Well done!

TITLE: A welcome surprise | TEXT: When we got to San Quirico and saw the town, the main square, and the outside of the hotel, we were prepared to be disappointed. It's a small town, there's a gas station in the center of the piazza, and if you're looking for the hotel - well, the sign mostly indicates the restaurant: Ristorante La Vecchia Fonte. In fact, you have to enter the restaurant, walk through to the back, and say you have a reservation in the hotel. The friendly and helpful (though somewhat English-challenged) staff take you upstairs and show you your room - the rooms are bright, clean, and usable, with views overlooking the piazza or the town. It's a 15 minute (or so) level walk to the historic abandoned town of Vertozza nearby; otherwise, there's not much to do in San Quirico. We had dinner in the hotel's restaurant (Very good!) and breakfast (included) in the back of the restaurant. The promised WiFi didn't seem to connect in our room - but this is often the case in Italian hotels in our experience.

TITLE: Nice treat | TEXT: I first visited Tail Up Goat in 2019. It was astounding. Tried to visit last year but without a reservation, and ended up at their excellent sister restaurant. This year, we made reservations.  Great meal. The format has changed in the years since my first visit. Now, if you dine in the dining room, you must order the complete pre fixe menu‚Ä¶ and some of the food is raw. I didn‚Äôt love that. But overall a delicious meal, nicely paced.

TITLE: A wonderful winery and restaurant! | TEXT: A wonderful winery with a great restaurant. Very beautiful inside. Friendly staff. Great to go up the stairs and look down from above into the giant barrel rooms! A very special place.

TITLE: Museum and House Tour Make this a fun Visit | TEXT: A visit to this presidential library comprises three potential activities.  First, there is an hour long tour of his house.  Second, the main building includes a small exhibition of his time as President.  Lastly, a mile from the library is his memorial.  We spent just under two hours here.
TITLE: Dont come | TEXT: We had a reservation but sat over 40 minutes after, ran out of our menu choice then ran out of the beer we ordered and food took forever to come.  Will not come back

TITLE: Learning at the Warren G. Harding Presidential Sites | TEXT: Great trip. We arrived at approximately 9:30 am and made our way towards the entrance of the museum. After paying the admission fee, we received a quick overview of the site and went on our way. We opted to view some of the outdoor exhibits first, which included the guard house and press house. The press house contained multiple informational plaques about President Hardings wife and her contributions to society. After viewing the press house, we made our way to the front porch of the house, where we waited for the 10 am guided hour tour to begin. There were guided tours of the presidents former house being held every hour throughout the day. The guided tour of the house was very informational, and the tour guide took us from room to room, while pointing out interesting features and artifacts out for display. The tour guide told us several personal stories related to the Hardings time at the house. The guided tour lasted roughly 1 hour.  After viewing the house, we went back inside to view the main exhibits. We opted to watch a short documentary about President Hardings life and some of the trials and tribulations he faced during his time as President. There were multiple informational plaques out for display, many of them quite text heavy, that went into detail about Hardings upbringing and roots as the owner of a newspaper company in Marion. The plaques also talked about election day, and several of the policy‚Äôs Harding implemented while in office. The last section of the museum dealt with his death and some controversial issues that surrounded his presidency. There were multiple artifacts out for display in the museum, along with short video clips that related to President Harding's time in office.  Tip: I recommend spending 3 hours here if you truly want to see everything.

TITLE: A well drilled operation and good food. And inexpensive | TEXT: Although not particularly a fan of burgers we gave this place a try. The visit was made better as we managed to get a table. With the volume of customers that isn't guaranteed. The quantity and quality of food was very good. Watching the throughput of customers and speed of operation [very slick] was impressive. And obviously very popular as one early evening we saw the queue [line] from order counter to door and some yards down the street.

TITLE: Nothing left to see | TEXT: Church of Saint Menas of Samatya also called as Agios Minas Church in Turkish is a Greek Orthodox Church in ƒ∞stanbul.ƒ∞t is located in the district of Fatih,in the neighbourhood of Kocamustafapa≈üa (historical Samatya) and it lies inside the walled city.Very easy to reach at by public transport like buses and tram and then a short walk.Presently it is also difficult to locate it and not in a good shape to see.Not recommended.

TITLE: A bit of a disappointment | TEXT: Having been recommended this as a treat for brunch we were looking forward to our visit.  Aware that most hotel lifts need a card to make them work we asked at the front desk and they just told us to go up to the 19th floor.  We went up as far as the 14th where a customer got in the lift and we started to descend again.  Luckily this customer used their room key to press for the 19th and once everyone got out in the lobby we went back up again.   The young lady serving was very polite and friendly but was on her own and the two people who were behind the desk did not attempt to help her.   We ordered starters and a main and after a half hour wait all the food came out together.  The main was warm but not hot as was the starter the toast had been hot at some point but was definitely cold by the time it got to us.   Having said all that the restaurant looked stunning, the food when it finally arrived although a little cold tasted good and the price was not unreasonable it‚Äôs just a shame that the customer experience was not what we would have expected

TITLE: Left Feeling Unwelcome Despite the Good Food | TEXT: Here‚Äôs a polished version that includes your new points and flows naturally in the review:  ---  Visited this restaurant with my husband for date night, but unfortunately our experience was disappointing. Right at the start, the waitress made a rude comment about my husband ordering tap water, which already set the wrong tone.  After ordering our drinks, we were told to grab salad from the salad bar. I wasn‚Äôt even halfway through my salad when, within about six minutes, they brought around six different types of meat. Everything felt extremely rushed, to the point where I had to turn my ticket to ‚Äúno‚Äù because it was all coming too fast. I‚Äôve been to Brazil, and even there the service is never this hurried.  My husband didn‚Äôt take any salad, so he was only eating meat. After about 45 minutes, they took away our plates, making it clear we wouldn‚Äôt receive any more food. The food and drinks themselves were actually good, and if we hadn‚Äôt felt rushed and unwelcome, we would‚Äôve gladly ordered more drinks and even dessert.  They say they want to give you an ‚Äúexperience,‚Äù but unfortunately this was not a good one.

TITLE: Cold food | TEXT: I must give up coming to this location!  They take the order so far from the pay window, approx 40+ cars in line.  By the time I get my hamburger it is COLD!  I have mentioned to order takers, no response from them.  If only, they would take orders when maybe 10 cars ahead! I give up!

TITLE: My favorite wings | TEXT: We‚Äôve never eaten in the restaurant , normally we get our food to go. We were seated quickly and there seemed to be plenty of help. They took our drink order and then our order. Our food came out reasonably quick considering how busy they were. We were there Saturday early evening, all college football on all the screens. All in all I would definitely come back again. If there‚Äôs a drawback for me is how noisy it is, but I anticipated this and I‚Äôm not dinging the place for this.

TITLE: Average stay | TEXT: Stayed here in 2005. Check in was ok. Room was ok with a kitchenette. Some cultery within the drawers needed clean, we didn't use them, Bought plastic forks from local shop. The pool area is lovely, although very busy in the evenings, i think they allow locals to use the pool, hard to find an empty sun lounger. The hotel is pretty much located next to the beach, which was nice if you wanted a change from the noise of the pool area. We didn't eat at the hotel, either ate out or made our own food in room.   Manta Rota is a very very quiet area in the algarve. Manta Rota is also a very small, quiet area. Not much to do. We spent most of our time further up the road in Monte Gordio, it's more liver with better selection of restaurants to choose from. Manta Rota is fine if your looking to sit and read a book all week. It was not the place that was sold to us, we were in mid tewnties, averge age was about 60 years!

TITLE: A "Must See" Museum! | TEXT: The National Museum of Wildlife Art is located about 10 mins. outside of Jackson Spectacular monumental bronze sculptures are located thru out the museums outdoor campus, not to mention incredible views of the valley. Inside, a fabulous collections of paintings & sculptures  from the 1800's - present day and a really good Cafe' for lunch, snacks or just a few moments to sit. This museum's not to be missed.

TITLE: Burger, Shakes and the Delta. | TEXT: I think everyone in Stockton has to know that if you are coming back from a long day on the Water, you gotta refuel and finish off your Day over at Bob's Marina. You can get a massive burger for a pretty decent price as well as a pretty nice shake (best flavor is chocolate). Idk what else to say, this place is iconic for any Delta goer. Make sure you are hungry before heading over.

TITLE: ANOTHER GREAT MEAL | TEXT: Another year,another visit,my wife and I and two friends,visited tonight,we were shown to our pre booked table by Mehmet,we had a great view of the harbour and village,we had free homemade bread and a dip to start,followed by chicken in bacon sauce and chicken & salmon in almond sauce,which is exactly what we had last year,and as last year,both were excellent as was the service. Maybe the best meal so far!
TITLE: This is not good food | TEXT: The quality and taste of the food on the buffet is sub-par.  This probably explains why the place is virtually empty even at prime dining hours.

TITLE: Excellent food and Service | TEXT: Friends found this gem.   They raved about the food and service.   We went back with them the next day.   I ordered a BLT  and Hubs  ordered a chicken wrap both were excellent.  My BLT was actually  a stack of crispy bacon on toast with lettuce and tomato.    Not the usual lettuce and tomato bed with 2 strips of bacon.   Best BLT I‚Äôve ever had offered for $7.   Or $ 10 with a side    Cheesecake for desert   Owner makes all the food  from scratch.  The cheesecake was heavenly.  The texture was a cross of cheese cake and mousse.veer light and creamy.  The owner came out and greeted us.    Will definitely return.

TITLE: Beautiful Elegant Yet Fun Ambiance | TEXT: I had dinner here tonight and give this place 5 stars due to the attentiveness and ambience. The decor, including a huge fish tank with a submarine inside catches your eye right away. Steak was amazing, and the staff gave me a surprise dessert when I told them I was celebrating a milestone accomplishment with work. They also promptly called me just as I was leaving the parking lot to inform me of an item left behind (at first I wondered how they even knew my number but figure they got it off of OpenDoor). Highly recommend this place and would definitely visit again.

TITLE: Funny quotes great service | TEXT: This is a quirky restaurant with funny quotes.  You will want to look up the quotes online.   We went for a weekend lunch and got a table quickly.   The service is prompt and the chips and salsa was good with the a nice heat to the salsa.   We ordered a couple dishes.  One of the dishes was switched with another diner so it had bacon in it.  The wait staff recognized on their own that they had made an error and apologized profusely and offered to it right by bringing out the dish made without the bacon.  It is rare to have that caring and hospitality any more in casual dining.   I was super impressed and would recommend this restaurant without hesitation.  The food itself was very good.  And, yes their quotes on the walls and boards are funny.

TITLE: Learning at the Warren G. Harding Presidential Sites | TEXT: Great trip. We arrived at approximately 9:30 am and made our way towards the entrance of the museum. After paying the admission fee, we received a quick overview of the site and went on our way. We opted to view some of the outdoor exhibits first, which included the guard house and press house. The press house contained multiple informational plaques about President Hardings wife and her contributions to society. After viewing the press house, we made our way to the front porch of the house, where we waited for the 10 am guided hour tour to begin. There were guided tours of the presidents former house being held every hour throughout the day. The guided tour of the house was very informational, and the tour guide took us from room to room, while pointing out interesting features and artifacts out for display. The tour guide told us several personal stories related to the Hardings time at the house. The guided tour lasted roughly 1 hour.  After viewing the house, we went back inside to view the main exhibits. We opted to watch a short documentary about President Hardings life and some of the trials and tribulations he faced during his time as President. There were multiple informational plaques out for display, many of them quite text heavy, that went into detail about Hardings upbringing and roots as the owner of a newspaper company in Marion. The plaques also talked about election day, and several of the policy‚Äôs Harding implemented while in office. The last section of the museum dealt with his death and some controversial issues that surrounded his presidency. There were multiple artifacts out for display in the museum, along with short video clips that related to President Harding's time in office.  Tip: I recommend spending 3 hours here if you truly want to see everything.

TITLE: Great place for a party | TEXT: We had the whole restaurant to ourselves for a birthday lunch. All of my guests raved about the food and the service. I had left the food selection up to Louis, the owner, and he chose well - seafood peleau, pork loin tender enough to cut with a fork, and coq au vin, also tender and delicious. The food was plentiful, and also included salad and dessert. Lunch was served hot and on schedule. We brought our own wine and paid a small corkage fee. Louis was great to work with during the planning stage, and always replied quickly to my phone calls, texts and emails. Wonderful experience all around and we will be back. Oh, and the location is very cool, too. You almost feel like you are really in the Caribbean.
TITLE: Cajun authentic experience | TEXT: Great place for lunch, probably for dinner too, also very central, besides the famous French Quarter. One of my good memories from New Orleans.
TITLE: Very nice coffee | TEXT: The best coffee in the city, keep going.. beautiful furniture, nice view. Espresso was quite good, the staff were polite ..

TITLE: Embarrassing Customer Service | TEXT: At about 1:30 this afternoon I visited the store on March Lane with my wife and got a cup of coffee I sat in the lobby for one hour drinking the coffee and I decided to get a refill I went to the register and asked the lady at the register whose name I don‚Äôt know to give me a refill but to my surprise she told me that I was not sitting in the lobby so she told me she couldn‚Äôt give me one I told her a couple of times that I was sitting in the lobby but still she didn‚Äôt believe me she went in and asked a colleague in the back room and the colleague confirmed that I came earlier and I was sitting in the lobby That was very embarrassing A manager came and apologised about what happen I felt so embarrassed that I used to visit that store everyday but not anymore My name is Jihad Basma and my phone number number is 2093199098

TITLE: BEST MEAL SO FAR! | TEXT: My wife and I have been visiting TURUNC for many years,if fact we stayed at the Es for a month 10 yrs ago,but we have not visited the restaurant for a few years,we went tonight,to be met by Mehmet,who was there 10 yrs ago, We booked a table the night before,tonight we a free starter of homemade bread and an olive oil dip,followed by chicken in bacon sauce and chicken with salmon & almond,both meals were excellent as was the service and great views and good value for money,we both said the best meal of our month long stay,we will be back

TITLE: Wonderful dining experience | TEXT: Great experience from ambience to service and food. Visited with friends and loved all of our selections: Tuna Cannoli, Halibut, Steak, and Bone Marrow. Our drinks were mixed perfectly and table service was impeccable.

TITLE: Delicious brunch & friendly vibes! | TEXT: Everything was delicious, fresh, and exquisitely presented, and I had the best breakfast here. From the minute we arrived, the personnel made us feel very welcome and very nice. Beautiful interior decor, ideal for unwinding before a full day of city exploration. I'm eager to return and would highly recommend!

TITLE: Phenomenal flavors! | TEXT: Phenomenal flavors! My husband and I always enjoy experiencing different restaurants when we travel and this was our favorite food of the trip by far. Flavors were complex & interesting while remaining balanced - I had so much fun tasting every bite of the meal. Highly recommend!

TITLE: Clam chowder not what you'd expect | TEXT: Clam chowder was a red based chowder kind of a hot spicy stew. Not what we expected clam chowder to be  Food was good but expensive and small. Also service was slow.  Waitress was distracted just a few waitresses for a crowd. It's not a very big place. Probably only a dozen tables if you don't eat outside.   Try the palm fish camp about a mile away. It's excellent.

TITLE: Fantastic Restaurant for Dine-In or Catering | TEXT: We hired Verdes Restaurant for catering at our recent event and were absolutely blown away! The food was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented ‚Äî every guest raved about it. The service was just as impressive: professional, organized, and so easy to work with. They made the entire experience stress-free and elevated our event in every way. If you're looking for top-tier catering with unforgettable food and seamless service, Verdes is the way to go! Highly recommended.

TITLE: Great food and service! | TEXT: Good food and service.  We visited during the non peak time between lunch & dinner which can sometimes not be a good thing but the service was spot on and food was delicious.  My husband and I both had the Fajita burrito.  I even asked for some alterations to mine. Perfect!

TITLE: Great service with a lovely view | TEXT: ES is a very friendly restaurant with great service, delicious food and a lovely view of the harbour in Turunc. There is a nice selection of local and western dishes to choose from and the steaks are very good. Highly recommended.
TITLE: Good stuff | TEXT: Best curry in the country , authentic, homemade curry. Absolutely the most friendly staff you can meet. Worth it‚Äôs weight in gold this place

TITLE: The worst anniversary in history | TEXT: We arrived on time, perhaps slightly early for our reservation and were aggressively and very inhospitably treated by the 3 Three hostesses that were clearly not busy and more importantly not at all interested in us having a wonderful anniversary.  We waited over an hour at the bar and lounge and were given NO attention or updates whatsoever.  I have never been treated in such an inhumane fashion, the very worst I have ever undergone in my 35 years of dining at Miami's hottest/trendiest establishments.  Such a sad, sad, very sad end to what should have been a wonderful evening.

TITLE: A good afternoon‚Äôs bottle of wine!! | TEXT: We spent a good afternoon drinking a bottle of house white wine in Stockton‚Äôs only Mexican restaurant and bar in central California in America on our drive from Los Angeles to San Francisco. A good bottle of wine, ok atmosphere and cleanish lavatories.

TITLE: Huge disappointment | TEXT: Went here with dogs.  Sat at outdoor patio service was fine but food not.  One of the recommended dishes was biscuits and gravy.  Did not finish and return to kitchen.  Got chicken and waffles.  Not much of improvement.  Wife got Benedict and not good at all.  Don't understand how this place is at top hotel and subpar food.  But I see many reviews below average

TITLE: Rooftop nights | TEXT: My first time here, i was invited at the rooftop for the Motown nights every Thursday. Very good, decent and behaved crowds.  Opens 7-10.  Definitely for someone who is a Motown music fan.  We danced the night away.  Drinks are priced reasonably.  One big bonus is the very, very nice sunset view.  Gets really really busy by 8:30. This placed has started putting Stockton on the map again.  Downtown has been so sleepy in the past few years.  I hope this will go on and on. Four stars for I saw some little kids in this very adult venue.

TITLE: You just need to go! | TEXT: When I tell you that the food in this place, and the service, are top-tier and impeccable, I state that with no exaggeration. You have got to go to this restaurant! The standouts for me were definitely the rabbit and the apricot and raspberry tart topped with lemongrass ice cream. Words cannot express the delectable meal you will experience!

TITLE: Hospitality and seafood excellence | TEXT: For a special occasion dinner, this restaurant and staff exceeded my expectations. We went mid week, counter seating. Staff attentive and provided nice little extras like a hook for my handbag, a lobby coat rack, warm, wet hand towels. Chef owner Hiro himself cooked and served. We indulged in a paired sake tasting with the meal and it was educational and tasty. The food was excellent, seafood melt in your mouth, and quite varied for late winter, some sourced from Japan. Hiro provided context for each course, how it related to the overall theme of the meal. The atmosphere was easygoing, organized, courses timed nicely, I could not have asked for a better dining experience.

TITLE: Blessing in disguise! | TEXT: My husband called and made a reservation at Bella Vista to celebrate my birthday.  When we arrived at the restaurant, it was closed for a private party!!!  Seems to me the restaurant needs to do better training.  Needless to say, we were not really excited to eat there after reading Yelp reviews online.

TITLE: Avoid this place | TEXT: I visited Nusr-Et in Istanbul and had an excellent experience, so I was expecting something similar from this branch ‚Äî but it fell far short. The service was very poor, and the meal was wildly overpriced.  The staff lacked professionalism and attention, which made the entire experience disappointing. Management should seriously address the service quality.  Overall, I felt scammed. Not recommended at all. Avoid this place.

TITLE: Brunch by the Park... | TEXT: TY, TY, TY!!!!!  For being awesome, being opened and being SO TASTY!!!!!  Hubby and I had some business Downtown and we were looking for an awesome brunch spot!!!  OH MY GOODNESS, the Bergen Benedict and Creme Brule  French Toast were FABULOUS with lattes!!!  Simply the TASTIEST!!!!! <3
TITLE: Awesome front desk | TEXT: The staff at front desk is outstanding. Especially Tatiana, and her associate. They adjusted our 3rd party booking like true professionals.

TITLE: Great Food; Extremely Hot!! | TEXT: I love Jamaican food and so we went to their new location in Stockton on Pershing.  The Jerk Chicken was so good but unfortunately it was also unbearably hot.  I know Scotch Bonnet peppers will take your head off and I wish they could make a more moderate version of Jerk Chicken without so much heat.  I really want to eat this dish but neither I nor my husband can stand how hot it was.  My husband is a real champion when it comes to eating hot food; he's not wimpy like me.  He says he can't eat that dish again either.  I hope the owner will read this review.

TITLE: Great service with a lovely view | TEXT: ES is a very friendly restaurant with great service, delicious food and a lovely view of the harbour in Turunc. There is a nice selection of local and western dishes to choose from and the steaks are very good. Highly recommended.

TITLE: Deserving 3 Michelin Stars*** | TEXT: Wow! This was the best tasting menu of our lives and we have traveled all around the world. We have been to places with more courses and more creative presentations. However, ranking purely on taste, Friday, Saturday, Sunday is our new number one. Every dish was scrumptious and the service was first rate! We loved the chef‚Äôs use of textures with complex flavors and just the right amount of crunch. We can‚Äôt wait to come back with other friends and family!

TITLE: Great Value | TEXT: Not in the best area of town, but the food was authentic. Been eating Mexican food since I was born and I know and appreciate authentic tasting food. The enchilada sauce was so good, I ordered a small cup of it and poured it over my beans and rice too! The chips were fresh from that day and the salsa had just the right amount of heat for my tastes. I would recmmend this to anyone.

TITLE: Unforgettable | TEXT: First time to New Orleans, and chef mentor and foodie Sensei insisted i go to Commander's Palace...he was not wrong, great ambiance, amazing service, although in New Orleans...southern hospitality is alive and well!. My server Joe from Honduras with his team Travis and Gwen, served me and treated me like a southern gentleman. Had the turtle soup and gumbo, perfect flavors and so rich. Had a braised short rib Appetizer on a fried pork skin with cream/sauce...perfect bite to prepare my pallet for my main. Pecan Crusted Fish with crab and finished with their infamous bread pudding souffl√©. I was on cloud 9. food was amazing, wanted to lick my plate. I'll Always make time to visit Commanders Palace when i visit Louisiana in the future. hats off to the chef. Exquisite experience.

TITLE: The most popular burger on the West Coast | TEXT: In-N-Out Burger is to San Francisco and the West Coast what White Castle is to Chicago and the Midwest. It has been serving quality burgers, fries and shakes since 1948, when it established the first drive-through hamburger stand in California, in Baldwin Park, a Los Angeles suburb. Since then, In-N-Out Burger has opened 424 locations in nine western states. I stopped for lunch at the In-N-Out Burger location at 333 Jefferson Street in the Fisherman's Wharf and North Beach/Telegraph Hill neighborhoods. Open from 10:30 to 1 a.m. Sunday through Thursday and 10:30 to 1:30 a.m. on Friday and Saturday, it offers two versions of its signature burger that has satisfied customers for over 75 years. I ordered a double meat burger, two pure beef patties with lettuce, tomato and onions stacked high on a freshly baked bun and a double-double with two cheese slices, two beef patties, lettuce, tomato, onions and house spread on a toasted bun. With French fries and a chocolate milk shake.and

TITLE: Crowded, super noisy and garlicky | TEXT: They pack the restaurant with so many people one can hardly breathe in there. Food is very good but terribly garlicky. They also charge a lot for each mini plate they offer‚Ä¶ using the tapas system they get you into ordering many overpriced small garlic bombs. All in all we do not go back although we live nearby as the hassle of being jammed into the noise restaurant is not worth the food.

TITLE: Great food and service!! | TEXT: This place is a hidden gem and I can‚Äôt understand why it‚Äôs not packed!!!  Conch Fritters, smoked fish dip, red shrimp, shrimp po boy were all amazing!!!  Service is great!  Nice laid back place with amazing food!!!

TITLE: Fabulous experience | TEXT: It was a fantastic experience. I actually ordered my meal off the neighboring table because The presentation of the food was unbelievable. And our waitress oh my gosh she was fantastic. What a great friendly atmosphere. Can‚Äôt wait to go back again. In fact I‚Äôm sitting here writing this as we plan to run down there just to eat at the uptown kitchen!!!

TITLE: Worth the visit!!! | TEXT: I was very impressed with the Warren G. Harding Presidential Sites.  We took the tour of his house, and listened first hand from the tour guides all about when Harding gave speeches on the "front porch".  The house is stunning and is 90+ percent original from years ago when Warren and his wife Florence lived in the house.  The tour guides can answer any questions you have off the top of their heads.  The  Library & Museum was finished in the spring of 2021 and they have a nice gift shop in there too.  They spared no expense in the construction of the building - it is beautiful!!!!  If you are a history buff, this is a must do.

TITLE: Good good | TEXT: This was a pretty cool restaurant with an authentic feel! My grilled chicken was okay, I needed extra sauce to enhance the flavor though. My friend had the jerk chicken and she said it was delicious. Our waitress/bartender was really nice and helpful. The location is spacious and I loved the decor as well. The strip mall means plenty of open parking! I will definitely return!

TITLE: From Unforgettable to Just Fine‚ÄîA Bittersweet Return to Zahav | TEXT: Our second visit to Zahav was highly anticipated, as our first experience two years ago was nothing short of extraordinary. Two years ago, we were blown away--not just by the incredible food but also by the warmth of the experience, with Executive Sous Chef at that time, Joe Howard, personally bringing out a few dishes he was working on. The sheer amount of food, the flavors, and the hospitality made it one of the most memorable dining experiences of our lives. Naturally, we knew it would be hard to recreate that magic, but we were eager to try. Securing a reservation is no easy feat, but we managed, and while the experience wasn't bad by any means, a few things dampened the excitement. The biggest disappointment was our seating. Instead of being in the vibrant main dining room--where you can see the kitchen in action, the bar buzzing, and the laffa bread being made--we were placed in a separate room on the outskirts. Unfortunately, this space lacked the energy and charm that makes Zahav so special; it felt more like a standard cafeteria, stripping away a big part of what makes the restaurant's atmosphere so unique. The menu had also changed, and we opted for the Tayim menu. While everything was good, it lacked the "wow" factor we had experienced before. In some cases, the descriptions of the dishes were more impressive than the actual flavors. Additionally, while our first visit left us completely full, this time, the meal felt smaller. To be clear, the service was great--attentive, professional, and even including an extra salmon tartar and lovely extra dessert for our birthday. There was no particular fault in any one aspect, but together, the little things added up, making this visit fall short of our high expectations. That said, we're still giving five stars, with the hope that Zahav will return to the unforgettable experience it once was.

TITLE: Reminiscing about German food | TEXT: We were told about this restaurant by friends. We were disappointed in little ways. Husband thought his cordon bleu was a little small. And possibly from a frozen food box. The salad was good and so was the red cabbage. My sauerkraut with mushrooms was not as tasty as I thought it should be. I thought there should be some pork flavor in it to tone it down. My fish fillet was breaded and crispy. I didn‚Äôt expect it to be breaded. The fish was good in itself. The staff were were very nice. It was crowded for a Sunday afternoon. I expected to reminisce to an Old town German quiet place with old German music quietly in the background. This place is youthful and lively!  The beer looked good!  We will continue looking elsewhere.

TITLE: Wet Behind the Bear's Ears | TEXT: Week long educational outing with a small group that was really educational and fun.  Seeing Bear's Ears National Monument for the first time was breathtaking.  The depth of knowledge from the scholars and coordinators on the excursion was very helpful.  Our native cultures are still alive and well and we all should explore while we have the opportunity.  Crow Canyon respects our Native American lands and wants to preserve and share with everyone.

TITLE: Busy, delicious to-go options in the heart of downtown Philly | TEXT: Crowded and bustling, between the tight fits amid the narrow aisles, you can find some amazing greasy-spoon lunch options frequented by tourists and locals alike.  There are several great options for cheesesteak and various Asian fare.  Best to get anything to-go, though, because tables are hard to come by and packed in tightly together where they do exist.

TITLE: Delicious food, great service and comfortable atmosphere | TEXT: We had an excellent dining experience and were well looked after from the moment we arrived. The food was delicious at a reasonable price. The atmosphere was relaxed and enjoyable

TITLE: Mostly very good | TEXT: Our tasting menu dinner was very good, everything that was erved was sublime except the beef course and the dessert. The beef wasn't an especially tender cut, and the dessert tangerine sorbet had a rather bland flavor.  But I would defineatly go again, for a special occasion. The cocktails were really really good.

TITLE: Great Experience | TEXT: The food was great.  We sat outside and they had the fire pit going, which set off a nice ambience.  And our server Greg was very attentive and recommended the crab stuff Cod, I‚Äôm glad he did because it was excellent.
TITLE: Worth a try | TEXT: Food was generally OK, but nothing special.  Overpriced and oversalted. Since it has a bar,and there are very few in town, it was worth a try

TITLE: Popped-in for lunch and a couple "Huge" beers.... | TEXT: Stopped on Bourbon St. (not my favorite locale) at Cornet.  Had the Chicken Alfredo pasta dish, superb!  But the better surprise was meeting the bartendress, Miss Nina.  What a treasure!  Has lived around the US (although originally from NOLA) and returned here.  The food was exceptional, the locals nice, and Miss Nina wonderful.  This is on my stop-list whenever I'm in NOLA now...

TITLE: It was walking into a ToysRus store | TEXT: I had read many reviews online and asked staff at my hotel all the food market. It was a 10-15 walk from my hotel and walking to the Reading Terminal Market was like walking into a toy store and not knowing what toy you want buy first.  There was so much  choices  of food available.  After walking round the market for around 10 minutes looking to see what I fancied I eventually chose a vender and had my first Philly cheesesteak.  Delicious, will defo go back again before I leave. Must do place for a visit.

TITLE: Dinner with Marty | TEXT: What a beautiful place here they got in Portland. Me and Marty had such a fun time when we stopped in to town. We always wanted to come up here for the view but holy cow everything was perfect. Mitchel the bartender was so sweet and knew every question we asked like a pro. The Lobster was so big! 10/10

TITLE: First Time Couldn't have Been Better! | TEXT: Our and our friends first time at Commander's Palace!  Service was amazing... a coordinated team effort lead by our waiter.  Food was also amazing with all 8 of us more than happy with every course leading to deserts that just blew us away.  Finally, a manager (one of the family) , who had been making sure we were enjoying our meal, invited us to see the open kitchen and wine cellar, topping off an amazing evening!
TITLE: Great Service | TEXT: Wanted try new place & enjoyed my meal here. Had spicy tuna & it was D-lish!! Edamame was perfect & beer was cold. Will return.

TITLE: ok | TEXT: last-minute choice for lunch. I had a turkey club, no cheese no sprouts. Oddly it was served with tortilla chips and salsa. The sandwich was actually quite good and I enjoyed it. Hubby had the grilled pork chop with mashed potatoes and roasted beets. They were also.

TITLE: Just right | TEXT: This vegetarian food actually tastes like something. The chili was excellent, with lots of fresh ingredients that worked well together. The two other dinners were quite good as well. This place is relaxed and unpretentious.

TITLE: Very Nice Dinner Place on SE Milwaukie Ave | TEXT: We have driven by this place numerous times including during the summer time where the outside patio is packed with people and always wondered what the attraction was. We finally stopped in for dinner recently and we were pleasantly surprised.   The interior seemed somewhat small but inviting and very nicely laid out. We were warmly greeted and promptly seated. We ordered some food items recommended by the waitress which was the fish and chips and the hand cut pasta with wild boar meat. Both items were very tasty with the fish and chips being some of the best I have had in the Portland area. We also ordered a desert that was a mint cheesecake with chocolate chips which was very tasty.   Between the great service and food, we will be back.

TITLE: An interesting little museum with Spitfire simulator more suited to teens and adults | TEXT: Before we visited I rang up to check the Spitfire simulator would be a suitable activity for our 4 grandchildren who were visiting us during Half Term. I explained that the youngest is only 8 (they recommend 9) but is almost 9 and is quite tall (to reach the pedals) The person I spoke to was friendly and helpful and reassured me it would be fine but suggested we book a 1 hour session which we did. This cost ¬£70 which I thought was reasonable value for 4 of them to have a try.   On arriving at the centre, the person at the front desk was very helpful and suggested that we could park one of our cars for free in the drive at the side as they only had one staff car parked there that day. We parked the other one (as we had 4 children with us) in the  Pay car park at the other side.   The centre itself is small but with some interesting exhibits. There is also a video which they can put on and that is very informative about the role of the ADA during the war. And there‚Äôs a dressing up section which amused the children who weren‚Äôt on the simulator and which kept them out of the way as I was a bit concerned that the guy supervising  (Richard) was slightly flustered by the number of them!! He said quite sharply that he needed to know this in advance and I explained that I had called to check that would be ok.  In the event they did all have the opportunity to operate the simulator, to loop the loop, do a barrel role and land the plane. And they all said they enjoyed it but said later that they didn‚Äôt really feel they were doing it themselves as Richard had his hands on the controls at all times‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..possibly in case they crashed it??!! And I don‚Äôt think he took to our youngest grandson who went last and was definitely over-confident which possibly annoyed Richard.  All in all, I think it‚Äôs probably more suited to older children or adults who may have had more experience with video games than ours have.  Our oldest grandson (at nearly 12) was the one who found it most interesting. The youngest was actually the most enthusiastic but was a bit too boisterous for Richard‚Äôs liking!! I also think that if I had been in charge I would probably have structured it differently. I think he could have explained the more general rules to all of them at the start and then allowed each of them to have a turn. Instead he went through with each individually which took more time and therefore reduced the time available for the flying.

TITLE: Amazing small plates | TEXT: We visited for the second time.  I am a pretty picky eater and more of a traditionalist in terms of my food.  Last time I was a little more experimental but this time I did the cheeseburger (a new add to their menu) and frittes.  We also did the grilled little gems (a lettuce).  That burger was amazing!  It's not big and not loaded with stuff on top.  But it's the right size to allow you to sample other things and is one of my top favorite burgers in town!  The frittes are crisp, thin, salty - perfect.  The gems were very good.  My husband had the Culottes which was excellent.  He also had the trout which he said was great (I'm not a fish person).    The previous trip we tried dessert and were not impressed.  Nothing enticed this time either.  But I see online they have a strawberry dish and considering and hoping they may use hood strawberries it may be worth trying!  We will be back - a new neighborhood favorite for us!

TITLE: Good location and friendly staff‚Ä¶. | TEXT: This hotel is in a good location, a short walk to Bayswater tube station. It‚Äôs a safe location for a solo traveller. The  staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful. The single room was very cramped and the bathroom was so small it was almost impossible to use. Eventually I gave up on the shower, as, even for a normal sized person, it was a struggle to manoeuvre in and out. The breakfast room which I tried  only  once, was small and cramped as were the hallways and passageways. There‚Äôs a good cafe just around the corner. Some rooms may be bigger, so might be worth checking those out.

TITLE: Still A Star | TEXT: Over 7 years since my last visit and this wonderful restaurant still does not disappoint. All the elements  - service, ambiance, meal - were harmoniously excellent. In particular, my filet and chocolate souffl√© were both amongst the best I have ever had. This is now my official  "Go To" in San Francisco.

TITLE: Fantastic | TEXT: We have been here a few times and the food is amazing, and cooked fresh. The  staff is very friendly and you get great service. We would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone.

TITLE: Not Worthy of Michelin Star | TEXT: I have long since disregarded Michelin ratings as reliable indicators of quality restaurants.  Such is the case of Artiete which has been awarded 1 star for multiple years although totally undeserving in my opinion.  Wife and I arrived 6:15pm last Saturday night and requested one of the many empty outside tables.  We were told they were all pre-reserved and were ushered to a table in the darkest area of the restaurant that already resembles a dungeon.  The hostess begrudgingly moved us to a more acceptable table.  As others have noted, the background music, which included Latin Rap, was oppressively loud.  We ordered the grouper and snapper dishes and both lacked taste and were otherwise undistinguishable. When the server asked our likings for dessert, I ordered flan and coffee.  The server indicated the coffee machine was broken and coffee was not available.  In over 70 years of restaurant dining, I never experienced a restaurant not being able to serve coffee.  So we left unfulfilled noting the outside tables were still vacant 1 1/2 hours after we first arrived.  $24 cocktails and limited expensive parking are further reasons one should patronize alternative restaurants.

TITLE: A++ Korean Restaurant | TEXT: Toro is a family owned restaurant that serve many delicious Korean dishes; in addition to Sushi and other popular Asian dishes. The food and service is always good, and reasonable priced. I highly recommend going there for lunch / dinner.

TITLE: It was a fantastic experience, and I will be coming back. | TEXT: It was my family's first visit, and we were thrilled to find Uptown Kitchen after returning from our holiday trip and searching for a brunch spot. The service and hospitality were outstanding‚ÄîLancy, our server and several managers, warmly greeted our table. The food was exceptional; every dish was delicious and arrived in a timely manner. We experienced a brief wait of less than 10 minutes for our party of seven, but that just showed how popular the place is! I highly recommend Uptown Kitchen and am already planning my next visit.

TITLE: Awful Stay and Hotel in Poor Condition | TEXT: DO NOT STAY AT THIS COMFORT INN! First it‚Äôs deceptive to say it‚Äôs at Main Gate at Ft Jackson (exit 12) when it‚Äôs several miles away st Exit 9. This hotel is old and dated and carpets are extremely dirty, paint issues everywhere and deferred maintenance. We checked in and had to be moved 3 times due to room issues. Room 200 had a leak in the ceiling with water dripping on floor and plaster falling from the season! While they are in the process of updating rooms on the first floor it still has major issues and not a Comfort Inn expectation. We also had someone outside our room in the parking lot from 9pm- 1am with car stereo playing loud and thumping while they smoked pot. No security and didn‚Äôt feel safe. Other options like Springhill Suites or Holiday Inn Express was priced the same and would have been better options. We would have checked out and moved but had a Nonrefundable reservation! This property needs to be closed and reopened when totally remodeled!

TITLE: Portland City Grill Delivers | TEXT: Best dining experience ever!  We wet for dinner and had the seafood tower, it was so good.  If you ever visit Portland, the City Grill is where you need to go!

TITLE: Slice of Germany in Stockton? | TEXT: We were in the area for the day and delighted to find this German restaurant for dinner. I'm not super familiar with German food, but we thought the schnitzel, sausage, and potato pancakes were especially tasty. Great beer on tap, too, and they let you sample for free. We had so much fun. Highly recommend!
TITLE: Joyful | TEXT: Quick service and anticipation. I really loved being served in the mornings by Luis Balboa. In the Devon day he already knew what I wanted

TITLE: Don‚Äôt Miss this Indoor Outdoor Museum on the Hill! | TEXT: Most of our itenerary for Jackson was outdoors, but we kept passing the hillside with the museum‚Äôs quartzite walls cutting into the slope and drove up. I love sculpture and have a minor in art, so the sculpture trail hooked me and also brought me inside. The placement of each animal across from the Elk Refuge is so perfect and acts like a canvas in complimenting each sculpture. I especially loved ‚ÄúGreat Northern‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe Emperor‚Äù on the walk. We had a delicious lunch at the museum then enjoyed the interior art. ‚ÄúChief‚Äù was magnificent. The museum is first class!

TITLE: A Stockton tradition‚Ä¶ | TEXT: It‚Äôs nice after having been away for over a decade to eat at one of Stockton‚Äôs most reliable Mexican restaurants: Cancun.  Very friendly and fast-moving staff with all the classic, tasty fare.  I got the chicken enchiladas.  Fun, open space a short walk from most downtown places of importance.  Support this legend of downtown!

TITLE: Visited twice, that‚Äôs enough, too busy for a relaxing time | TEXT: Nice spot, parking close by, reservations needed for dinner, show. Dinner pricey for what is served. Nice atmosphere. Seafood disappointing. Oxtail, Mac n cheese good, cornbread very good. Wait staff good but busy. Music a bit too loud, seated in back but still loud.

TITLE: Wonderful oysters and patio scene | TEXT: Visited last weekend, sat outside on the patio and enjoyed a cocktail, oysters and pizza. It was delightful, the staff was attentive and the people watching was perfect. Best oysters I‚Äôve had outside of dining in Maine!

TITLE: Fantastic Asian cuisine | TEXT: Benu was fabulous. I had rarely visited a fine dining Asian restaurant but all the food here was genuinely faultless. From a plump sea urchin starter to a delicious fish dish to delicate desserts, the kitchen clearly knows how to create elegant and flavourful dishes. This was one of the best Michelin starred restaurants I've been to. The restaurant is led by Corey Lee, who for a long time was the head chef at Thomas Keller's 3 Michelin-starred restaurant, 'The French Laundry' in Yountville.

TITLE: Week long travel with Crow Canyon in Southwest | TEXT: I have travelled with Crow Canyon more than 8 times; mostly in the Southwest. I would label this travel adventure travel.  You are in a small group with at least two scholars, one an archeologist and one a related field.    I have learned so much and had access to so many archeological sites I would not otherwise be allowed to visit.  The trip leaders are full time employees who are very professional and experienced.  These trips are unique learning experiences.  Additionally, I have developed many lasting friendships with other persons I have met on the trips....we all share common interests  which adds to our own experiences.

TITLE: Nothing amazing, but it was a good place to stop. | TEXT: I got the shrimp caesar salad which was pretty tasty. The prices were extremely reasonable too. The restaurant was really busy and there was only 2 servers. It took forever to get our food. I may go back when they're not so busy.
TITLE: Amazing Greek Cuisine | TEXT: Yasoo Yani has a great menu - the Gyros salad is the bomb and the pita bread is so fresh and delicious!!

TITLE: Amazing food great service. | TEXT: What an amazing food. Authentic without any compromise. The Tacos are a must, we ordered a second portion and the Mai‚Äôs with wild crab is simply the best dish I had in a long time. This combined with an amazing service made this the best dinner during our trip in Miami. Thank you

TITLE: The Best | TEXT: This restaurant never fails to delight. Service is high quality. Food is fresh and tasty. Love the charm of the place. I take all our visitors there and everyone, family, friends, etc love it and ask to go again!

TITLE: Wet Behind the Bear's Ears | TEXT: Week long educational outing with a small group that was really educational and fun.  Seeing Bear's Ears National Monument for the first time was breathtaking.  The depth of knowledge from the scholars and coordinators on the excursion was very helpful.  Our native cultures are still alive and well and we all should explore while we have the opportunity.  Crow Canyon respects our Native American lands and wants to preserve and share with everyone.

TITLE: Exceptional! | TEXT: Beautiful setting after dark with twinkly lights, candles and Christmas tree.  Cozy and warm when it was blustery outside.  Great staff.  I can always tell a good menu when there are a few things I really want and can't make up my mind.    Deviled eggs with smoked salmon were a little meh, but the potato croquettes were heavenly.   Two of our group settled on the happy hour burger with a salad, both were flavorful and delicious, two others had steak frites with a drizzly of chimichurri sauce, also delicious.    Good cocktails.  This was our second time and it was every bit as good as the first, just a different (and special) experience eating inside.  Great place for a romantic date.  Street parking.

TITLE: Wouldn‚Äôt recommend | TEXT: I went to FARE with my sisters for the first time ; I was excited to try the food ! The customer service was TRASH and the food wasn‚Äôt that good either ! We literally waited for the check for 20mins . The server was really rude ! I had to say it twice

TITLE: Left in 30 minutes | TEXT: VERY loud with tables literally about 4-6 inches apart.  You could hear everything neighboring tables were saying but very little of your partner's comments.  I like a dry white wine with Mediterranean food but none available (excluding two bubbly options). Only one vodka brand available so you are limited to cocktails (mainly rum) or beer. While we left in about 30 minutes, flat bread pizza was overcooked by had good flavors and the octopus was tough but again, had a nice flavor.  Big crowd so appears popular, but we will not go back - too many other great options out there.

TITLE: Customer service at its best! | TEXT: Truly a historic gem (circa 1925) restored to modern day convenience. Good amenities in a great location.   Perhaps the best part was my experience at breakfast this morning. The standard Holiday Inn Express offerings were very well prepared (e.g., perfectly moist and appealing scrambled eggs) and the attendants distinguished themselves by their continuous checks and attention to detail like wiping up spills. However, the MOST REMARKABLE service I witnessed was when one of the two attendants noticed a guest (walking with a cane) needing assistance as he served his plate from the buffet. She respectfully approached him and offered her help. It was spontaneous kindness and true customer service at its best!  Both my day and my trip were made better by seeing the above (while also enjoying a tasty, filling breakfast)!  I will be back!

TITLE: awesome  motel | TEXT: this place is great  the innkeeper calls if your late   he leaves a bbq with propane full  balcony for smokers kitchenette  is fully stocked so you dont have to go out to dinner we pack dinner and breakfast  great coffee shop downtown and restaurants also  clean and quiet

TITLE: Archeological Research Program (ARP) at Crow Canyon | TEXT: I recently completed my fourth Archeological Research Program (ARP) at Crow Canyon.  The three previous ARP programs I've participated in were all mostly archeological digging.  I wasn't sure what to expect with the site survey program, but it was a great learning experience as the first part of the archeological process.  The week flew by as I was having fun and learning a lot.  The Crow Canyon instructors even slightly changed our itinerary because our group had so many questions about the entire process for site, so we had extra lab time to go over the lab processes.  I would definitely recommend the ARP program or any of the other programs Crow Canyon offers for furthering your adult learning on indigenous history.
TITLE: French room experience | TEXT: A Good experience and Carlos was super friendly and knowledgeable with everything. Def recommend trying this spot. Variety and good service

TITLE: Worth a try | TEXT: We needed a last minute reservation for a larger party and there was not much available in the North End so we decided to try this place on Beacon Hill. It's in a basement so don't be surprised when you arrive. I had the scallops and they were very good.  The rest of my party enjoyed their food as well. While efficient, the staff was not very helpful or friendly.  We asked for a couple of suggestions in regards to the food and did not really receive much input. A bit more of a welcome would have put a much better spin on this place for us.  It's worth a try though as food was good.

TITLE: Best brunch in years | TEXT: The menu was very unique giving the 4 of us the opportunity to try new things and everything was excellent! The flavors just combined to make everything so tasty. Service was good and the total price very reasonable for the quality of the food and the time we were able to spend there as a small group.

TITLE: Very disappointed | TEXT: I‚Äôll start by saying I hate to leave reviews & usually don‚Äôt; so when u do it‚Äôs only when I‚Äôm very impressed or very disappointed. I‚Äôve been here several times & never been disappointed. This time was different unfortunately. My first red flag was when our food came out in less than ten minutes. Fresh food takes longer than that to cook. My partner & I came by for dinner because she wanted the trout salad. Which she seemed to enjoy.  I was in the mood for white fish so I ordered the pan fried Idaho trout piccata, with broccolini & lemon mushroom risotto.  Sadly, the menu said nothing about the trout actually being farm raised steelhead (I hate steelhead) so that was my first disappointment.  Next, the risotto was complete mush. I asked the server to ask the kitchen when it was made. He said it was ‚Äúprepped‚Äù yesterday. Having spent 20! Years in the culinary industry including culinary school I know what that means.   @ lastly, the broccoli was just unseasoned broccoli. Zero salt, pepper, or butter. The server was friendly enough & not rude at all, but when I made my disappointment visually & audibly known, he showed & offered zero in the way of fixing the situation. I did say that will take the remaining 2/3rds of the disappointing meal to go partner would have it at work later,  so I understand that. I despise people who complain just to get free stuff & so that‚Äôs why I try not to leave bad feedback.  I think the biggest disappointment was that from my very first sign of displeasure, there was no offer to fix the situation from beginning to end.  I left the couple stars because the staff were fine. But I won‚Äôt return.

TITLE: Wow, wow, wow | TEXT: Wow, wow, wow.  Fabulous dinner, great service, cool / intimate setting. We were just walking by and stopped in, hadn‚Äôt no idea how great the experience would be. Outstanding meal.

TITLE: Excellent experience for my birthday in Miami | TEXT: Amazing food with the best mac & cheese and potato puree sides I've ever tasted! Location is very beautiful with lots of fairy lights, plants and high rise buildings outside. The staff were attentive, friendly and upbeat. Stylish modern restaurant with great cocktails, I ordered the 'Message from Gordon', The steak was cooked to perfection and we had the best time. Thank you for an amazing birthday experience ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

TITLE: Food Experience for Foodies | TEXT: A dinner absolutely worthy of a Michelin Star. Food was unique, creatively prepared and delicious. The wait staff (primarily Evan) were attentive and friendly. Co-owner Jill visited tables. A lively vibe with a mixed crowd.  Extensive  wine list in addition to curated pairings. The Lion‚Äôs Mane Mushroom was amazing, presented in a thick cut, steak-like format and tasted much the same. I could be a vegetarian after eating it!   For those who previously offered criticism of: Price:  Check out similarly starred restaurants and  you‚Äôll appreciate their price point.  Noise:  Yes it‚Äôs lively but we had absolutely no issues carrying on a conversation and discussing the creative preparations  Included Gratuity:  Really folks??  Where have you been for the past few years?  Who doesn‚Äôt give a 20% gratuity for good service and more for great service? Great job Team Tail Up Goat!!  We will highly recommend to others for a fun and delicious foodie experience in DC.

TITLE: Wonderful spot for memorable sushi! | TEXT: Wait staff not very attentive, ran out of water twice had to ask for more. Was not warned how Spicy the three spicy rolls I ordered were-if there‚Äôs a jalape√±o next to roll be warned it‚Äôs hot, had a hard time finish rolls, food was excellently prepared and fresh! Highly recommend this place for sushi and appetizers were big and unique.

TITLE: Predictable food, not the best service! | TEXT: At the Hard Rock Cafe in New Orleans, the atmosphere is typical of the chain, but the experience was marred by unfriendly service; we only saw our waitress a couple of times. We chose this restaurant specifically for a fresh salad, as options on Bourbon Street tend to lean heavily toward gumbo, jambalaya, and √©touff√©e, which wasn't what we were craving in the heat. Fortunately, the Cobb salad and southwestern bowl were both delicious and hit the spot. Despite the service issues, I would consider visiting again for the food.
