TITLE: We watched a short film at the museum prior to the tour | TEXT: Our guide was Theodore, he did an excellent job sharing his knowledge of Warren Harding and Florence- marriage, campaign and presidency. The tour started on the porch where his Porch Campaign took place. The house furnishings are over 90% original. NO Pictures allowed which is sad for my personal journey ablum. The museum has nice exhibits with a couple audios. Enjoyed watching the pictures taken on the Voyage of Understanding tour to the western states and Alaska. Purchase tickets on-line because we were shocked how the first 3 tours were fully booked. We changed our itinerary to make a late afternoon tour. Large parking lot. Restrooms on site.

TITLE: Quintessential Italian Fine Dining!!!! | TEXT: We have eaten all over the greater Jacksonville area (and far beyond), and this remains our family‚Äôs favorite for good reason‚Ä¶owner Jerry‚Äôs passion for quality translates to a rich, immersive dining experience that you won‚Äôt soon forget.  Dress nicely, bring your favorite people, prepare for exceptional service and cuisine by the best in the business, and let the experience begin!

TITLE: Cozy restaurant near Washington Square. | TEXT: We were in town to celebrate my wife's birthday. We tried this restaurant on a recommendation from my boss. The food was delicious. I had the Branzino and Broccoli, my wife had the Roasted Chicken and Gnocchi. We shared the the Chocolate Pudding cake which was delicious also. My wife really like the bread plates on each table. Each plate was different from the next and look like someone went searching thru some antique shops to pick them out. We ate inside because it was a little to windy to try the patio but it looked really and cozy.

TITLE: Very noisy. not very Japanese | TEXT: The noise level mood to be mentioned first. We practally had to scream to talk to each other.   Service was good with lots of staff. One person, possibly the sushi chef or restaurant owner was Asian. The rest of the staff and the cooking style had a big Mexican influence.  We had a tuna with avocado and jalape√±o roll. Also spicy ramen. I liked it but had indigestion afterwards which is a first for Japanese food. The tempura was very greasy.   I do not recommend his restaurant.

TITLE: Sophisticated, relaxed and quality. | TEXT: What a great night out. The ambience was perfect for us, high end yet relaxed and a bit dressy. The food was superb. We started with the mackerel and asparagus which were both perfectly cooked and delicious, light and fresh. I had the agnolotti and my husband had the Iberian pork. The agnolotti was perfectly al dente and the flavors were fresh,  balanced and very tasty. The pork was flavourful and tender, and the service was wonderful. I rate this an A+. It just all came together for a relaxing Night with wonderful food.

TITLE: Prioritize my bladder!!!! | TEXT: Hello, I regret  to inform you that your staff needs to be engaged in coaching, due to the lack of attention to a female and I needing to use the restrooms after multiple attempts to utilize them. I was ignored by the first female and was given a puzzled look that they can't be opened. After I went around to seek attention from the other staff she rudely stated both bathrooms are not available, after I asked why she said " they just are ". I asked to see what would cause them to be unusable but could only feel discriminated as she added no urgency to the issue. She then asked if I was management to even request to see the inside of the bathrooms. As a LONG TIME CUSTOMER. I suggest to keep your client based loyal to address this issue as it leaves a bad image on the franchise. I left feeling "I didn't have it my way ". And that's just a bowl movement. Thank you for your time and I hope this matter has been addressed the next time I pass by the store as I will try to obtain pictures of the staff reluctant to assist. Best regards, JJ.

TITLE: Worse tasting overpriced chicken parm I ever had in my life | TEXT: I just moved to this town and was dying for a chicken Parm sandwich, and did not feel like going through the trouble of making it myself. Well, I certainly should have because this was the worst tasting chicken Parmesan sandwich I‚Äôve ever had. I asked for extra cheese there was no cheese no sauce and when I first looked at it, I thought they had given me eggplant by mistake. That‚Äôs how thin and burnt the chicken cutlet was. It was literally all bread no meat to thin hockey pucks just terrible and they charged me $16 for it. Very very upset never again will I ever eat here!

TITLE: Spooky entrance reminded me of the Bates Motel. | TEXT: The ONLY motel in town, You must drive through a one lane alley and down a slope to the parking area, then climb metal stairs to access checkin. The room was musty, but otherwise a clean kitchenette. The manager provides Tim Hortons coffee and donuts in the AM.

TITLE: Great ambiance  and food. | TEXT: Had a wonderful time at Cassidy‚Äôs. We ordered off the specials menu ‚Ä¶ ‚ÄúShort ribs over Risotto‚Äù Divine! Tip; Always order off the specials menus as it is always revolving and delicious. The ambiance is classic old Portland with its oak bar, wood floors and wood paneled walls.

TITLE: Another great dining experience. | TEXT: We were able to eat here again pre- cruise after a visit a few years back.   We were seated promptly at a nice table.  Service as before was exceptional as was the food. The portions are huge, so we  shared some appetizers and the veal parmigiana.   Everyone was  very professional and I love the decor.

TITLE: Archeological Research Program (ARP) at Crow Canyon | TEXT: I recently completed my fourth Archeological Research Program (ARP) at Crow Canyon.  The three previous ARP programs I've participated in were all mostly archeological digging.  I wasn't sure what to expect with the site survey program, but it was a great learning experience as the first part of the archeological process.  The week flew by as I was having fun and learning a lot.  The Crow Canyon instructors even slightly changed our itinerary because our group had so many questions about the entire process for site, so we had extra lab time to go over the lab processes.  I would definitely recommend the ARP program or any of the other programs Crow Canyon offers for furthering your adult learning on indigenous history.

TITLE: Pretty restaurant in bishop arts district known more by the locals. | TEXT: This restaurant has a lovely interior decor and large fun patio in a lively area of Dallas, the Bishop Arts District. The place was very pretty for Christmas the holidays. Our server was nice but not super attentive and the food was pretty good not great and not above average. We ate early and it was still very loud in there so if it's a quiet meal you are seeking this place is on the loud side acoutiscally. I would like to go back for a drink on the patio in warmer weather. Lots of photo spots throughout.

TITLE: Exceeded Our High Expectations | TEXT: It's unusual to go to a restaurant with such high expectations, only to have all those expectations exceeded in every way.  That was our experience at Kann.  Service by Chris and his team was impeccable.  Timing of plates was perfect, we were never rushed, the table was kept spotless, everyone was attentive without hovering.  The meal itself was fantastic.  We over ordered so we could try more dishes, and ended up taking a bunch home.  To be honest, I think i enjoyed the appetizers and sides as much as the main courses, but everything was spectacular.  I am gluten and dairy free due to allergies, and I was in heaven, knowing I could order just about anything on the menu and be safe.  Thank you!  We will make another reservation and wait our three months to get in - it was just a perfect, perfect meal in every way.  Oh, and be sure to save room for dessert!

TITLE: Phenomenal flavors! | TEXT: Phenomenal flavors! My husband and I always enjoy experiencing different restaurants when we travel and this was our favorite food of the trip by far. Flavors were complex & interesting while remaining balanced - I had so much fun tasting every bite of the meal. Highly recommend!

TITLE: First rate, highly recommended | TEXT: Highly rated French restaurant, with an exceptionally high quality menu. Prices are reasonable for the excellent quality and service tips are built into the prices you see on the menu.
TITLE: Fine dining excellence | TEXT: Amazing dining experience from the drinks we had to start all the way to the decadent desert... flawless! We can't wait to return.

TITLE: Comfortable Clean Overnight Stop if you are on a car trip | TEXT: Interesting concept for those driving.  self checkin with your car ( but we had help) the garage door opens and also one at your room.  prive into your personal garage and them close the dorr and walk up the stairs to your room.  Its a very nice room with a spa and lovely bed - but no refrigerator :-( .  THey have great room service from a corridor that runs behind all the rooms.  Great if you dont have teh need to go out and walk around.  Its in a commercial area so car is needed to get there and to go out to stretch your legs and explore in any case.  We would stay again but we were only there to sleep and have a bite.
TITLE: Amazing! | TEXT: Excellent service. Amazing food! The servers treated us very well. And explained each course very good. All in all an amazing experience!

TITLE: Exceptional knowledge provided, kindness and a very professional crew. | TEXT: Unforgettable experience. The knowledge shared by sme‚Äôs was invaluable. The world needs Crow Canyon!   The expertise and educational opportunities provided by the center was exceptional. I highly recommend trips with Crow Canyon often.
TITLE: Amazing food | TEXT: Amazing food, quaint and inviting location, and overall one of our best dinners while traveling ever!  We had the special Valentine's Day menu and it did not disappoint!

TITLE: Food was very good but service needs some work | TEXT: When we entry the restaurant no one greeted us or said anything to us. Few minutes later, we were told to follow him. I was not impressed with the service but the food was very good.

TITLE: A tasty Chinese diner in this cosy restaurant. | TEXT: This restaurant is locatedin the main shopping street of Roden. We arrived at about 18 o'clock, there were a number of take away custommers and we were the only guests in the restaurant area. We choose to sit near the window. The friendly waitress showed us the menu and served a good strong green tea and a flavourful jasmin tea. We ordered Prawn crackrs, Fu Yong Hay with large Prawns and Mi Fan with Siu Yok (roasted Pork) and Cha Siew (sweet roasted pork) . The dishes were prepared in the Chinese way and  tasty, as per my Chinese wife. We recommend this restaurant.

TITLE: Birthday Celebration | TEXT: We celebrated my wife‚Äôs 70th birthday.  The staff was very accommodating to the group.  The scenery was very appealing inside and out.  The marina situated just off the patio decking was nice.  The food was outstanding!  Treat yourself to a wonderful meal at the Point!

TITLE: Wonderful Happy Hour at Bellevue! | TEXT: Very elegant setting with welcoming and attentive servers.  The happy hour wine, crispy Brussel sprout medley, Parmesan truffle fries were all delicious!  Background music streaming from Spotify - various artists "Summer Barbeque"  was so much fun families of multiple generations felt compelled to jive along !  Please view the submitted photos that capture the essence of the lovely XIX BAR LOUNGE.
TITLE: Great Service | TEXT: Service was fast & efficient. Food was hot & tortilla  fresh and flavorful. Shrimp salad was fresh & tasty. Beer was ice cold. View was great.

TITLE: ANOTHER GREAT MEAL | TEXT: Another year,another visit,my wife and I and two friends,visited tonight,we were shown to our pre booked table by Mehmet,we had a great view of the harbour and village,we had free homemade bread and a dip to start,followed by chicken in bacon sauce and chicken & salmon in almond sauce,which is exactly what we had last year,and as last year,both were excellent as was the service. Maybe the best meal so far!

TITLE: Pleasant place for drinks and dessert | TEXT: During our stay, we stopped by the XIX lounge for drinks and dessert.  My wife and I were each treated to a generous pour of a good chardonnay, which had just a bit of residual sweetness.  We also shared a portion of the chocolate mousse, which was very satisfying.  Prices are a little on the high side, but that's to be expected when you're in a classy location like the Bellevue.

TITLE: Beyond Great Experience Wilder Philadelphia! | TEXT: 2/26/25 Year End Celebration work lunch in semi-private space upstairs. Exceeded our expectations on all fronts! Food, staff, service, beautiful space. Worked closely with Brett who owns Wilder with his partner Nicole. I let Brett know that is was wonderful and we cannot wait to return for another work event and to bring family and friends.  Thanks for everything Brett!

TITLE: Best roasted potatos ever! | TEXT: Beautiful place. Went for brunch. Food was great although my eggs could have been warmer. Service was good and friendly but as the place filled up‚Äîour reservation was at opening time‚Äîour waitress disappeared. However, really enjoyed it and would visit again.

TITLE: Good food, quite restaurant | TEXT: We went on a Monday night so it wasn't to busy, sat at bar.  Had calamari not bad, could have been cooked longer.  Pork saltimbocca was very good served with spinach.  Bill was $50 without any drinks!
TITLE: Romantic dinner | TEXT: Wonderful dinner and service.  The lamb chops were delicious and the presentation was wonderful. Great wine selection!

TITLE: November Stay | TEXT: Staff were very nice and hotel was very clean. I think the pictures make the rooms look bigger than they truly are- they do say it that rooms are small and cozy- it is truly SMALL AND COZY. Small that 2 people can barely walk at the same time. If you are clear on that you will have a fabulous stay- if you skip over that detail (like me) you may be confused. Aside from the small rooms they do offer a nice breakfast. The hotel is close to everything- trains, food, convenience stores and the casino. It is the perfect location for a visit to Chicago.

TITLE: Unstuffy culinary hotspot | TEXT: We came here for dinner while visiting friends who live in the area, and had a wonderful meal!  The ambiance is upscale and trendy without being stuffy, and it was very clear that this is a culinary hotspot. The staff were professional and friendly - our waitress was very helpful when we were struggling to decide what to order. The crispy duck, salmon satay, tempura cauliflower, and the general tso soup were outstanding! We ended up not leaving anything for leftovers, which doesn't generally happen with us. We'll definitely come back the next time we're in town.

TITLE: If the locals are always here, it‚Äôs got to be good. And it was great! | TEXT: Rustic environment with excellent food and lots of options. We‚Äôve driven by multiple times on our way to Jacksonville and were determined to stop this time. We got there around 11:45am, hoping to beat the rush, which we did. By the time we left, both the parking lot and restaurant were full. It was very obvious that the vast majority of the folks inside were locals. My wife had fried shrimp - about a dozen large shrimp with a very light coating of batter. Excellent! I wanted something not fried and opted for the full pot of the chowder. Also excellent! They say it‚Äôs made fresh daily, and it was. A medium sized pan filled with a tomato based, thick soup with fresh potatoes, celery and large chunks of tuna and diced shrimp. Highly recommend. Also available in a ‚Äúhalf pot‚Äù if you‚Äôre not really hungry. Don‚Äôt drive by - go in and enjoy great food and service.

TITLE: Hard pass, good location | TEXT: Booked 4 nights stayed for 2. Have stayed in various HIE here and in Europe and you know going in the rooms will be smaller, basic but functional and nice. These rooms were small and considering it was renovated not functional at all. There are so many ways to maximize a small space but that was not done here. They were nice to let us see 2 other rooms and choose after our initial room. Good location, Front desk lady helpful and nice.

TITLE: Go for the meal, but stay for the cocktails | TEXT: This was very great restaurant. I had the salmon that was very excellent. I have not had a good piece of salmon in a long time and I was not disappointed. Highlight experience was bartender made me a bourbon cocktail hecwas developing. For those that like manhattans or old fashions, step out of your comfort zone and try a that bourbon pineapple thing. You want be disappointed.

TITLE: Delicious | TEXT: Ordered via doorsash. Everything was delicious.  Empanadas and cubanos were very good. Highly recommended. Check order, ours was shorted a cubano but plenty of food for our family.

TITLE: Splendid Saison | TEXT: What a splendid meal at Saison. An innovative and tasty set menu with many standout dishes and presentation - lobster tartare, uni, white truffle pasta, duck etc. I would probably skip the wagyu supplement next time since i‚Äôm not a fan of wagyu generally   Service top notch and friendly as well  The kitchen tour was a plus  9.5/10

TITLE: Wouldn‚Äôt recommend | TEXT: I went to FARE with my sisters for the first time ; I was excited to try the food ! The customer service was TRASH and the food wasn‚Äôt that good either ! We literally waited for the check for 20mins . The server was really rude ! I had to say it twice
TITLE: Great Breakfast | TEXT: Great breakfast with delicious food. Friendly staff and clearly a local favorite. Nice location on the marina for land and boat access!
TITLE: Coffee with a Scowl | TEXT: I thought it was a Good morning , until my Daughter snd I got the Evil eye and Coffee with a Scowl. Yikes. How about a smile from the Coffee server .

TITLE: Great food Affordable prices | TEXT: The food was delicious. Large portions  and affordable pricing. The employees were super friendly and helpful. I thoroughly enjoyed my meal and would love to eat there again if I am in the area!

TITLE: What a disappointment; they missed the mark on nearly everything. | TEXT: We really wanted to like this place.  We live nearby but have never been.  We made a res for 1:45 (late for brunch). The place was 1/2 empty but we were seated at a table for 2 at a banquette squeezed between 2 noisy groups and very close to the front door which brought in icy air.  I looked at a long expanse of empty tables and asked if we could sit over there and was told no; they were expecting a big party.  Note:  the big party arrived one hour later when we were ready to leave.  Also 2 other couples arrived and were seated in the forbidden zone. Okay that was #1.  Then no wait person showed up for a longish period of time: #2: no water; no welcome.  Menu was okay.  We both ordered a different version of a salad with grilled salmon. Mine included a poached egg. #3 poached egg arrived hard boiled. I asked for a replacement t and they did bring me a softly poached, runny egg.  We waited a ridiculous amount of time for someone to refill our iced tea. #4: food was mediocre.  Edible but no where near the quality anticipated based on the prices.  I do not recommend this place and would not go back.  Plenty of far better places a short walk away.

TITLE: Quiet retreat. | TEXT: Stayed a couple nights. View is very good and the couple of goats and three wadling ducks were happy to say hello in the paddock below. Some yummy local chocolates and apples provided were great. Was very nice to sit outside on table having a few wines and antipasto watching the sun go down. Quite modern open plan style. Bed wasn't the best but ok, probably just me. Host was very unobtrusive but still stuck in fresh provisions for breaky. Nice spot to just chill and short trip to the ferry for Bruny Island.

TITLE: Excellent Tapas Spot | TEXT: Was excited to see this tapas place near our hotel, especially as my colleagues had never tried tapas before. The standards (patatas bravas, pan con tomate, croquettes) were all great. The pork belly was so good we ordered it twice. Would come back again for sure.

TITLE: So-So | TEXT: The resturant was clean and service was good. The breakfast were okay although too much lemon on my avocado toast and my husband's toasts were burnt and eggs undercooked. Another morning our breakfast was amazing. I'm not sure if there are different cooks but quality of food is a bit inconsistent.

TITLE: Holiday Tea was over the top! | TEXT: Carlos and Jitendra were magnificent! The food was delicious. We had the Holiday Tea. Their service was impeccable. Would definitely recommend and plan to come back!!

TITLE: Check your bill | TEXT: I was really disappointed with my recent visit to Sampan on 10/27. The food itself was delicious, but when I got home and looked over my receipt, I realized I was charged for two meals instead of one for several items. I double-checked to make sure it wasn't something I ordered by mistake--it definitely wasn't.  I am not sure how this is even possible since only one item of each was delivered to our table.  Is it a scam???  The total amount overcharged was $109.   I tried calling and emailing the restaurant to sort it out, but haven't been able to get a response yet. Mistakes happen, but overcharging a customer and not fixing it right away doesn't leave a good impression.   Please double-check your bill before you leave!  I hope management sees this and reaches out so this can be corrected.  Table 54

TITLE: Too expensive for what you get! | TEXT: For context, we have eaten at several of the top ranked restaurants in the world.  We‚Äôre very familiar with the idea of tasting menus.  The staff at the restaurant (ie. Valet, hostess, waiter, etc.) were all very good.  The artistry of the food was good.  The food quality was good.  The menu variety was good.  Having said that, the pace was a bit too slow and not because it was busy.  The major negative critique was that the food quantity was severely lacking.  After spending a few hundred on dinner, I left starving.  The same family owns other restaurants in Jax, one we really enjoy, but I would not recommend this one.  Way too expensive for what you get.

TITLE: Mediocre | TEXT: Came for dinner and took almost 10 minutes to locate the place. Really tucked away upstairs. On a Monday night, the restaurant was pretty dead - we were one of 4 tables. Albeit, the view from our table next to the floor to ceiling windows was lovely. Food was ok, overpriced for the basic offerings and portions. The Caesar salad was an interesting take and was probably the highlight of our meal. Our server was very friendly and accommodating but really focused on closing time/pushing us to order.

TITLE: Worth the visit!!! | TEXT: I was very impressed with the Warren G. Harding Presidential Sites.  We took the tour of his house, and listened first hand from the tour guides all about when Harding gave speeches on the "front porch".  The house is stunning and is 90+ percent original from years ago when Warren and his wife Florence lived in the house.  The tour guides can answer any questions you have off the top of their heads.  The  Library & Museum was finished in the spring of 2021 and they have a nice gift shop in there too.  They spared no expense in the construction of the building - it is beautiful!!!!  If you are a history buff, this is a must do.

TITLE: Best Street Fajitas Ever! | TEXT: My husband and I stopped in during our road trip to Key West. We sat outside and watched the beach and ocean while eating street fajitas and taco burgers. After we ate lunch we walked across the street to the beach and went down to the water.

TITLE: In New Orleans with family and friends. Have always wanted to try Mulates. | TEXT: The food was excellent. I recommend the key lime pie. There was live Zydeco music. Or waitress was very pleasant and knowledgeable. I will return.

TITLE: Chicken falling off the bone | TEXT: We ordered two chicken dishes, grape leaves, and rice pudding. We were very excited for the meal and arrived a bit early for our reservation. Chicken mandi and chicken kabsah were fabulous, the chicken was so tender and delicious , and the rice was unique and flavorful. I love rice pudding, which had pistachio on top! Service was timely and the staff are pleasant and knowledgeable. A+ all around!

TITLE: Staff Attitude | TEXT: My first and last time dining at this restaurant. Our server was great but one staff that was working at the backyard was rude and nasty. She was annoyed when I was standing by the door of the restroom which I must say they have a very small place. She kicked me out by saying "step outside!" What an attitude treating their customers. We like exploring French restaurants in San Francisco but this will be out of our list and will not recommend. Disappointing!

TITLE: Original Greek Food | TEXT: This is a very old restaurant in Stockton but very busy lunch crowd, the service is old style but very friendly the food is very original an fresh we always get the same Nick‚Äôs salad.The menu is pretty big. Good value for your money.

TITLE: Excellent service, food, and ambiance! | TEXT: This restaurant was excellent! Small restaurant with great ambiance. Owner is wonderful‚Ä¶ professional with a sense of humor. He comes to your table and tells you the extensive menu.  The food was out of this world! We had crab cakes, caprese salad, crusted salmon, rib eye, and key lime pie!
TITLE: Not great | TEXT: Food was ok. Staff was rude. Customer service was terrible. Place desperately needed cleaning and updates. Definitely not a coffee shop as the name suggests.

TITLE: Good food, poor service | TEXT: Unfortunately we have to give this restaurant three stars, despite the delicious food. We sat at the bar because we did not have a reservation. Bar staff, two young women working at Pesche each for one year, were unfriendly and surly, offering poor service and even to our surprise, rude comments. We ordered several appetizers and a whole redfish, but received zero service after a food runner brought the entree. We were ignored at the bar, asked several times for a drink but did not receive, and experienced very bad, unwelcoming service from these bartenders. We would not return, despite the extremely well prepared food. Thank you to the chef. Bartenders required more training and certainly a lesson in courtesy and manners.

TITLE: Best Place to Stay in Southern Pacific Costa Rica!!!! | TEXT: We've traveled all of Costa Rica, nearly 40 trips ( actually, it's 39 trips throughout the country ). The Ballena Coast is our favorite locale, and Many's House is by far, our favorite place to stay. Menachem, is a very attentive  host, and the accommodations are much like home. You will rest comfortably between the ocean, and the rain forest. Many's website, fails to do him justice.....THIS IS THE BEST LOCATION IN SOUTHERN PACIFIC COSTA RICA.........PERIOD!!
TITLE: Exceptional all around | TEXT: We went to visit our kids. Saison experience was beyond expectations. Staff game us exceptional service. Food and drinks were well presented and delicious.

TITLE: Best pub in Boston | TEXT: Best bar I‚Äôve found in Boston so far. I‚Äôm travelling for work as a solo female and may have tried a bar or two (or more) along the way. The staff here are wonderful, location is great with an outdoor sun trap. Loving the people watching and the history that surrounds the pub. Strongly recommend and thank you to the staff.

TITLE: Asian fusion in downtown Philadelphia | TEXT: Tasty food late in the evening. We had flown in for the work conference. Not everything‚Äôs open late on Sunday evening, so our choices were more limited. This is in a very vibrant area of the city with lots of people still walking around after 8 PM. The food choices were good. It is sort of served family style in that they bring a bowl of the entr√©e, rice, etc and you share it at the table.  The menu was small, but the food was tasty. Servers were responsive and helpful. It‚Äôs a small restaurant and a little bit loud, but I would definitely return again.
TITLE: Wonderful! | TEXT: Absolutely wonderful, staff, wine garden & food all above and beyond. Big thanks to Todd and Jess for making this an exceptional birthday!

TITLE: Great date night! | TEXT: We went last night for the abbreviated menu and it was delightful.  Perfect service that was both professional and playful.  The smell alone is worth another star.  The food was sublime and the wine pairings were different but matched beautifully.  The chef came by and visited with us and he was lovely.  Beautiful room and a gorgeous kitchen.

TITLE: Little hidden gem... | TEXT: When I visit Berlin, I always have a beer or three in this little bar tucked away between shops. First time I came, it was packed, playing 80's music. Several times since and the bar staff have always been friendly and chatty. Great atmosphere and nice and small.

TITLE: Worth visiting | TEXT: We are regular visitors to the resort but had never had a meal at this restaurant before. As we were staying at the accommodation this time, we naturally tried the food.  We were not disappointed. The portions are generous and the quality outstanding.

TITLE: Trendy | TEXT: A lovely, lively restaurant that is trendy in food options. Great service (from Julianne) and delicious entree, large plentiful fresh salads and good appetizers.  We enjoyed delicious wine and a drink. So glad we chose this restaurant!

TITLE: Amazing Hidden Restaurant...with Excellent Food | TEXT: This food here is amazing.  We loved everything on the menu. We ordered to go here a lot during the pandemic because it was delicious.  However, we had never gone into the actual restaurant until recently. It was an absolute delight. The owner/chef is there to make sure your food is done to perfection. The ambiance is casual/elegant.  It is a true Seattle gem.

TITLE: A Magnificent Evening! | TEXT: While we were in town for a quick weekend getaway, we were looking for a solid tasting menu at a place we hadn't tried before. A number of different options presented themselves, and Nomad PDX kept popping up as a place we should take a look at. We decided to go with it and were, obviously, very happy with our decision!  The police is located in a pretty nondescript building that has some really cool space contained within it. You walk in and there's a very casual sitting area with tons of exposed brick, some fun lighting and some very modern looking Decour. It's an interesting mix of classic and modern styles.In doing so, they create a really nice area for people to come in and wind down. The adjacent bar is very cozy, and the dining area - which is literally a long table Just outside the kitchen - creates a very intimate dining experience and atmosphere.  This place apparently started as a pop-up restaurant they got so popular that they decided to open a standalone restaurant. Ryan Fox, the head chef, is doing some really cool stuff here!  There wasn't really a theme to the dinner, other than being delicious.There were a total of eight courses, all of which showed a lot of creativity as well as consideration of the patrons... Mostly because they had three dessert courses!  The variety of foods was pretty awesome, and range from a Peruvian inspired ceviche, to a trout collar serve with flatbread and different butters, to a celery root foam and desserts that included the use of liquid nitrogen (food science is fun!) The trout collar was an absolute hit, as it showcased a really nice portion of the fish that a lot of people don't often pay attention to. Another big hit was a squash soup served with pumpkin bread and chestnut butter. It ends up chestnut butter is awesome!  The favorite dessert was also the signature one. They call it the nest egg, and it is beautiful! Trying to describe and greens does not do this thing justice, but let it be known that this is one of the more beautiful and delicious desserts we've ever experienced!  The measure of a great meal isn‚Äôt only the food, but arguably more the entire experience- At the end of the night, we walked away knowing a new group of people who are also big fans of food, and having had a meal that we won't soon forget. If you have an opportunity to go dine at this place, you should absolutely take advantage of it!

TITLE: Week long travel with Crow Canyon in Southwest | TEXT: I have travelled with Crow Canyon more than 8 times; mostly in the Southwest. I would label this travel adventure travel.  You are in a small group with at least two scholars, one an archeologist and one a related field.    I have learned so much and had access to so many archeological sites I would not otherwise be allowed to visit.  The trip leaders are full time employees who are very professional and experienced.  These trips are unique learning experiences.  Additionally, I have developed many lasting friendships with other persons I have met on the trips....we all share common interests  which adds to our own experiences.

TITLE: Ok I guess | TEXT: Good place,  just wish the tv had a channel guide so we did not have to scroll every channel to find something to watch and we had to get a new key card every time we came back to our room!

TITLE: Miami Cost is Cray Cra | TEXT: Hmm.   All I can say is "when did everything get so expensive"?      This is not a Michael Schwartz issue,     this is a Miami issue.      Happy to have spent $125 on two dishes of pasta and two glasses of rose for a lunch.     Still wondering---- how did everything get so expensive?

TITLE: Well preserved | TEXT: A nice little building out in the middle of nowhere. It was quite complete with a ground floor and courtyard and a story above that with rooms you could go in. It‚Äôs astonishing how old it is and it is one of the best preserved of the desert castles. You can only get there by car, lots of hotels do tours from Amman.

TITLE: Stellar dining experience | TEXT: Wonderful vibes the moment we walked in. We were told there was a dining room upstairs, but my wife and I sat at the bar with friends. Although it was a sober night for me, the rest of my group ordered one of the cocktails from the menu that was expertly crafted by a friendly mixologist named Paul. The playlist set the tone for a fun Friday night and the volume was a perfect level for conversation and in seat dancing. This place is a hot spot with folks waiting up to an hour or more to dine at the bar, and frankly, the food is more than worth the wait. It is a culinary delight with high art presentation. It really engaged the five senses, yes even sound; I could hear the crisp of the skin as I bit into the roasted chicken. A rich sensory experience. I have so much more to say about the food, but I invite you to try it out for yourself. We will absolutely be back here.

TITLE: This place turns up the HEAT! | TEXT: This place turns up the HEAT! Our group of gals danced the night away! Band was bangin‚Äô!!  Servers awesome, food and drinks were on point!  A fabulous Friday night!

TITLE: Cannot wait to come back | TEXT: Fabulous !! It was wonderful ! 2 couples - started with the seafood tower ! Perfection - but so do not miss the bone marrow toast - we each had a little something different - cannot wait to come back !!!!

TITLE: Never again | TEXT: On pulling up to this hotel we could tell it wasn't going to be our perfect holiday. First of all the neon lighting sign was out. As we entered the hotel reception we were greeted by what seemed to be a very miserable hotel manager. After a lot of faffing about with a man that could only speak very little English we finally got to our room. As we arrived late there was some 'fresh food' bought up to us. This wasn't fresh and it seemed to stay in our room for 3 days after we arrived. We decided to have a drink in the bar which I'm pretty sure is a makeshift bar with the bar staff not being able to speak English to the point where we had to pour our own drinks. I won't ramble on to much about how awful this hotel is, but the restaurant was filthy, the rooms were unclean, the pool side was horrendous with empty cups laying everywhere so it was heaven for the flies.  The restaurant which does seem to cater for the Russian guests. We did complain to our rep. The manager offered us an alcarte menu which still would be prepared in the same kitchen which we did ask to view before hand and was very quickly dismissed. If your looking for cheap and cheerful I wouldn't bother wasn't your money because it is far from cheerful!

TITLE: Great food! | TEXT: Great home Cookin‚Äô cheese grits amazing, great fried catfish with well seasoned cocktail sauce. Cabbage n beans were just like momma makes. Ty Callie for the great service!

TITLE: One of the best in Austin! | TEXT: We have eaten here many times. We always return. Why? Because it is one of the best in Austin. The service is excellent. The food is amazing!! We haven‚Äôt found any place here or in the DFW metroplex that compares! You will not be disappointed. Even if something sounds questionable, it is usually the best ever!!

TITLE: Good food, good value | TEXT: First time visitors for take out. Wife had the non-spicy grilled salmon salad which came with rice, kimchi and marinated cucumber slices. Quite good. I had the dumpling soup (wantons were super velvety) and steamed Shumai (steamed shrimp dumplings). Both were very good. Can't wait to go back and try the sushi.

TITLE: A must go place in San Francisco | TEXT: Very very interesting and creative menu, great wines, good service, nice atmosphere, great place to share plates and try new food combinations, much more interesting than the average restaurant menus

TITLE: What a rip off, the worst food and service I have ever had! | TEXT: The server took over one hour to serve us, the food tastes terrible.  The place is dirty and we saw a roach.   The owner happened to be there and offered to serve us himself with this weird salt routine he does that I found creepy, then served my friend directly with his knife a price of burnt meat.  I would never go back, The price was outrageous! They won‚Äôt last long, I prefer Capital grill or even la carreta to this dump.

TITLE: Perfection | TEXT: Fantastic!  I stopped by this awesome place for lunch after a long morning at the State Capitol.  For lunch, I had the chicken fried mushrooms and vegan cookies.  My lunch was perfection.  Everything was extremely flavorful. I enjoyed my lunch outside and people watched.  Mother is a must.

TITLE: Finest Restaurant in Jacksonville, FL | TEXT: This is one of the best Brazilian Steakhouses in the USA. With over 1900 restaurants of all types in the Jacksonville area, they are consistently in the top five. Their array of appetizers, soups, shrimp, salads, cold cuts, prosciutto, cheeses (you name it, they offer it) is spectacular. They also bring out fresh hot rolls (as many as you want) that are made from Yucca flour and cheese. One could make a meal out of these alone. Then comes the non-stop service with steaks, pork, lamb, roast beef, chicken, ribs, etc. that the waiters carve at your table. Everything is fresh, hot, and delicious. Also, their wine list is comprehensive and very fairly priced. Don't miss Terra Gaucha the next time you are in the Jacksonville area.

TITLE: One of our favorite spots in Philly! | TEXT: We live 50 miles from Philly. We were going to be in town for a show at the Walnut Street Theatre, celebrating our anniversary. I made reservations at Talula's Garden due to it's proximity to the theater. I believe this was our third or fourth time dining there. I had the Roasted Chicken with Gnocchi and my wife had the Handmade Ricotta Ravioli. To say they were both good would be an understatement. My wife usually never finishes her entree (she did), and it was the absolute best chicken I have ever eaten (anywhere). The only thing that would have made it any better would have been a nice piece of crusty bread to lap up the sauce, as licking the plate would have probably been in bad taste! Outstanding experience from start to finish.

TITLE: Skip if possible | TEXT: Just was going to get an order and take it back up to my room no big deal right‚Ä¶..well guess the young lady bartender did not think so.  I was told you‚Äôll have to wait ‚ÄúI only take care of people that are dining or drinking in‚Äù as a whole 2 people were at the bar area and no one eating.    The gentleman came out and took my order.  I just got a burger and substituted for a salad.  The food was not bad but I basically got a burger salad.  No separate container for the salad and dressing so everything was just mixed together.

TITLE: Terrible experience at expensive and over-hyped restaurant | TEXT: One of our worst dining experiences ever. This fancy speakeasy has no name on the door, just a gold plaque with a rose on it. You have to ring the doorbell when you arrive and a secret panel opens in the door for the host to speak through. I found it on a list of ‚Äúcozy and romantic‚Äù restaurants with great reviews. It is very dark, with bookshelves, and mismatched vintage plates (which fit the d√©cor I guess, but I would have expected something more minimal.   It is very popular and by the time we made a reservation (on a Thursday night), the only available time was 8:45pm. This was already late for our preference, but we thought we‚Äôd try it since everyone raved about it. We arrived early at 8:30pm to see if our table was ready. They said it was not, and the people currently seated had just ordered dessert. They recommended we get a drink nearby and they would text us when the table was ready. We waited at our hotel lobby around the corner, thinking it wouldn‚Äôt be that long. We received a text at 9:06pm that said ‚ÄúYour table is now ready at Alpen Rose!‚Äù When we arrived a few minutes later, we rang the bell again, only for them to tell us it was still NOT ready. There was a rowdy party of 5 guys also at the door that were taken in before us.   It was almost 9:30pm by the time we were seated. Starving, we ordered oysters Rockefeller. Being so late we asked if we could put in our entr√©e orders but was told that ‚Äúthe chef likes to course it out‚Äù. We were surprised by (who we assumed was) a manager bringing us a complimentary appetizer of tuna carpaccio, however I do not eat raw fish. She left with it and came back to ask if we would like shrimp cocktail instead (which my husband is allergic to). We imagine they were trying to make up for being late, but never asked our preference. She finally brought out a wedge salad, like it or not (which was good, even though I don‚Äôt eat bacon).   It was very noisy and we were right on top of the people on either side of us ‚Äì not romantic at all (the space is very small, seating maybe 40 people). The only good thing were the drinks (we had No. 3 and 21). Vegetables and starch sides do not come with the main dish, you must buy them separately (the asparagus was large but tender and tasty). I ordered the branzino, which she said would have some bones but were large and in almost every bite. We were shocked that my husband‚Äôs $56 filet was so tough it was hard to cut! Two small dessert bites showed up at the end of the meal, but they did not make up for the poor performance at this price point.   We were seated next to the noisy guys who came before us, so in the end we tried to make the best of it, joking and trading photos with them and being entertained by their drinks covered with smoke, massive Tomahawk cavemen bone steaks, and flaming baked Alaska with a sparkler. Maybe at 50 we are older than the typical crowd, and now we know not to make a reservation that late (especially when the times are not honored), but a pricey establishment like this should know better how to space out their reservations. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone, even given the hype.
TITLE: Cute spot for an early dinner | TEXT: My husband, daughter and I visited for an early dinner. Staff were super friendly and helpful & the food was delicious. We will return!

TITLE: Casual and Comfortable | TEXT: I love a spot where I can day drink with a glass of spritz or some equally light and lovely cocktail. This is a comforting neighborhood spot, serving nice sized portions of simple food using very good ingredients (the roasted mushroom omelet is super). Service is attentive without being obnoxious or overbearing and the guests range from families with toddlers to older couples to work colleagues enjoying a break together.  Would happily take anyone there for a good meal and the pleasant atmosphere

TITLE: Friendly staff | TEXT: Went in with a group of 8 and waited for about 20 minutes. The staff was friendly and we were served pretty quickly with it being so packed. Everyone got what they ordered and the kids were occupied the whole time in the game room.  Staff was very friendly.
TITLE: Nice Service! Delicious Breakfast! | TEXT: Very delicious scrambled eggs with bacon and fries. Very good Coffee and Juice. Thank you Monica for the nice breakfast service.
TITLE: Angela experience | TEXT: Great place. Loved Angela. Supper cool. Food was excellent. Thanks Angela. Food was delicious atmosphere wonderful we love the panini gouda grits and the mule.

TITLE: First rate, highly recommended | TEXT: Highly rated French restaurant, with an exceptionally high quality menu. Prices are reasonable for the excellent quality and service tips are built into the prices you see on the menu.

TITLE: Recommend to Everyone | TEXT: Really enjoyed our dinner at Haywire! The atmosphere was great! Would recommend this to anyone. I got a special that was fish with some crab on it in a creamy sauce. Really enjoyed that! We also got the appetizer platter. Everything on it was great! Loved it.
TITLE: Coziness | TEXT: Nice cozy place for studying or working remotely and setting appointments. Has free internet, bathroom acsses close to the mosque

TITLE: Best family style food for group brunch. | TEXT: We were here for a wedding brunch in the back and the staff couldn‚Äôt have been more accommodating. The food was excellent and we all enjoyed the brunch tremendously.

TITLE: Special place to eat and drink on Treasure Island | TEXT: Love, love this place for either personal or business. The west-facing restaurant has the prettiest view of downtown San Francisco imaginable. Food is creative but not fancy; reasonable prices, friendly staff. Eat indoors or out. And it's next to the new Treasure Island Park.

TITLE: Won't be going back.. | TEXT: Very underwhelming.  The two-hostess standing outside the front door led you to think it will be great service.  Very wrong.  Your seated, and everything is just dropped off, menus, etc.  The food was dropped off and the server just turned and left.  She would rush by the table periodically not bothering to check.  Midway she came rushing by, wearing a black mask and black latex gloves and yelled ALL GOOD?!?! and gave two thumbs up and she rushed buy.  Two hamburgers, two soft drinks (no refills) plus tip was $75...this place has the sound of a death rattle...

TITLE: Not good food | TEXT: Fritatta was awful. Staff didn't try to correct situation. My husband's meal was also dissapointing and he was immediately sick and in need of a rest room. We will never go back.

TITLE: Fun night out with friends | TEXT: The Point D.C. has lots of potential.  The menu is varied, the location is amazing, and the decor is great.  The service could use some improvement.  Pros -  Menu - lots of great choices, even for those who don't eat seafood Food - came out HOT, which meant it was freshly cooked Decor / ambiance - fantastic Location - right on the water, excellent view Seating - inside or outside seating was available  Cons -  Service - slower than expected Server - was nice, but wasn't attentive

TITLE: Definitely recommend | TEXT: Stop here when visiting Philly. Large variety of foods to choose from. Plenty of shop to look for souvenirs. Definitely with visiting especially if it‚Äôs your first time visiting.

TITLE: Won't go back | TEXT: Went for my wife's birthday. The lobster bisque was excellent and that was all. The waitress talked me into getting the whole steamed lobster. The claw tips were tender but the rest tasted uncooked and like rubber. My wife did not like her shrimp and the scallops were not cooked. So much for the Birthday dinner !

TITLE: Excellent experience | TEXT: We had an amazing Thanksgiving dinner here. Not one person in our family had a single complaint about the food or service. The food was delicious and the service is incredible.

TITLE: Above and Beyond: Food, Cocktails, Ambiance and Service | TEXT: Many thanks to Chef Ryan Fox for preparing and serving such a wonderful meal for my family last evening! The food was wonderful, cocktails fabulous, and the ambiance and service made us feel as though we were dining in your home with your family. Thanks to you and your staff you made a family get together in Portland even more special - an evening we will remember for the meal and laughter for a long time to come.

TITLE: Excellent customer service, very tasty food, very good location, it is a nice place, very familiar, you have to visit it | TEXT: Excellent customer service, very tasty food, very good location, it is a nice place, very familiar, you have to visit it

TITLE: Great Cafe | TEXT: A great American cafe, old school!  Mingle with the locals here because THEY know where the food is good.  You might have to wait a spell for a table, but around here life moves slower.  Eaten here twice, wonderful food always, The gravy that goes on the biscuits is excellent, unless you are not from the South/

TITLE: Cannot wait to come back | TEXT: Fabulous !! It was wonderful ! 2 couples - started with the seafood tower ! Perfection - but so do not miss the bone marrow toast - we each had a little something different - cannot wait to come back !!!!

TITLE: Asian fusion in downtown Philadelphia | TEXT: Tasty food late in the evening. We had flown in for the work conference. Not everything‚Äôs open late on Sunday evening, so our choices were more limited. This is in a very vibrant area of the city with lots of people still walking around after 8 PM. The food choices were good. It is sort of served family style in that they bring a bowl of the entr√©e, rice, etc and you share it at the table.  The menu was small, but the food was tasty. Servers were responsive and helpful. It‚Äôs a small restaurant and a little bit loud, but I would definitely return again.
TITLE: Delicious food! | TEXT: The food was delicious, and the prices are reasonable. Everyone enjoyed their food and most had some to take home. The service was great, and atmosphere is fun!
TITLE: Excellent | TEXT: All the food was fantastic! And the service was amazing. We loved Colin as our waiter! The crabmeat appetizer was delicious and the veal medallions entree was incredible!
TITLE: Groovy food | TEXT: I am not a vegetarian, but do enjoy vegetarian meals.  This place seems to try a bit too hard to be "cool", at least in my opinion.

TITLE: An wonderful experience | TEXT: A wonderful experience. It is very expensive, but you know that before you get there. We had the abridged menu; couldn‚Äôt eat a 10 course meal and would not want to pay the much   But the meal was fantastic and the friendliest, most helpful wait service. The wagyu was the best ever.  And the desserts were extremely good and different. If you want an excellent, interesting meal and can afford it, go there.
TITLE: HORRIBLE | TEXT: Overpriced, horrible food and customer service.  They make their own hours and open/closed whenever they pleased.

TITLE: Fresh, fast and delicious.  Highly recommend for a dependable meal. | TEXT: I first found this restaurant during the worst of the pandemic through Grub Hub.  For delivery it is one of the best I've ever used, but I've also picked up numerous times.  The food is always fresh, the salads are large and delicious, I love the pork ban mi and the broth for the Pho is unique (chicken based).  Very found of the pot stickers as well.    I've tried most of the menu and while I like some more than others based only on my particular taste.    The service is personal and attentive to detail.  I have tried eating in yet, but now that things are open again, I think today might be the day.

TITLE: Why I will never go back | TEXT: The lady was rude and non polite to customers and waitresses the cups and silverware were dirty and plates were nasty and they yelled at me because I was getting it grilled and she thought I was finna eat it raw
TITLE: Fantastic brunch spot | TEXT: This was probably our favourite meal in San Francisco‚Ä¶ great range of brunch options and fantastic friendly service- highly recommend

TITLE: It was fun | TEXT: Menu was varied, local wines & beers. Staff was pleasant and helpful. Food tasted good and plenty of it. There was a short wait on Saturday night, but not terrible. Place was a bit noisy for our tastes, but we are in the "senior citizen" category. Not really unusual for a "sports bar" atmosphere.

TITLE: Decent food but lacks flair | TEXT: Went to Mistral after some friends recommended this restaurant. Menu is nice but the prices are insane. Not that we are ‚Äútoo cheap‚Äù, but $98 for lamb is a bit steep. Our appetizers and entree were average in quality but nicely prepared. Our waiter was very good however this place is very busy, loud, and has minimal flair.

TITLE: Catering services | TEXT: They provide excellent food for a large group of people and always please everyone.  They have never disappointed us and have been around for years. It is vibrant in the restaurant, and a lot of people enjoy going in to eat. Their food is very delicious!

TITLE: Charming staff with a lovely view | TEXT: We had an absolutely lovely dinner here for our first night in Washington. It was a birthday trip for my dad, and the staff were so welcoming. Even the manager came over to wish him well, he was a gentleman and we enjoyed chatting to him while enjoying the view.   We were surprised it wasn‚Äôt busier but sounds like a lot of people don‚Äôt know it‚Äôs there, so highly recommend as the only thing that would have been better is more people for the atmosphere!
TITLE: Pier 39 Pier Market | TEXT: Delicious sea food if you like sea food you must try here. Very kind waitress, clean, and good price. You can share a plate

TITLE: Excellent | TEXT: The restaurant is exceptional from the decoration, atmosphere, service and food.  However the only thing we didn't like was that our waiter made us place the complete order.  We wanted to order the appetizers and first couse and then wait to see if we want it to have a second course.

TITLE: Reminiscing | TEXT: I was stationed in Berlin in the 80's and this was my favorite watering hole. At the time it was called the Old Dublin ran by a great friend named Klaus. Sorry to hear it's closed. One of the things I loved was the shelf above the bar had coins from all over the world plastered on with Guinness foam, never believed it til a buddy stuck a 5 mark piece up there! A little slice of the old world, apparently gone forever. I had to put a date, my last visit was actually in 1989.

TITLE: Go! You won‚Äôt be disappointed! | TEXT: We had heard about this place recently and had to check it out. We were not disappointed. The food was exceptional and the service outstanding. Love the homey vibe of the place and the decor.

TITLE: Great brunch and service | TEXT: Cute little French bistro. We went for Sunday brunch (tip:get there really early if you want quiche!)... The beet salad was an excellent starter, as was the boiled eggs over mayo.  We had the charcuterie, the croq madame, and a really good soup, and some goat cheese beignets.  Outstanding food and service.

TITLE: good for just stay | TEXT: average hotel with no many facilities to make fun or luxury stay  food is good  rooms wide and clean  staff helpful but not so kind  position is away from downtown   it was good stay by the way .. all time spent outside

TITLE: I love the feeling of welcomeness | TEXT: Man awesome employees here and surprisingly young employees and so patient and respectful here. Absolutely loved how fast the drive threw was to. All around 100 stars!

TITLE: Lunch disaster | TEXT: Stopped for lunch for our Anniversary. The inside appears clean and pleasant so that was nice. Very few patrons so we figured we would get our order in quickly and be served right away. Boy were we wrong.  Our server was pleasant but not very knowledgeable of any of the dishes. Our order took 25 minutes to be served and it was extremely overcooked. Burned even. I had the chicken parm meal. It was burned and the pasta had zero flavor. Just an awful dish all around. Ordered cannolis for desert and those were equally awful.  Adequate service but the food was well below sub par. I hope I don‚Äôt have to eat here again

TITLE: This restaurant has slipped. | TEXT: This restaurant has slipped since the last time we visited. Both food and service leave much to be desired. Two different steaks were still quite good, but a Caesar salad on the menu with Little Gem lettuce was ordinary romaine and in two ‚Äúcut it yourself‚Äù slabs. Service was lackadaisical, wave and wave to get your server, drinks wrong, wrong steak sauce. Large slice of roast beef looked nice, but why swimming in a deep pool of beef broth? That is not ‚Äúau jus‚Äù. The Japanese fries are just OK, most steak places have better, crispier, or matchstick, etc. ‚ÄúLoaded‚Äù baked potato was certainly that, if you are into a thousand calorie smothered vegetable. Curiously meager wine list with few cabs, the preferred steak wine of many people. So all and all if you‚Äôre looking for a NY or Las Vegas steakhouse experience, this is not even close.

TITLE: Better than ever | TEXT: Absolutely the best, hands down‚Ä¶never disappoints‚Ä¶ the staff are even better than the food and that‚Äôs saying quite a lot! Ginou and Victor are so wonderful, warm, & kind and made us feel like royalty‚Ä¶it‚Äôs the one place you shouldn‚Äôt miss for a special time in Miami
TITLE: Spectacular Wildlife Photography | TEXT: The art, sculptures, and photographs were interesting and the cafe fare was delicious with great views and friendly efficient service.

TITLE: defamation of character | TEXT: I came into station 16 today as I always do because this is one of my favorite restaurants to visit. My alcoholic beverage was watery and I sent it back. general manager RJ ( who refused to give me his real name who was rude) start talking stuff stating every time I come in here it's an issue and the last time I had an issue with the server. Mind you he was the server I complained about before he became general manager because when he was a server he had the same nasty attitude and I complained to his manager at the time and I'm sorry if a server is being rude to me im going to let upper management know that is my right and if my food comes out not good or cold as a PAYING customer I have a right to have them remake it never was rude always respectful. The fact that he stated this false accusation in front of other customers and staff badgering my character (that's defamation of character which my friend I was with recorded this) he made me feel so humiliated, uncomfortable and he embarrassed me! When I asked to speak with the chain of command he refused and stated with a smart gesture and said "he's the general manager and he's the last of the chain of command and if the owners want to call me they will and that's if the owner feels like calling me" and he will let them know it's always an issue which is very much false and I feel he's making this up to cover up his wrong doing and to retaliate against me for when I complained on him. Not only did he humiliated me but defamation of character, I will be taken this further more legally. The disrespect and attitude was uncalled for and very unprofessional and I will be taken actions all the way. Mind you I haven't been here in months because I had kidney surgery (life threatening) and was fighting for my life and came out to celebrate life and this how I'm treated. Run back the cameras and you will see how I was treated and how he humiliated me in front  of staff and customers because he wanted to retaliate. By him being a general manager he should of conducted hisself way better and professionally. He is in place to defuse any issues not make them worst and not to be rude or retaliate against me because he was complained on and now taken this personal. He approached my table with the smart remarks and my friend had me asked him again what he said so we can get it on recording and he did.

TITLE: Museum and House Tour Make this a fun Visit | TEXT: A visit to this presidential library comprises three potential activities.  First, there is an hour long tour of his house.  Second, the main building includes a small exhibition of his time as President.  Lastly, a mile from the library is his memorial.  We spent just under two hours here.

TITLE: Avoid here at All Costs | TEXT: This McDonald's is One of the Worst Ones I have Been to Yet. I Ordered online before I left My Hotel, and 10 Minutes after I left, I Arrived. But I had to Wait 58 Minutes before They Finally Told Us we Needed to Ask for our Order. This Stupid McDonald's did not say when your order was ready, you had to Ask for it. This Took up 50 minutes of my time. 1 Star, Never Coming to this One Again.
TITLE: Best Chain Wing Restaurant | TEXT: Always satisfied with the wings!! Always fresh, never dry, and plenty of sauce!! Custom service is also a 5 star.

TITLE: Service was Off | TEXT: We have been longtime fans of Orsay and make it a regular stop when driving in from Hilton Head. They offer an extensive vegetarian menu and probably the best hamburger in the area according to my husband. The weekend brunch is really fine and happy hour runs all day on Saturday (11am to 6pm) with 1/2 price wines by the glass and bottle. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable m- they are normally quite attentive. This visit was a bit different. While my husband‚Äôs burger was perfectly prepared, his request for Dijon mustard went unfulfilled for more than 10 minutes and required requests to three separate servers before the condiment arrived. Our server provided a complimentary sparkling wine, a nice gesture but too little too late. His meal had cooled and I was well into my lunch by then. Very disappointing. We will eat here again. Do look at the petit desserts-for a small price you get a sample of one (or more) of their delicious sweet treats‚Ä¶.I can attest to the crepe br√ªl√©e!

TITLE: Lounge Has It All | TEXT: Nicely crafted and creative drinks, delicious food served up in a historic and beautiful setting, with stellar views over the city. I enjoyed their cheeseburger as well as several other items during our stay at the Bellevue; all were excellent. They offer a sweet happy hour which includes some drinks and some food. The service is impeccable, but also very welcoming and friendly. I enjoyed the drinks, food and ambience so much, I kept going back; it was that great.

TITLE: Crowded, super noisy and garlicky | TEXT: They pack the restaurant with so many people one can hardly breathe in there. Food is very good but terribly garlicky. They also charge a lot for each mini plate they offer‚Ä¶ using the tapas system they get you into ordering many overpriced small garlic bombs. All in all we do not go back although we live nearby as the hassle of being jammed into the noise restaurant is not worth the food.

TITLE: Disappointing special occasion | TEXT: Firstly the food was excellent. We had the set menu Steak Tartare and Striploin (fatty but to be expected) and Sticky Toffee Pudding. We thoroughly enjoyed the food, there was a nice busy ambience and feel to the restaurant. We were close enough to a window to have a view of the park. Visiting from England and Abu Dhabi we were celebrating my daughters 21st birthday. Every other place we have been to in New York have acknowledged this and we have loved the welcoming feel. The Bluebird dinner was the real big event for us and we were soo disappointed with the service. We were greeted with a ‚ÄòYes‚Äô I almost wanted to apologise for being there. The maitre d walked away without speaking to us - we kind of figured we should follow! Most restaurants begin with a Good Evening and Welcome at the very least. A waiter asked if we wanted water (we later noticed everyone else having tap water) and swiftly brought a bottle of still. No smile, no niceties, no welcome. Next our server came to us, perfectly amicable and perfunctory but no introduction or welcome. We ordered our food and drinks. Food came very quickly as starters were both cold. I asked a waiter if we could have our drinks, he explained they were busy. I explained this was a special occasion and so far it had been less than special. To his credit a few minutes later the drinks appeared. We received our steaks and the manger noted we had no steak knives, which she quickly corrected. Mains cleared and deserts promptly brought out. When we had finished our desert our server asked if we wanted anything or just the check! By this time I was totally incensed. Let alone feel this was a special occasion, we were now feeling an inconvenience and she just wanted us to leave. 250 dollars for 2 - I at least expect to feel welcome. Perhaps I am wrong to expect a little more personalised attention at a restaurant of this standard. Clearly it is just a get them in and out and take their money business model. I did not leave a tip and funnily enough no one asked me if everything was ok for me to put my thoughts across at the end of the evening. A shame that such a special occasion will be tainted by a lack of attention and personal experience.
TITLE: Great experience and a must-see place if in Dallas! | TEXT: Great food, ambience and service! It was the first time I visited and would highly recommend if you are on business or pleasure.

TITLE: Delicious food served cold‚Ä¶. | TEXT: Fare is a cool restaurant with some pretty awesome food.  Only problem is that I‚Äôve been there twice and both times my entr√©e was served cold.  I just don‚Äôt understand how a restaurant could do that.  Don‚Äôt they have a person to ensure meals are hot and immediately served when prepared?  Fix that, and you get a 5 from me!

TITLE: Best lunch meeting ever! | TEXT: I finally asked the host of our monthly meeting, where they get the lunch.  It is always super fresh and delicious.  Today I chose a Greek vegetable and hummus sandwich(gyro).  Being a meat lover, I was a little apprehensive, but it was awesome. The flavors were blended perfectly. Only open for breakfast and lunch, so go early.  Looking forward to taking my wife.  She is a big hummus fan and is going to love it.

TITLE: 1 night was not long enough! | TEXT: A beautiful little place in a  magic location!  Quality accommodation and a wonderful host.  Generous breakfast provisions. Clean and well presented.  Central to Kettering and Bruny Island.  Couldn't ask for more.
TITLE: In N Out is always GOOD | TEXT: In N Out is always GOOD  Really good fast food  And it is always fast and good  Best burgers,,  I always asks for them to make my fries very crispy

TITLE: DIRTY ROACH CRAWLING | TEXT: WENT TO THE BAKERY MIDDAY. TABLES WERE DIRTY AND STICKY. MANAGER THAT DAY WAS A SHORT HAIRED BLONDE LADY TOTALLY OBLIVIOUS TO REGULAR CUSTOMERS SKIPPING IN LINE NOT GETTING A # AND FOLLOWING THE PROTOCOL ESTABLISHED BY THE RESTAURANT, MAKING OUR WAIT LONG. THE PASTRY CASEMENT LOOKS DIRTY AS WELL. WHEN WE FINALLY SAT DOWN AFTER WIPING DOWN OUR TABLE WHICH THE MANAGER SAW US DO AND DID NOT EVEN APOLOGIZE FOR THE FILTHYNESS, WE SEE A GIGANTIC ROACH CRAWLING ON THE WALL. WE THREW OUR FOOD AND LEFT THE ROACH CRAWLING ON THE WALL FOR THE NEXT PATRON. GROSS!

TITLE: [no title] | TEXT: This lovely restaurant welcomed us with a big friendly smile and as we were shown to our table there was a beautiful hand drawn card .. made by one of the servers ,( wish I could remember her name ) with silver stars sprinkled on our table . What a welcome !!! Myself and Grandaughter   ( from the UK ) were visiting my son who is currently living and working in Boston and it was our first time in the beautiful city . He booked it as a special evening and it certainly was . The  bread basket with whipped butter was delicious ‚Ä¶ The Calamari starter was huge and so glad we shared it , my salmon and asparagus risotto was cooked perfectly.  My Grandaughter had spaghetti with clams ..first time she has had this and said it was amazing ,   my son had the a 16 oz steak .. we were so full but  I desperately wanted to try the key lime pie so we shared one portion and so glad we did , schamazing !!! as it‚Äôs so popular we got almost the last one .. it is homemade by one of the bar staff .. who makes 3 of the deserts on the menu .. it is  truly divine ‚Ä¶ we had an amazing experience there all due to the the Manager and the wonderful  server Julie .. Julie has been there 25 years and a truly outstanding waitress , they do really look after you and made our special trip to Boston  a truly memorable one. I had tears at the table when seeing all the effort they had gone to .. never have I experienced such joyful moments with lovely people working there . Thankyou  for the lovely thoughtfulness in making the card and  the warmest welcome ever !!! We will never forget you all !! üíñ

TITLE: First rate, highly recommended | TEXT: Highly rated French restaurant, with an exceptionally high quality menu. Prices are reasonable for the excellent quality and service tips are built into the prices you see on the menu.

TITLE: Go else where‚Ä¶. | TEXT: Very expensive for what you get‚Ä¶. Had far better food for a lot less whilst in New Orleans, You are paying for the name‚Ä¶. Very loud live music, can not talk to one another it‚Äôs that loud‚Ä¶.

TITLE: Great seafood restaurant | TEXT: Duy N was our server, he was very helpful in recommending good food from the menu. We ordered the seafood platter and it was delicious and perfect for 2 people. The service was great and we will definitely be back.

TITLE: World Traver favorite vacation | TEXT: I expected the scenery and the sites to be amazing, but was not prepared for the professionalism and passion of the staff!  Without exception all staff members engaged with participants to educate and make feel welcome!

TITLE: A real gem of a place! | TEXT: How is it possible that a restaurant of this calibre has a handful of reviews!!!   This is an amazingly beautiful restaurant with incredibly attentive staff and their food is to die for. Honestly by far the best restaurant experience (of this type) of our Texas trip and we will definitely make the point of returning here if we ever come back.

TITLE: Harding Presidential Sites | TEXT: We had a great visit to the Warren G Harding Presidential Library and Memorial. The Library (aka Museum) is quite small compared to other presidential libraries, but does a good job telling the story of Harding's short presidency. Tours of his home are only offered on the hour, so we had to miss that, but did take photos from the outside. We also visited the Harding Memorial in the cemetery, which was quite impressive. If you're passing by Marion, Ohio, take a break from your drive and stop by to see the presidential sites.
TITLE: Cheap, tasty and quick | TEXT: Cheap, tasty and quick. Can‚Äôt go wrong with Kiplings. Very nice.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

TITLE: Good Neighborhoody Southern Buffet | TEXT: The food was decent and the service staff was kind.  There's a lot of variety, it is a true southern buffet.  They even had chicken livers and gizzards!  I ate the fried chicken (good), the fried catfish (very good), and the mashed potatoes (not much flavor).  For dessert, I had some bread pudding and peach cobber which were both okay.  The salad wasn't that fresh though the sides were very good.    I'd eat here again if I'm in town.  I was especially pleased that they'd opened at 10 AM with the hotel checkout being 11.

TITLE: Found this while passing thru town | TEXT: Just a slight detour from our route and it was well worth it. Seems to be a very popular local place. My wife and I both ordered paninis. Hers was Italian and mine Southwest. Both were excellent. I, also, really enjoyed their cole slaw. Service was fast and efficient. They do have a full bar, as well. Great little place, especially if you're traveling and want something other than fast food.

TITLE: Amazing staff! | TEXT: We met with a friend to enjoy some bites at Odd Duck, happily surprised that valet parking is free (tip-based). Our waiter was beyond accommodating to our needs. When my fianc√© told her his dietary needs, she returned with the seasonal menu marked up to help him know exactly what to order‚Äîwow! We sat in the enclosed porch space and it wasn't too loud or cold. Our meal was great and the staff is exceptional.

TITLE: Amazing | TEXT: Amazing dinner. Definitely need reservations. Need to start early to get them as well. It is a set menu that will be $90. Very inventive with interesting combinations of flavors. Hummus was some of the best ever! Dessert really blew our socks off with the fennel sorbet and the carrot cake. Wow. Just wow. Takes about 2-3 hours to dine.

TITLE: Big, comfortable and cheap. | TEXT: I really liked this hotel. The room was HU-GE. Two big single beds, a desk, wardrobe, huge TV, and big bathroom. Very clean and cheap. I recommend it definitely. Service at the front desk was great too. It is not a 5-star so don't expect luxuries, but for a 2 star it's very good.

TITLE: Don‚Äôt forget dessert! | TEXT: This quaint French bar was highly recommended by the wine merchant at Western and Pike Wine Shop and we are so glad he did!  The place is busy with a few tables outdoors, inside and at the bar. My husband enjoyed the falafel with salad and found it totally satisfying. I ordered the red pepper soup‚Ä¶it was delicious with just the right amount of kick. Table service included a chewy baguette with butter. We treated ourselves to the chocolate mousse for dessert-WOW!  Velvety dark chocolate mousse served along side a portion of perfectly whipped heavy cream. A single order is large enough to serve 2-4. Great wines to choose from. This is a great break in the day for a delicious meal.

TITLE: Will be back!! | TEXT: Super super friendly service by the owner.  I felt so welcomed. The lunch I had - a pork banh mi - was a new flavor profile for me and really delicious and affordable. So many things on the menu I want to try - I‚Äôll be back.

TITLE: Average | TEXT: The food here wasn't great. It's by the kilo but, overall average. I also have seafood allergies and it was clear that although I stayed far away from the seafood it must have been cooked in the same pan or handled with the same utensils because by the time I left I was a walking rash.

TITLE: Great Food. Fun Spot! | TEXT: Loved the vibe and our server.  The food was excellent!  The Western Burger was so yummy and  the shoestring fries were amazing. We love the Thai Salad a bunch!  Just really good food and fun!
TITLE: Lunch in an office complex! | TEXT: Great food,  service,  atmosphere nestled in an unlikely office complex.  Blacked cheese steak was delicious and very tender!

TITLE: Pass it by . Better places close by to enjoy for the $$ .snooty pretend manager .Pass it by . promise | TEXT: Save your $$$ for a more welcoming place... not a place to spend your $$ at . Shameful manager . shamefull  . thanks for the great wines ..But just by the product any other way . NOT A NICE PLACE TO ENJOY FOR REGULAR FOLKS. manager made sure of that and now can't even leave a message for the family.... Sad ...

TITLE: Best family style food for group brunch. | TEXT: We were here for a wedding brunch in the back and the staff couldn‚Äôt have been more accommodating. The food was excellent and we all enjoyed the brunch tremendously.

TITLE: Customer service A+ | TEXT: Came for Sunday brunch and to hear live music. Was not disappointed in any way. The food was delicious, my favorite was shrimp and grits, candied yams, so good, and the customer service was on point. We sat at the bar ( place was crowed and I can see why :) ) and the bartender Stacy, was very pleasant, drinks were just right. Want to thank Yvette, the manger, for taking the time to ensure our time there was special, she was very friendly and attentive and we truly appreciated, we had such a good time.

TITLE: Worst Ever | TEXT: This was the worst McDonalds ever. Long lines, long waits, cold food and terrible service. Long lines and waits were due to the most disorganized and useless crew working. This place needs to fire everyone and do some training in management and service. Don't do it and find somewhere else to eat.

TITLE: If you love extreme noise and a rude waiter, this is a place for you | TEXT: If you love, extreme noise, extremely loud music, and very tight seating arrangements, this might be the very place for you. Furthermore, if you‚Äôd love to be contradicted by a waiter in a most rude manner, this might also be perfect for you. The food was fine, small portions, big prices, but tapas restaurants seem to be like that anyway. That is not the point. When I asked for pulpo asado (octopus) they brought fried breaded calamari. Even an elementary school kid the difference between squid and octopus. The extremely rude waiter contradicted me when I mentioned that this was not octopus, it was calamari. Octopi do not have rings!! Squid have rings and octopi have tentacles with suction cups. It was so obvious to the point of pathetic that it was funny how the man was dead set on contradicting us and in the most rude fashion. If I were the manager, which we did not contact because we didn‚Äôt want to make a scene, this guy would have been in the street right away. When I confronted him and asked him why we got calamari instead of octopus, he said ‚Äúthe chef knows what he‚Äôs doing thank you‚Äù and he left the table in a huff. Obviously we are not coming back nor our large groups of friends.

TITLE: Tried again, same result | TEXT: I understand the job market, but one waitress for the whole restaurant ?  Just don‚Äôt.  Host/manager should have been helping on every table.  Food is meh at best, hash browns were cold mushy sticks.  French toast without syrup, dry af.  Eggs Benedict dry af.  No jam for toast wtf.  One bread opy, really.??

TITLE: The worst experience | TEXT: .This has been the only bad experience I‚Äôve had so far, even though I‚Äôve visited many places. The level of disregard and poor treatment was extremely high. I do not recommend this place. Terrible customer service from the moment you walk in

TITLE: Exceptional Experience | TEXT: This was my second time at Friday Saturday Sunday.  It's definitely a restaurant for a special occasion!  The tasting menu is pricey but in my opinion well worth it.
