I experienced eight courses of unique and delicious dishes, each served by amazing servers who could explain the intricacies of the dishes so well.  Although this is definitely a high end restaurant, it never feels stuffy or pretentious.  I dined alone and was made to feel comfortable and as special as if I was with an important group.  Starting with the seasonal snacks to the halibut dish, pasta, and steak, each dish was immaculately prepared and served.  Dessert was an amazing chocolate cake, a vanilla type custard/ice cream, and an extra chocolate coated piece of heaven!  I did not choose the optional wine pairing, but instead enjoyed one of their cocktails, an Orange Catholic.  They are known for their cocktails as well and this one was amazing!

TITLE: Bad mussels ruin experience! | TEXT: This restaurant is in a beautiful area of SF!!!  Gorgeous old homes and buildings!  Amazing!!!    The service was very good and we loved that it is a tip free restaurant.  Awesome that they provide a great work environment for their employees.    The portions were huge!  Especially the pork chops!!!!  Also the cheese from the selection of 3 cheeses appetizers,  2 of the 3 were huge chunks of cheese.    Most of our food was amazing and very delicious.  But my sister and I had the PEI mussels that were very off and made me almost throw up.  We couldn‚Äôt eat them.  We told our waiter at the end of our meal, as he asked how the food was.  He told the cook and the cook said they were fresh, bought that day and tasted fine.  Too bad for us!  Charged full price .  Not that we were expecting them to remove the charge but since neither of us could eat them we would have thought there would have been more than a ‚Äútoo bad!‚Äù  It left our experience less that delightful.

TITLE: Open on Mondays, good fortune! | TEXT: Not much open on Mondays so we were glad Good Fortune wasn‚Äôt closed. We decided on an Indonesian Rijsttafel for 2. Lots of food and it all tasted good. Some of the little dishes were not as Indonesian as I had hoped more Chinese cuisine influenced. Over all the dinner was good and plentiful. Not too pricey either. Service was very friendly.

TITLE: Modern Italian | TEXT: Torno Subito delivers a truly creative dining experience, with dishes that showcase high quality, sustainability, and outstanding presentation. You can clearly see Massimo Bottura‚Äôs influence in the innovative approach to traditional Italian flavors.  The portions are a bit small, which might leave some wanting more, but the attention to detail in every bite makes up for it.  The neighborhood is rough and still developing‚Äîit feels unsafe at night. Hopefully, things will improve soon.  One suggestion: the staff should speak more Italian. Some try, but it‚Äôs minimal. A stronger Italian presence would enhance the authenticity of the experience.  Expensive.

TITLE: Stick to the ribs brunch but inconsistent | TEXT: Came here for weekend brunch.  Right in the heart of east passyunk, it‚Äôs a popular place. Its theme is Amish influence which is nice for brunch.  On the one hand. My Amish bologna eggs Benedict with cream chip beef and was super yummy and our lattes were perfect.  But my wife‚Äôs Avacado toast was really too basic for the price.  Also the service felt young and untrained and very inconsistent.  So we drop a star for that inconsistency.

TITLE: The ultimate Italian experience, La Cena! | TEXT: La Cena is the perfect place for the ultimate Italian experience in food and wine! We had a ‚Äúcousins‚Äù dinner in February and are returning this evening. I decided to write a review after reading in disbelief the small number of critical reviews. Our experience was amazing! The ambiance, decor, menu, and wine offerings equal or surpass the best you can find in Italy. Every one of us shared and were so impressed with our food selections and our server suggested perfect wines to accompany our choices. Everything was delicious and prepared perfectly. It‚Äôs difficult to find enough superlatives to describe La Cena! I highly recommend!
TITLE: Great Bar experience and good Happy Hour Choices | TEXT: Good selection of drinks with a very friendly atmosphere. Service was great for a large party and very accommodating.

TITLE: Dinner in Philadelphia, PA | TEXT: Came here for dinner Saturday night‚Äîhad reservations so we were seated right away.  Cute small restaurant.  The bar area seems pretty energetic but we sat in the dining area.  Started off with Half Dozen Pink Moon Raw Oysters‚Äîso delicious!  Also tried the Roasted Oysters which were overloaded with breadcrumbs I could barely taste the oyster underneath‚Äîalso has a spicy kick to it as well!  For entrees, we tried to Bucatini Cacio E Pepe and Mafaldine Alla Vodka‚Äîboth pasta dishes were generous portions and overall were pretty good!  No issues with our cocktails and service was great.

TITLE: Def worth a visit! | TEXT: Well if you can‚Äôt find some food here, there is something wrong with you. All the local stuff you would expect plus bundles of ice cream, fresh meats and cheeses, and chocolate.  Well worth an hour of your time.
TITLE: As good as you would expect | TEXT: Grand dame of New Orleans restaurants. Services a 5+. Food is a solid 4. Pretty and elegant and reasonably priced for an amazing experience.

TITLE: Dylan the doorman was amazing!! He brought us in with good energy n gave menu and wonderful goodbye!! He needs a raise n | TEXT: 5great job by Dylan he did a great job by bringing us in and then also brought us menus and gave me the best goodbye ever he needs a raise

TITLE: World Traver favorite vacation | TEXT: I expected the scenery and the sites to be amazing, but was not prepared for the professionalism and passion of the staff!  Without exception all staff members engaged with participants to educate and make feel welcome!

TITLE: Neat find!  Good food. | TEXT: This was a neat find.  There is indoor and outdoor seating.  We sat outside & the server pulled up a heater for us when it started to get a little chilly. We ordered Cordon Bleu, & Schnitzel.  The Cordon Bleu was delicious!  The side I ordered was Spatzle & it was a little dry. There are a ton of combinations that you can customize your entr√©e with. We also ordered a pretzel for an appetizer, and a Bee Sting for dessert.  Both were good.

TITLE: A decent steakhouse with a decent vibe | TEXT: Alright, so we went on a Friday night and had a res for 8:15. Valet was easy. The hosting staff was amazing and gave us recommendations and were super friendly. We waited about 15 minutes to be sat because she said she wanted us in the main dining room after we told her our monthly steakhouse review plans. Sweet girl. We talked with them almost the whole wait. The decor was cool, including a giant fish tank and car in the dining room. The atmosphere was loud and vibrant with a cool guy swagger. Our server was exceptional and made some suggestions as well. We ordered the filet mignon, cheeseburger and fries, (one of the recommendations by hostess), mac and cheese, fried brussel sprouts, and passion fruit kickers. Okay, so they cook their steaks over some cedar wood and I just wasn't the biggest fan as it tasted smokey and almost bbq'd and I guess I'm a bit of a traditionalist when it comes to steak. It was cooked perfectly but I had a hard time getting past the woodsy flavor. The voodoo sauce they served with it was SLAPPIN. Request it if you go. They told us the cheeseburger and fries were better than Hudson House. Nope, as it was really, really salty and you could feel the salt crystals in your mouth. The mac and cheese was okay but mine is better and the brussel sprouts were the star of the show with a tangy honey mustard flavor that we both looooved. We didn't do dessert, which is a travesty, but nothing really spoke to us. No tears overall (yes, I sometimes cry when i eat really good food). The meal was $150 and we left $60 for tip and $5 for valet for a total of $215. Food: 5/10 Ambience: 8/10 Service: 10/10 Next up is Pappas Brothers for anyone who cares, but I'm excited and this is fun. Much love.
TITLE: Restaurant | TEXT: The best restaurant  in Stockton ca food serves is amazing customer severed is great too me and my family‚Äôs favorite spot

TITLE: Day in Philly | TEXT: Interesting little place in the heart of South Philly. we went with several very different items, The Veggie Dutch, the Lebanese Salami and cream chesse omelet, and the truffle mushroom omelet.  All was good and different and will come back to try the great looking pancakes! Service was a little slow as it is a small place and two front staff members. The bar out front takes a lot of space , if it was nice out, we would have sat in the outside space out front.

TITLE: Wooden beamed authentic pub near Boston Common | TEXT: Great atmosphere with low wood beamed ceilings creating an olde world pub feel. Lots of great beers on tap. Food is good pub grub. Not a lot of gluten free options but the loaded nachos were delicious. Our server suggested a half portion: great call!! It was huge!!

TITLE: Skip the Dinner and Just have Dessert and Coffee | TEXT: Sister and I went for dinner.  She ordered veal and I ordered the scallop and pasta special.  Her veal and potatoes were very good but the "vegetable medley" was a pile of mushy vegs. The best thing that could be said about my dish were the two blistered cherry tomatoes were tasty.  The bead size scallops were rubbery, the small amt of sauce was incredibly bland, and the dish was dry. The side garden salads were very nice size, fresh and good.  The salted caramel cheesecake was amazing and strangely enough, the decaf coffee  was truly terrific.  However, a $97 meal (we ordered no alcohol) with mushy vegetables and a non-edible entree was a big disappointment.  The reason I did not send back my entree was that it took 45 minutes for our meal to arrive.  There were 3 servers and 9 tables, so that was not the issue.

TITLE: Small restaurant, but BIG on taste/dining experience... | TEXT: Was in Philly visiting my son and he said we couldn't leave without eating at Bistro Southeast.  He discovered this restaurant last year when he moved to the area.  He said he'd never been disappointed and we weren't either!  The food was so fresh and the service was excellent.  I ordered the salt and pepper shrimp, my son ordered the spicy curry shrimp, my daughter ordered summer rolls and the rice bowl with chicken; we also ordered thai sweet chili wings and sweet potato fries to share.  All very delicious!!!  If visiting Philly, be sure to stop by this jewel of a restaurant.

TITLE: Definitely recommend | TEXT: Stop here when visiting Philly. Large variety of foods to choose from. Plenty of shop to look for souvenirs. Definitely with visiting especially if it‚Äôs your first time visiting.

TITLE: Customer service at its best! | TEXT: Truly a historic gem (circa 1925) restored to modern day convenience. Good amenities in a great location.   Perhaps the best part was my experience at breakfast this morning. The standard Holiday Inn Express offerings were very well prepared (e.g., perfectly moist and appealing scrambled eggs) and the attendants distinguished themselves by their continuous checks and attention to detail like wiping up spills. However, the MOST REMARKABLE service I witnessed was when one of the two attendants noticed a guest (walking with a cane) needing assistance as he served his plate from the buffet. She respectfully approached him and offered her help. It was spontaneous kindness and true customer service at its best!  Both my day and my trip were made better by seeing the above (while also enjoying a tasty, filling breakfast)!  I will be back!

TITLE: Unstuffy culinary hotspot | TEXT: We came here for dinner while visiting friends who live in the area, and had a wonderful meal!  The ambiance is upscale and trendy without being stuffy, and it was very clear that this is a culinary hotspot. The staff were professional and friendly - our waitress was very helpful when we were struggling to decide what to order. The crispy duck, salmon satay, tempura cauliflower, and the general tso soup were outstanding! We ended up not leaving anything for leftovers, which doesn't generally happen with us. We'll definitely come back the next time we're in town.

TITLE: Stylish Ambiance, Top-Notch Service & Amazing Pizza! | TEXT: Paradiso in Bishop Arts District is a fantastic spot! The decor and ambiance are incredibly fancy, creating a chic yet welcoming atmosphere. But beyond the beautiful setting, the service is truly professional, and the food is high quality. Every dish was well-prepared and flavorful, making for a great dining experience. A special mention goes to the pizzas‚Äîthey were perfectly cooked, with a crispy crust and delicious toppings. Whether you‚Äôre looking for a stylish night out or just great food, this place is definitely worth a visit!

TITLE: Unstuffy culinary hotspot | TEXT: We came here for dinner while visiting friends who live in the area, and had a wonderful meal!  The ambiance is upscale and trendy without being stuffy, and it was very clear that this is a culinary hotspot. The staff were professional and friendly - our waitress was very helpful when we were struggling to decide what to order. The crispy duck, salmon satay, tempura cauliflower, and the general tso soup were outstanding! We ended up not leaving anything for leftovers, which doesn't generally happen with us. We'll definitely come back the next time we're in town.

TITLE: Nice place to eat off the beaten path | TEXT: We arrived at the restaurant after 9pm (it closes at 10pm). We had a nice seat outside and a very friendly/good server named, Carlos.   We had a Cesar salad with salmon and the baby gems salad with shrimp added.  They were both really good!  It was a nice, easy and enjoyable experience.

TITLE: Everything delicious | TEXT: Recommended by the Courtyard by Marriott front desk, I had a nearly perfect sumptuous dinner at Market Tavern.  Loved the choices of by the glass wines.  My Duckhorn Merlot was delicious!  Was in the mood for steak, and the kitchen totally delivered.    I decided to eat in the bar as a solo, and they had good sports choices on multiple TVs. The bar was doing a fine business.  Portions are very generous.  My ribeye steak was perfectly cooked medium rare, exceptionally tasty, and a perfect accompaniment to the wine.  It came with two side dishes, great steamed broccoli and garlic mashed potatoes.  Amazing flavors!  Again all portions were huge!  Highly recommend this restaurant and so pleased to experience it during my one, and possibly only, visit to Stockton.
TITLE: Good food and excellent server | TEXT: Hot and delicious food. Excellent server‚ÄîSam Decent-sized booth Music TOO Loud Bathrooms need cleaning and attention.

TITLE: Not very good patio closes early | TEXT: Patio closes at 6 pm why so early nice outside it's a beautiful evening July 9 th 2025 5:09 pm patio closed at 6 pm young man said sorry closing patio. I said you close at 9:30pm why does patio close so early doesn't get dark til 8 pm I'm a business owner and this is unprofessional. shortsalesmit@gmail.com Frances Bazan

TITLE: Clearly recommended | TEXT: Whilst the ambiance is not the best - a bit too busy and acoustically unfavourable) I clearly recommend to go as the food is extra tasty, the service perfect and relaxed-friendly at the same time.

TITLE: Farm to Table Excellence | TEXT: Perhaps the best meal I had in Philadelphia. Very large restaurant with big patio and several inside dining areas plus a large bar. Well appointed and elegant but still warm and welcoming atmosphere. We enjoyed a meal of roasted cauliflower with coconut curry, garbanzo beans and quinoa. Along with lamb bolognese Pappardelle with whipped ricotta. Their chive and cheddar biscuits are to die for.  Wine options are well chosen and multiple by the glass offerings

TITLE: Very Noisy | TEXT: Much too noisy. I enjoy loud restaurants but I feel the ‚Äúcackling‚Äù  group at the adjacent table ruined our evening even though the food, wine and service was exceptional.  We wish management ask the five ladies next to us  to simply respect the other patrons and quiet down!
TITLE: Great!! | TEXT: Colin was great. Cheesecake and affogato perfect ending to a good meal! The veal was great and the filet has great flavor. Colin was friendly  and made us laugh!

TITLE: Hungry Men | TEXT: So another business trip..  So we have to eat!!!!  This the best..we always go here. Wish the Country was run like this place!  We love the owner. A no nonsense get it done lady!

TITLE: Harding Presidential Sites | TEXT: We had a great visit to the Warren G Harding Presidential Library and Memorial. The Library (aka Museum) is quite small compared to other presidential libraries, but does a good job telling the story of Harding's short presidency. Tours of his home are only offered on the hour, so we had to miss that, but did take photos from the outside. We also visited the Harding Memorial in the cemetery, which was quite impressive. If you're passing by Marion, Ohio, take a break from your drive and stop by to see the presidential sites.

TITLE: We watched a short film at the museum prior to the tour | TEXT: Our guide was Theodore, he did an excellent job sharing his knowledge of Warren Harding and Florence- marriage, campaign and presidency. The tour started on the porch where his Porch Campaign took place. The house furnishings are over 90% original. NO Pictures allowed which is sad for my personal journey ablum. The museum has nice exhibits with a couple audios. Enjoyed watching the pictures taken on the Voyage of Understanding tour to the western states and Alaska. Purchase tickets on-line because we were shocked how the first 3 tours were fully booked. We changed our itinerary to make a late afternoon tour. Large parking lot. Restrooms on site.

TITLE: It was walking into a ToysRus store | TEXT: I had read many reviews online and asked staff at my hotel all the food market. It was a 10-15 walk from my hotel and walking to the Reading Terminal Market was like walking into a toy store and not knowing what toy you want buy first.  There was so much  choices  of food available.  After walking round the market for around 10 minutes looking to see what I fancied I eventually chose a vender and had my first Philly cheesesteak.  Delicious, will defo go back again before I leave. Must do place for a visit.

TITLE: Delicious food in special occasion setting. | TEXT: A perfect special occasion place. Great food with lovely presentation. I had duck with parsnip puree, apples, and fois gras pudding. Fabulous. Cooked as ordered, and the right size portion. Pre-entree arugula salad was eh, but hot potato leek soup with fried puffed noodle was delicious. Dessert was a white chocolate souffl√© with pistachio cr√®me and was wonderful: creamy, the right amount of egginess, not too sweet yet smooth and unctuous. My husband had the scallops, which he said were the best he has ever had, cooked perfectly, sweet and tender. He also ordered the wagu beef appetizer, which we all tried: raw but seared on a hot stone and served with soy, pickles and wasabi. Meat was very thinly sliced and tender but nothing to write home about despite the very substantial price. Daughter ordered the homemade pasta bolognese, which was yummy. Servers come to the table with a variety of breads, including ciabatta and focaccia. I tried both, and felt they were just good, but my daughter and son love the focaccia.  They offer several special cocktails. I asked for a chocolate martini ( their special was espresso martini) and it was very good.  Mathew‚Äôs is a small, attractive place where you don‚Äôt have to shout to have a conversation. Exemplary service from our waiter and his several assistants. Free valet parking out front. Small but well appointed bar when you walk in. Upscale but not stuffy.

TITLE: Dinner after work | TEXT: Great steaks and nice atmosphere. The bartender was nice as I sat at the bar and talked about Portland with the person who had just arrived. Would recommend for a special dinner or event as the restaurant is really nice. Oh yeah, good wine selection as well.

TITLE: Pleasant place for drinks and dessert | TEXT: During our stay, we stopped by the XIX lounge for drinks and dessert.  My wife and I were each treated to a generous pour of a good chardonnay, which had just a bit of residual sweetness.  We also shared a portion of the chocolate mousse, which was very satisfying.  Prices are a little on the high side, but that's to be expected when you're in a classy location like the Bellevue.

TITLE: Everything delicious | TEXT: Recommended by the Courtyard by Marriott front desk, I had a nearly perfect sumptuous dinner at Market Tavern.  Loved the choices of by the glass wines.  My Duckhorn Merlot was delicious!  Was in the mood for steak, and the kitchen totally delivered. I decided to eat in the bar as a solo, and they had good sports choices on multiple TVs. The bar was doing a fine business.  Portions are very generous.  My ribeye steak was perfectly cooked medium rare, exceptionally tasty, and a perfect accompaniment to the wine.  It came with two side dishes, great steamed broccoli and garlic mashed potatoes.  Amazing flavors!  Again all portions were huge! Highly recommend this restaurant and so pleased to experience it during my one, and possibly only, visit to Stockton.

TITLE: Very good Southern cooking | TEXT: Ellen‚Äôs provides very good Southern style dishes from their flagship location in the West End area of Dallas.  We came here on a Tuesday for lunch and were immediately seated.  We ordered chicken fried steak with mashed potatoes and green beans.  The steak was great, the mashed potatoes were slightly bland but the green beans were excellent, mingled with tomatoes and bacon.   A by the glass Cabernet rounded off lunch.
TITLE: Alarming | TEXT: This is the first restaurant to serve lab grown salmon.  It's called Wildlife .    They call it cultivated salmon .    I didn't order it so not sure how it tastes.
TITLE: Lunch with a Dear Friend | TEXT: My friend chose this place for us to meet for lunch.  I loved the Teriyaki Salmon dish I ordered.  The atmosphere was great, too!

TITLE: Incredible Dining experience | TEXT: My son who lives in Dallas had been bragging on this restaurant. We had reservations but still had a 20 minute wait to our table. The manager gave us an app on the house. The food was fabulous. Service was spot on.

TITLE: Wonderful experience with a large group | TEXT: We found this spot for a group of 20+ last minute on a busy weekend and they fit us in at a beautiful table and it was a wonderful experience.  The food was incredible but the service even better. They assigned us enough servers to make sure we were taken care of very well. The atmosphere was great, bathrooms clean...just a very well run restaurant.

TITLE: Good Ending | TEXT: This dinner was redemption for a subpar lunch elsewhere. We both enjoyed the grilled salmon. Our server, Eve, must have realized we were tired after a tiring day and didn‚Äôt try to overwhelm us with too many ‚Äúthings,‚Äù for which I was grateful.  Worth a return visit when we come to Jax.

TITLE: Miami McDonald's?  Rude, Dirty, Horrendous | TEXT: Most of the McDonald's in this town are rude, dirty and horrendous, and this one is no exception.  Make you wonder why people would even buy food here.

TITLE: Consistently Fantastic! | TEXT: Ate outside under the trees and twinkly lights.  Beautiful. No reservation needed on a Sunday night for a great seat but it was still hopping.  Ordered from Happy Hour menu and the regular one, they have a great happy hour.  Polenta fries with marinara-Loved!  Steak bites-Loved!  Not a huge order but just right. Black bean soup-comes in a chicken type broth with veggies, was not what we expected but better-so delicious. Burger on lettuce with white cheddar, onion jam and avacado was excellent!   Consistently exceed expectations, not the usual run of the mill options so we always feel happily surprised, and you can't beat the great atmosphere and service.   This is a great first date place, casual dinner, group of friends or special event (smallish groups) location.  They fall somewhere between the cheap eats and the mid range.  You can get a good burger for $13.50 or a steak plate for between $19-26.

TITLE: Fantastic | TEXT: We have been here a few times and the food is amazing, and cooked fresh. The  staff is very friendly and you get great service. We would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone.

TITLE: Farm to table done right | TEXT: Amazing farm to table restaurant with rotating menu based on seasonal ingredients. You can‚Äôt go wrong with the pork chop and ceviche but the real star was the cast iron corn bread. Drinks on great as well, highly recommend

TITLE: A little oasis after a bad day! | TEXT: We enjoyed everything about this place! The ambience, the architecture, the decor, the seating, the food, the wine and the service!  We had the farm greens salad and the buttermilk dressing was amazing.  Then the papardelle and the risotto.  Both delicious.  Kekoa was our server and he was just the perfect mix of intelligence, humor, knowledge (everything from the risotto to the jazz playlist) and discretion.  End of a horrible travel day for us that was all but forgotten as we soaked up all the goodness of this restaurant/bar.  We will be back.

TITLE: Museum and House Tour Make this a fun Visit | TEXT: A visit to this presidential library comprises three potential activities.  First, there is an hour long tour of his house.  Second, the main building includes a small exhibition of his time as President.  Lastly, a mile from the library is his memorial.  We spent just under two hours here.

TITLE: Don‚Äôt hesitate -  visit The Grange soon! | TEXT: We plan time to come here every time we are in Sacramento. The food, service and ambiance are all excellent! Even when we order something like a classic breakfast, it‚Äôs amazing. My brunch frittata was just delicious!!

TITLE: Very disappointed, not worth the trip | TEXT: We went for a birthday celebration and was very disappointed in the slow service and lack of knowledge of the server. order chilled seafood platter, steak and lobster and oyster rock fellows, the steak came first and waited a while before the chilled seafood plater came out and the oyster appetizer never came before our meals. the oysters on the chilled plate had lots of sand and shells in it and the steak was so so. The manager asked how your dinner was and told him of the problems and he did not say sorry or make any adjustment. All in all very disappointed birthday celebration
TITLE: Great place | TEXT: Excellent food and excellent service. The menu had all the right notes and did it very well. The Osso buco and the salmon were perfect.

TITLE: Best of the best | TEXT: This is the, not one of, but the finest restaurant in the country.  It's every bit as creative as a 3 star restaurant in France.  Corey Lee's melding of local ingredients with Asian fusion sauces, marinades and soups are so brilliant.  It is costly as one would expect a 3 star Michelin to be, but worth it.  The service is perfect, attentive without being cloying. I cannot recommend it more highly. We've lived in France many times, and I feel that we're blessed to have such a treasure locally.

TITLE: Fabulous TIME as always! | TEXT: Canada Berries has professional and knowledgable staff who are friendly and customer service oriented. They patiently waited on my friend and I and introduced 9 different types of wine for us to taste and informed us what types of food goes with each fruit wine, and the health benefits of each fruit. The wine is delicious, I really liked Blueberry and Raspberry wine. The location is also a great meeting space with a second floor which hosted an investor presentation that I attended last year. It is spacious and got a big TV with tables and chairs so it was perfect. I also attended a Chinese New Year festival several years ago there with over 1,000 people in attendance with lots of live entertainment under big tents with proper stage, and lots of vendors. It has a big parking lots and it's all free so it's a fantastic venue. I highly recommend this winery. I have given out many of their wine as gifts, and people really like it!
TITLE: Nice simple place. | TEXT: We had a table outside in this relatively quiet street. Good club sandwich and fries. Excellent salad. Nice evening with the family.

TITLE: Barely worth the price | TEXT: Oyster appetizer was really good. Chicken and snapper entrees were 5 out of 5s. Atmosphere was 5 out of 5. Our friends got the duck and really liked it. I thought it was tough but am not an aficionado. Service was 5 out of 5.

TITLE: Consistently delicious food made with seasonal ingredients, tasty cocktails, and great service! | TEXT: I‚Äôve been here 6-7 times now over the last year, at least twice by myself just for the kale salad. I‚Äôve brought out of town guests here as well as local friends and it‚Äôs been consistently delicious: the meal, the cocktails, and the service (we love Spencer!)‚Ä¶and we‚Äôll keep coming back!

TITLE: 2 spilled drinks by waiter, no apologies | TEXT: We‚Äôve been here quite a few times and have always had really good service, friendly older, and great experience. We went this past Sunday after church with our two kids 20 and 11 years old.  Got seated, ordered our drinks and we went up to the salad bar. When we got back to the table sat down they brought our drinks. One guy sat down my son drink, and it spilled all over the table. They moved everything from the center of the table, put down a towel and blotted  up what they could of the Coke and then another or a girl came around to my side between me and my daughter and she picked the glass up off the tray and I guess the tray was not centered and a whole cup of beverage spilled between me and my daughter on the floor it splattered on her brand new UGG shoes.  Now with what happened you would have thought they were going to either offer free dessert or comp the meal. Nope. Nothing.  This is not the experience you want your customers to have is it?

TITLE: Bday Dinner | TEXT: While visiting Portland for my wife's bday, we came here for dinner because it was recommended by a Lyft driver. Upon walking in, we were greeted very warmly with smiles. We were immediately seated. The waitress was very pleasant. I can't remember her name, but she was young with blonde hair and a facial piercing. She provided her recommendations by request. It took us a min to figure out what we wanted, but she was very patient.  We ordered the BBQ fried rice and boneless chicken thighs. It all came out hot and tasty. For dunks, we ordered Makers Mark whiskey with coke ave cherries and a tequila well drink. Both were delicious. We spoke to our waitress about how our time has been in Portland. She was very friendly. We ended the night with a special boozy slushy shot that she had made for my wife to help celebrate her bday. She put a candle in it and all. We loved that gesture!!!!  We highly reccomend this spot. Oh.. the ambiance was nice as well.

TITLE: Embarrassing Customer Service | TEXT: At about 1:30 this afternoon I visited the store on March Lane with my wife and got a cup of coffee I sat in the lobby for one hour drinking the coffee and I decided to get a refill I went to the register and asked the lady at the register whose name I don‚Äôt know to give me a refill but to my surprise she told me that I was not sitting in the lobby so she told me she couldn‚Äôt give me one I told her a couple of times that I was sitting in the lobby but still she didn‚Äôt believe me she went in and asked a colleague in the back room and the colleague confirmed that I came earlier and I was sitting in the lobby  That was very embarrassing  A manager came and apologised about what happen  I felt so embarrassed that I used to visit that store everyday but not anymore  My name is Jihad Basma and my phone number number is 2093199098

TITLE: Huge breakfast | TEXT: We‚Äôve been here several times over the years and it‚Äôs always been great. Portions are huge and easily splittable. My wife and I split an omelette and along with the potatoes and toast we couldn‚Äôt finish it. Service was great. Our server was very friendly, helpful, personable, always there with more coffee, and didn‚Äôt rush us. We were at a family gathering so our server knew we had a lot of talking and catching up to do. It was a great experience and we‚Äôll be back again.

TITLE: Cozy restaurant near Washington Square. | TEXT: We were in town to celebrate my wife's birthday. We tried this restaurant on a recommendation from my boss. The food was delicious. I had the Branzino and Broccoli, my wife had the Roasted Chicken and Gnocchi. We shared the the Chocolate Pudding cake which was delicious also. My wife really like the bread plates on each table. Each plate was different from the next and look like someone went searching thru some antique shops to pick them out. We ate inside because it was a little to windy to try the patio but it looked really and cozy.
TITLE: Mince | TEXT: The worst of the worst, absolutely gash. The staff are useless. Holding up cash to buy a simple carry out and ignored for 20 minutes.

TITLE: Fabulous Drag Brunch! | TEXT: We had a fabulous Drag Brunch! Performers were really amazing and absolutely stunning and the food & service was superb! Will definitely recommending it to all my friends! Shared this fun experience on my YouTube Channel @Rob Mahor if anyone wanna see it:) It was the best!
TITLE: Maximo! | TEXT: Amazing experience! Every plate a different surprise, my favorite was Cia Modena and the e Tortellini. Also, Gian Luca was a wonderful waiter who guided the whole experience.

TITLE: Always delightful staff! | TEXT: The food is delicious,  no doubt. What is extra special is the attentive, knowledgeable and really pleasant staff. Always makes us feel like we are the entire focus of our waiter's attention.

TITLE: Subpar | TEXT: Arrived to be seated near a birthday party going. While it wasn't the birthday party's fault, I think the party should have been held somewhere away from regular diners. They were loud and celebrating which was expected but again why have a party of 30 ppl in the center of a restaurant? After the party, the clean up consists of hitting the pillows loudly, moving furniture, and carrying long wooden tables over the heads of diners while we ate- (extremely dangerous) The food was subpar, (ordered the curry shrimp, salmon was the end of the fish with brown parts under, ravioli was like 12 pieces, the side (spicy yellow rice was hard). The food was not to Cipirani standards NYC or Dubai location. The view-  obstructed by plastic wrapped windows and no seating in a the patio space. The restaurant was cramped, tiny tables, low back chairs. I think the restaurant could have so much potential. Go to Casa Tua in Brickell for better Italian food and bypass this Cipirani. This location should be closed.

TITLE: Anniversary Dinner | TEXT: We were very excited to have dinner at Wa‚Äôz because our son took his girlfriend there for their anniversary and said it was amazing. The food was fabulous!  Every plate felt like a piece of art. Chef, and his team, was friendly and polite, as you would expect from a Japanese restaurant. We shared a Saki tasting, which was plenty for the two of us, and we loved the beautiful saki cups. Each one was so unique. Our only criticism is that the meal felt really rushed. We were seated at 8pm, served 10 courses and were done by 9.30!  We sat at the chef‚Äôs counter, and everyone was served each dish at the same time, so it wasn‚Äôt just that we were eating fast. It was an expensive evening, so I would have liked to linger.  On the bright side, we were given a little bouquet for our anniversary.
TITLE: The Best Mexican Food Around | TEXT: The food is great!  The amount of food is amazing.  Take your appetite with you.  The menu variety is excellent.  I love this place!

TITLE: Excellent restaurant choice near Fisherman's Wharf | TEXT: Pier Market Seafood is located on the waterfront about halfway down Pier 39. The tables look out to the waterfront for a lovely dinner setting. My wife and I enjoyed a delicious ceviche appetizer and then salmon and cioppino entrees, followed by two desserts that included ice cream on the side (we are ice cream junkies!). Service was professional, and the prices were very fare for the quality and setting. We would certainly return on our next trip to San Francisco (we go about every ten years!).

TITLE: Never rated a business so low in my life‚Ä¶ | TEXT: We were enjoying some food and a drink earlier this evening and upon attempting to order a fernet to finish off our meal,  the bartender asked who was driving and wouldn‚Äôt let us place the order. No one was drunk, we were peacefully enjoying our treats, I hadn‚Äôt even drank 20% of my drink.  She may have been going through something personal because when I asked her name, she raised her eyebrows, swung her head, and raised her voice to say, ‚ÄúWould you just like to talk to the manager?!‚Äù We accepted the offer, but regardless, will never return. So sad.  When we first arrived and ordered our initial drinks, the patrons that left the seats we took were bragging about drinking a whole bottle of Don Julio 70 between the two of them along with the same bar tender. At that point, the bartender accidentally took our full drinks and dumped them. So we mentioned the error and she supplied replacements. As I said, I didn‚Äôt drink mine and my husband finished his by the time of her episode.  The manager explained they had just had some ABC training and they were buckling down. This would be entirely understandable. However, the bar tender‚Äôs  judgement was misplaced and targeted. That, in addition to her horrendous decorum, has destroyed the establishment‚Äôs rapport with us.

TITLE: Great service | TEXT: My friends and I met at Rue for drinks after a concert at Voodoo Doughnuts. The service was outstanding and we were allowed to just have drinks, though the menu looked quite intriguing. We ordered the almonds with rosemary and smoked beef fat, and they were to die for.

TITLE: Poor service.  Steak frites was too tough to eat.  Waiter and manager were not helpful.  They sat us outside when hot | TEXT: Poor service from both manager and waiter.  Steak frites was too tough to eat.  It was very hot and they could not get the fans on us and would not seat us inside.  There were many open tables inside so could have been a racial thing

TITLE: A rare disappointment by a reliable chain | TEXT: On my way out of town stopped for lunch before 5 hours of I-10 was in my future.  Service was great as usual.  But food was only average and I probably should have sent it back.  Started with the Chili, only available on Saturday.  Pretty good but a bit thinner than I prefer.  Id had it a few weeks ago at J Alexander in Atlanta and it was more hearty and thicker. Just a preference.   The French Dip was my entree, it was not great.  Bread was borderline stale and the roast beef was loaded with gristle and fat.  I only ate half.  Maybe just a bad day and it was after 2pm so kitchen was not at full strength but the restaurant was at least half full so business was good.   I‚Äôll go back but I‚Äôll be more quick to reject a poor entree this time.

TITLE: Nice vibe, food was disappointing | TEXT: The vibe is really lovely in the restaurant, and it‚Äôs one of the busiest in Austin too. However we felt that the food was average at best - we had to send back both of our sides as they arrived before the entrees and were both cold! The service was also very slow, and food took ages to come. Nice vibe, but not worth it for the price and the wait.

TITLE: Good place for wings | TEXT: This is for the location on Beechmont ave. It‚Äôs been a few years since I‚Äôve been to this location. We were there on a Saturday evening and it didn‚Äôt appear to be really busy, but steady. Our order of  wings were hot and done just right as were the onion rings. They had plenty of help and our waitress was attentive at the right times. So we had a really good experience. My only knock is this, it‚Äôs rather noisy to the point of making conversation a little tough.
TITLE: Great food! | TEXT: This is our go-to location for Mexican Food. best in Stockton! This is located downtown. They make the best flour tortillas.

TITLE: Exceptional knowledge provided, kindness and a very professional crew. | TEXT: Unforgettable experience. The knowledge shared by sme‚Äôs was invaluable. The world needs Crow Canyon!   The expertise and educational opportunities provided by the center was exceptional. I highly recommend trips with Crow Canyon often.

TITLE: Do Not Stay Here! | TEXT: Hotel is old, in a terrible part of town.  Rooms not cleaned , trash on floors, mold in windows and curtains raggedy and unable to close.  It appears homeless people are living there and hanging outside. Very unsafe and not worth the money  at all.   Could not wait to leave.  Best thing there is the front desk employees.

TITLE: Perfect place to kick back and chill | TEXT: Me and my boyfriend went back to this hotel after a previous visit. 2 years ago. The hotel is mainly occupied by Russians and Egyptians, which is perfectly fine for us because we spend more time outside of the hotel than we did in the hotel. The food is ok and the chefs are willing to provide you with an alternative if you do not like what they have cooked. The staff are all lovely and the room was decent (they gave us the same room as the first time). Overall a nice chilled place.
TITLE: Awesome place! | TEXT: Staff are friendly! Good food! Good beer!! This place is amazing.  Haven‚Äôt try the 2 liter challenge yet but getting there.

TITLE: Top dinner experience in Northern California. | TEXT: My wife had wanted to go here for awhile,  since she is a vegan and they vegan options. She couldn‚Äôt decide among the various choices, so I suggested the two person tasting menu. They created and vegan masterpiece. The variety of flavors was amazing. Some of the offerings were among the best food I have ever had, vegan or otherwise.  This place is a gem and we had one of the best dinner experiences ever! We did not have wine with dinner, so if that is important, check out the wine list ahead of time. Our only complaint was that there was too much food, but that was erased when we enjoyed a nice lunch of left overs the next day. Finally, for those who love meat, as the name suggests, they have many other choices besides vegan. Try this place and I bet it becomes a regular dinner spot for you and your loved ones.

TITLE: Truly Unique and Delicious | TEXT: This was the best restaurant experience my wife and I had in a while.  The experience was top notch from arrival to departure. Service was friendly, helpful,and attentive. Food was imaginative, beautifully cooked and presented.  Every dish, from amuse bouche to dessert had interesting flavors, quality ingredients, and lovely presentation. No dish was like anything we‚Äôve had anywhere else. This is a kitchen with a truly unique (and delicious) point of view.
TITLE: Awesome front desk | TEXT: The staff at front desk is outstanding. Especially Tatiana, and her associate. They adjusted our 3rd party booking like true professionals.
TITLE: Nice cozy Resturant | TEXT: the atmosphere was nice and cozy  , sea food is cooked very well and the service was really nice and friendly . it is a BYOB restaurant

TITLE: Subpar at best | TEXT: I don‚Äôt understand where all these great reviews are coming from, but don‚Äôt be fooled like I was. First of all, the service was subpar. We asked our server repeatedly for a baby booster seat and she never brought it, so I finally had to get up and look for where they were kept. She also didn‚Äôt bring the juice we ordered for our toddler till the end of the meal. Have you ever dealt with a thirsty toddler? Not good. Also, we ordered bottomless mimosas and only got one refill, after asking repeatedly for it. Our glasses were empty most of the meal. Now the food. We ordered eggs Benedict and the eggs were hard boiled, served over stale bread with just a little bit of hollandaise. It was gross. The only good food was the side of bacon we ordered for our toddler. Overall this was by far the worst restaurant experience I have ever had, especially because it ruined Father‚Äôs Day for my husband.

TITLE: Best taste Seafood in town ! | TEXT: We‚Äôre inviting by friends to check on this Seafood Restaurant. We were surprised by the food!! Great food ü•ò Good service !!  Definitely will Be backüòò
TITLE: Jeju Spirited Garden | TEXT: Well worth a visit if you're in Jeju, South Korea.  Sang Bum Young pictured here,  is the creator of this Bonsai garden. It had taken him 57 years to create.

TITLE: Nice, but not great | TEXT: It was a little out of the way from where we were staying.  Our initial waitress obviously did not know much about the menu.  She gave us incorrect responses to our questions.  Upon entering we were asked in a rather abrupt way to show our vaccination cards - we all 6 had these, but it was not done in a very nice manner.  Dinner was good - not great.  I would not tell someone to waste their dining experience here, especially given the wait staff.

TITLE: Don't order curries from the buffet menue | TEXT: Ordered food from the buffet menu for my husbands birthday party. Was horrified to find that the curries were just cause with no meat. Phoned round all the guests incase it was just me that got no meat but all said that there wasn't any in the curries. I was mortified. Phoned to complain and was told manager would phone me next day. Stil waiting for the call but guess it isn't coming any time soon. Was a valued customer of 13 years. Won't go back. Con artists!
TITLE: Nice small family restaurant | TEXT: This is a nice fast sea food restaurant. Service is very friendly and quality of food is good. Prices are reasonable.

TITLE: Loyal to my party. | TEXT: After having lunch there, I was told by a friend they would not let the Democratic Party meet in their dining room.  I wish I would have known this.  Will not go there again.

TITLE: Worst Dining Experience | TEXT: I called ahead and was told outdoor seating is available on a first come first server basis.  Upon arrival I was greeted by a bearded gentleman in a sports coat who informed me that outdoor seating was not available for at least 30 minutes despite the fact that I could see three empty tables.  When I informed him that I would be happy to wait he told me to go ahead and leave and come back in 30 minutes and if a table is available at that time, he would let me know.  He was very condescending in his tone the entire time.  Since they were booked for seats at least 2 weeks out I decided to stay so I could experience the food.  I ordered a pasta dish and it was absolutely delicious.  The waiter was pleasant.  I plan to return back to this restaurant multiple times and leave similar feedback if I have a like-kind experience.

TITLE: Overrated restaurant | TEXT: Quite disappointed tbh. Nothing special; service was fair but not great. I had a Calle Ocho Special sandwich, the bacon was almost inexistent it was a joke. It comes with french fries, I asked to change with another side I was told I could not when it‚Äôs just fries‚Ä¶coming with a sandwich so clearly it is possible, they just didn‚Äôt want to. The fries were not even good or fresh they look the same as at McDonalds. Plantains were okay but I‚Äôve had better they were not even hot. The only great thing was the cafe cubano.
TITLE: Delicious | TEXT: My Swai fish sandwich was delicious and our server was amazing. She made some great suggestions as she knew I had no clue what to order.  She even had us sign the wall.

TITLE: Outstanding! | TEXT: The kaiseki dinner at Wa'z is one of the best dining experiences I've had. Service was attentive and each course as well as the paired sakes were explained. If Seattle had Michelin stars, this restaurant would be on their list.   We were lucky to sit at the counter and were able to watch as dishes were prepared. There were eight courses that were paced well over about two hours. For me, the highlights included Copper River salmon sashimi, wagyu that melted in your mouth, grilled eel, and tuna nigiri, but each course was fantastic. The chef and other staff spoke to us about the provenance of the food as well as providing stories/history on why we were eating certain items.  At $600+ for dinner for two (including alcohol), this is a special occasion restaurant, but the experience was worth it.

TITLE: Beyond incredible, one of the best dining experiences ever! | TEXT: There are not enough superlatives to describe our dining experience at Eem.  The White curry with Brisket Burnt-ends was absolutely superb, the Massaman curry with smoked lamb shoulder was beyond incredible, the Very Spicy Papaya Salad was delightful (and a good challenge to any pepper heads) and the Thai-style Ceviche provided an exemplary presentation and tasting of kanpachi.  You could really sense that the entire restaurant staff from greeters to servers to line cooks and chefs were committed to providing a memorable dining experience.   We can't wait to go back and try out the other menu items!

TITLE: Nothing spectacular | TEXT: The restaurant is in an older building that is looking tired inside (and that's different than vintage). It doesn't really have any identifiable appeal. However, the food was good and everyone seemed to enjoy their meals. Many people took advantage of the "dine in Portland" $33 - 3 course special. I had crab cakes that were very tasty. Brussel sprout appetizers and the fresh bread were both fabulous.

TITLE: Riff of Miami not nice | TEXT: I hope you read my review before you eat and not after as i did. Food average Told Happy hour ..but 2 beers still cost ‚Ç¨ $25 for 2 beers. Service 20% and we were shouted at tat we had to pay it. Not a good example of how to treat customers in your town AVOID AVOID AVOID. This has left a very bad impression of your town and your restaurant.   Rip off

TITLE: Great neighborhood spot to grab a bite | TEXT: We have eaten here several times for a Hicks meal or dessert.  This restaurant has a wide variety of delicious food from hamburgers to Asian stew over rice.  Plus they have specialty coffees, ice cream and baked goods.  There is something on their menu to satisfy everyone‚Äôs palate.

TITLE: Perfect ! | TEXT: One of the most beautiful restaurants I‚Äôve been to. Perfect rooftop location and great atmosphere.. Drinks and food were outstanding. This was my favorite dining experience on my trip to Boston. I will definitely be back.

TITLE: Inattentive time wasters | TEXT: I sat at the bar but was not told that the hostess seats people at the bar.  I waited 10 minutes watching the bartender ignore me.  Then I asked for a table and had to wait longer.  I spent 15 minutes waiting for anyone to acknowledge me.  This used to be a nice place but they went downhill fast!  My waitress apologized and I finally got my order in, but now I know where not to go if I am looking for a place that does not treat customers like trash.

TITLE: Overrated | TEXT: When we arrived we had to wait for our table which we didnt mind and was told to wait at the bar, but this was soooo busy and struggled to get to the bar. Kids sat at the bar too which we didnt like. Got our table which was near the bar and had people banging into us. My partner asked the woman at the reservations desk if we could move to the other table of two which had just been set up and got told if we want to wait an hour and  a half for a new table then we can but otherwise we had no choice but to sit there!!!! We was not happy about this as she was rude with it. Our server was lovely couldnt fault her (didnt catch her name) and the food was average. Once we got our bill we was shocked at the price as we have had nicer and better service for less.

TITLE: Awesome Food, Awesome People | TEXT: Stopped in today for lunch.  The people were super nice and very accommodating for my handicapped brother.  We ordered and sat down.  They brought our soft drinks to us.  After a little while out came my brother's "club" sandwich on Dutch Crust which he loved.  His garlic fries looked so good I had to try them.  Terrific.  I had heard about the "A Plate Above" meal and had to try it.  It came out and to my surprise it actually looked bigger and better than I had expected.  My three items were Kalbi short ribs, Teriyaki beef steak, and deep fried shrimp all serve on a bed of white rice with a side of mac salad.  It was a fantastic meal for only $13.95.  I could only eat half before getting full.  We were checked on at least twice to see if we need anything by a smiling young lady.  Once the boss came out to tell us about the deals they are having for vets on Veterans Day.  He was all smiles too... as were we.  I live 50 miles away and I may become a steady customer!
TITLE: Quick bite | TEXT: A quick bite and drinks in the bar area. Service was top notch. No issues.  Nothing special but easy if you are a guest of the hotel.
TITLE: Great hotel stay! | TEXT: Microtel is conveniently located near Mohegan Sun casino.  The hotel is quiet, very clean and comfortable. Staff are always friendly.

TITLE: Not bad for authentic. | TEXT: Has changed a lot over the years, but not bad.  Too much gravy, and gravy mixed with too much flour.  Service was slow considering the amount of patrons...not many either time.  Overpriced for the quality.

TITLE: Prioritize my bladder!!!! | TEXT: Hello,  I regret  to inform you that your staff needs to be engaged in coaching, due to the lack of attention to a female and I needing to use the restrooms after multiple attempts to utilize them. I was ignored by the first female and was given a puzzled look that they can't be opened. After I went around to seek attention from the other staff she rudely stated both bathrooms are not available, after I asked why she said " they just are ". I asked to see what would cause them to be unusable but could only feel discriminated as she added no urgency to the issue. She then asked if I was management to even request to see the inside of the bathrooms. As a LONG TIME CUSTOMER. I suggest to keep your client based loyal to address this issue as it leaves a bad image on the franchise. I left feeling "I didn't have it my way ". And that's just a bowl movement. Thank you for your time and I hope this matter has been addressed the next time I pass by the store as I will try to obtain pictures of the staff reluctant to assist.¬†  Best regards,  JJ.

TITLE: More cities should have a Reading Terminal with its excellent regional food choices and great prices | TEXT: I love coming to the Reading Terminal Market with the great selection of food stalls and the sights and smells as you walk around. I love their selections and the interaction between the locals and tourists when people are ordering.   Some of my favorite places to eat in Philly are here with Dutch Eating Place, Beilers Bakery and Bassetts Ice Cream. When Carmine‚Äôs was open, that used to be my favorite place for Cheesesteaks. After a meal, I like to walk around and look at the food displays. Everyone merchandises their food so nicely.  Don‚Äôt miss a visit here when you are visiting Philly.

TITLE: Outstanding Place for Breakfast/Brunch | TEXT: The Dutch has changed a bit since some of these pictures.  It has upgraded the atmosphere, and the food continues to be outstanding. The wait staff is fast, friendly and efficient.  We had a egg white omelet and 3-Egg breakfast.  I recommend the sausage; its some of the best I've have had in a while (but spicy).   Great local place, quiet and good for talking.

TITLE: Excellent Flavor | TEXT: The service was highly attentive and the food items that we had the watermelon salad and the lamb meatballs were both really creative and tasted excellent. I recommend it for this. It‚Äôs also extremely close to high-end shopping and strolling around.

TITLE: DON‚ÄôT Do it. | TEXT: Awful food. Overpriced.  Their chicken Parmesan is easy to replicate.  Take a chicken breast, bread it, burn it in a pan (yes. Extra crispy), throw a can of tomato paste on it (generic can damaged from multiple floor drops) over cheese the top, add some spaghetti on the sides (like 1/2 the normal side portion), and BAMM‚Äîyou saved 24 bucks.  Oh...make sure you have TUMS for the blowback later that night.   Mic drop!
TITLE: So so experience | TEXT: Flavors are nice. Rations sizes  are tiny.  Octopus overcook and cold  Nice atmosphere in a snail place  You shall book your visit

TITLE: Delicious and very reasonably priced | TEXT: The front door is a little hard to see, but glad we found it. The food was spectacular! I got the Sea of Indochine and it was loaded with fresh seafood . My husband got green curry and lived it. Spice level 4 was perfect for us. Great ambiance, great service.

TITLE: Great restaurant | TEXT: What a lovely restaurant.. attentive staff, great atmosphere and FOOD!  Lots of it and perfectly cooked..  Grilled lamb (which was like a casserole) with rice, hot meze platter, lamachun,  and flat bread with dips. A glass of wine and a beer. At ¬£50 it was  great value too!

TITLE: Town Secret | TEXT: Hidden gem! Great Mom & Pop owned business. Mom is out front greeting, smiling and taking orders and serving. After your order is taken, if necessary, Pop will talk to you from the kitchen to ask, " Would you like onions on that?"  "Did you watch the game yesterday?" "Hey there! I  haven't seen you in a while. How are you?" The food is as good as the owners! The fried spare ribs are the bomb!! I have seen the police, fire departments, teachers and students there. It was a Florida Caverns ranger who told me that I had to try their food.  I keep going back!

TITLE: Authentic Kaiseki Course Dinner in Downtown Seattle | TEXT: Wa'z offers Michelin level kaiseki cuisine, which is an artistic and traditional style of multi-course cooking from Japan, probably Kyoto.  The January 8 course menu was highlighted by a dish with New Year offerings of kazunoko (herring eggs), datemaki (rolled egg dish), grilled fish and a sashimi roll. This course meal progresses with sashimi and other types of seafood. A5 Wagyu is featured twice.  The white miso ozoni was very good and in middle courses, the Chef serves a sampler of pressed sushi and aged tuna nigiri.    If you choose counter seating, you can see the Chef and his colleagues at work.  The preparation unfolds before your eyes and it made me appreciate how much skill is involved with the presentation.  The dinner lasted 90 to 100 minutes and my group left fully satisfied.
TITLE: Fantastic brunch spot | TEXT: This was probably our favourite meal in San Francisco‚Ä¶ great range of brunch options and fantastic friendly service- highly recommend

TITLE: Best taste Seafood in town ! | TEXT: We‚Äôre inviting by friends to check on this Seafood Restaurant. We were surprised by the food!! Great food ü•ò Good service !!  Definitely will Be backüòò

TITLE: Perfect dinner spot | TEXT: This was a perfect dinner spot after the show at Preservation Hall Jazz. We ate upstairs and would have enjoyed the balcony but skipped it because of the rain when we were there.

TITLE: Brilliant. Best steak ever. | TEXT: This restaurant has lovely view of the harbour from the terrace. The staff are very attentive and friendly. All areas pleasant and very clean. The food was delicious the best steaks we have had during our holiday, husband enjoyed the mash potatoes üòã nice change from chips.
TITLE: Simply Philadelphia's Finest. | TEXT: I've eaten here 5 times. Each time the meal has been perfect and the service simply outstanding. It's my go to fine dining experience in Philly.

TITLE: Highly recommend the 7 course chef‚Äôs tasting menu! | TEXT: We 3 had the 7 course chef‚Äôs tasting menu and we shared a bottle of wine. The sommelier did a great job recommending a wine that would work well with the range of flavors. It did go very well with the meal which was outstanding. The food was wonderful and beautifully presented. The service was outstanding. We had a terrific evening.

TITLE: Perfect Spot in Rittenhouse SQ | TEXT: Food was exceptional. Staying in Center City / Rittenhouse SQ and Google Best Restaurants near me turns up lots of options. This place did not disappoint. Fig & Ricotta salad plus their Rotolo pasta dish were just right. Certainly give them a try. Had no reservation, I just sat at a bar side table, it was a Sunday however.

TITLE: Excellent brunch | TEXT: We went there for brunch before a matinee, expecting a coffee shop. Boy were we surprised. The decorations are charmingly rustic, the server we had was very friendly and helpful. The food‚Ä¶ ah yes, the food. It was superb. I had a porchetta hash with eggs, one of us had the chillaquilles, and the third of us had eggs Benedict, with porchetta. All were pronounced excellent. We‚Äôll certainly be back after discovering this treasure.

TITLE: Dining experience out the window | TEXT: I was in the restaurant industry for a decade bw 2000-2010.  It was all about customer service, timing the meals properly and the dining experience. I was front and back of the house. I let it slide that this place did all bottled cocktails??  Bc I was so excited to see my friend. But no bar to make a proper drink-noted. Then upon arrival‚Ä¶..we were notified that there was a reservation 1.5 hours later so essentially ‚Äúdon‚Äôt hurry but hurry up.‚Äù  Slightly off putting but We agreed and got back to our bottled Negronis. Then not even 10 minutes later, another staff member came by and asked if we made any decisions. We hadn‚Äôt yet. She then told us ‚Äúwe just want to make sure we‚Äôre on the same page that there are people coming at 7:30.‚Äù  That was it. Bill please?  We were done. Timing tables is a bogus thing that happened in the hospitality industry. Until these folks figure out how to manage it better?  Don‚Äôt bother.

TITLE: Isolated and enigmatic- a good addition to a 'Desert Castle' tour | TEXT: Not much to see and not a lot is known about the site. It is thought it was a caravanserai. While named 'Qasr' (castle) the towers are solid and the slits in the walls unsuitable for arrows but useful for ventilation. I visited as part of a tour group- one of 3 sites visited under the 'Desert Castles' label as half a day trip.  The ride from Amman to the Qasr/s is flat desert and military sites with the occasional camel to spot and the 'castles' are easily spotted from the road. Each has their own point of interest. You can explore the many rooms of the caravanserai, peek out into the desert, imagine the travellers who may have journied here, consider how different the location must have been in less arid days. A lonely location- not something to make a special trip to on its own, but as part of a tour of similar structures it is a nice day out.

TITLE: Barton G‚Äôs should be ashamed | TEXT: This restaurant was once spectacular, just like their website touts but now it is extremely old and worn out.  The food is basic.  The service was fine but management didn‚Äôt care.  I was expecting Hollywood and Disney and all I got was a traveling carnival.  No wonder they are closing

TITLE: Good Tex-Mex in Dripping Springs, TX | TEXT: Verde's delivers quality Tex-Mex food.  Another good meal enjoyed recently...  the complimentary chips and salsa are da bomb!  Light crisp chips, and the salsa tastes like it just came out of the garden... super fresh ingredients!   We had a couple of the "Lime in the Coconut" cocktails, reminiscent of a pina colada, but better, and not too sweet.  Very good.  For food, we settled on the  pollo flautas (chicken flautas) and the fish tacos.  Both were very good, and the flautas were some of the best we've ever had.  The tacos were stuffed full of fish and fresh veggies.  We sat at the bar this visit, and the bartender was super-busy, so not much time to visit.  Recommend Verde's for good Tex-Mex in the Dripping Springs area.

TITLE: Best breakfast with most awesome everything! | TEXT: Great family experiencence with personalized treatment, awesome coffee choices and best grits plus home made fresh bagels. Stopping there on way back to get a take home order of bagels and lunch!

TITLE: You will NOT find clich√© menu offerings here! | TEXT: I researched both State Bird Provisions and The Progress and we selected The Progress for our dinner while visiting San Francisco for 2 nights. We love restaurants that are trying new things and The Progress delivered! We shared 5 dishes and then ordered two desserts, and we enjoyed every morsel. It was enough food for me, but my husband was still a little hungry when we left (he grabbed an apple back at the hotel) so perhaps we should have ordered another dish or even the duck‚Äîwhich was a lot of food but looked crispy and spectacular. Our favorites were the Tuna Crudo and the dramatic Brown Butter Seaweed Noodles, but truly everything was delicious.  This is a special occasion experience, so it is pricey, but its worth it to sample innovative  and sustainable food. I am not posting food pictures because mine did not do the food justice due to the lighting, but the presentations were lovely and creative.

TITLE: Fun and Funky Tex Mex | TEXT: The sign is hilarious.  The location has two patios and an interior dining room.  Lots of open air seating for those concerned about disease prevention.  The menu is typical tex mex, with some surprises.  I really enjoyed the green mole and enchiladas.  Zoe was helpful, efficient and eager to be of assistance.  The prices were very reasonable for downtown Austin.
TITLE: Romantic dinner | TEXT: Wonderful dinner and service.  The lamb chops were delicious and the presentation was wonderful. Great wine selection!

TITLE: Worth the visit!!! | TEXT: I was very impressed with the Warren G. Harding Presidential Sites.  We took the tour of his house, and listened first hand from the tour guides all about when Harding gave speeches on the "front porch".  The house is stunning and is 90+ percent original from years ago when Warren and his wife Florence lived in the house.  The tour guides can answer any questions you have off the top of their heads.  The  Library & Museum was finished in the spring of 2021 and they have a nice gift shop in there too.  They spared no expense in the construction of the building - it is beautiful!!!!  If you are a history buff, this is a must do.

TITLE: Great staff , food, and rooftop views | TEXT: A hotel staff member recommended this restaurant to us, and it was a great recommendation. There is a rooftop bar for appetizers and drinks, with great views, facing the river. (Rooftop opened after 4 pm)  The restaurant on lower level was open earlier in the day and has a nice outdoor patio, as well as inside seating.  The dinner prices are a bit on the higher side but the food and staff are wonderful. The menu is varied. It was my birthday and the staff surprised me with a birthday card signed by the whole staff. Very sweet and appreciated.  Cee cee  of the hostess station is a beautiful and delightful person. She made sure we had a great table. Our server on the rooftop, Vanessa, was fantastic. And our restaurant server, Cora, were all great. Thank you for making it a great night. All of our food was fantastic. I had the salmon, and it was great. The restaurant is perfect for casual, business, and special dining  occasions. I look forward to returning.

TITLE: Good artist but..... | TEXT: The bar is rather dirty - lots of sticky stuff around.  I also found the staff fairly indifferent to the customers.  After reading their FAQ on their website I should have anticipated the service.  Other bars in Chicago have good shows, in clean places with attentive staff.

TITLE: Disappointing Value | TEXT: We ended up paying an absurd amount for dishes that simply weren‚Äôt worth it. As the photos show, the presentation and portion sizes were underwhelming, and the overall experience didn‚Äôt justify the price. The only redeeming quality was the meat. Unfortunately, that alone doesn‚Äôt make up for the poor value for money.

TITLE: Unique experience with terrific food and showmanship owner | TEXT: Wonderful lamb loin, swordfish, salmon and veal.  Loved food creatively presented and delicious.  Best mashed potatoes ever.  Moderate wine prices and attentive service.  A Sacramento gem.

TITLE: Versailles Restaurant | TEXT: We went to the Versailles Restaurant to sample their legendary Cuban sandwich.  Cuban Sandwich Recipe -  roast pork, ham, Swiss cheese, pickles, and yellow mustard, pressed inside Cuban bread until the bread is crispy and the cheese is melted  It was delicious!

TITLE: Exceeded expectations | TEXT: Our first dining experience at the woolworth exceeded expectations. Both the food and drinks were excellent. Our server Brayan was fantastic both personable and attentive.

TITLE: Fantastic birthday celebration with family | TEXT: We celebrated my husband‚Äôs birthday and the experience was phenomenal. We have dined at Commander‚Äôs once before but we brought our two teenaged kids with us this time. They enjoyed the experience as much as we did! I called ahead to confirm this was a birthday celebration, so they made note of my husband‚Äôs name. When we arrived the host immediately wished him a happy birthday by name. Each person that interacted with our table wished him a happy birthday. We had impeccable service throughout the evening. The service staff are a well-oiled machine! We had an incredible meal and it was a special way to celebrate!

TITLE: Salt bombs | TEXT: Creative menu. Ordered halibut and ceviche and quesadilla and guacamole and several other items. The sea bass looked fantastic and flavors were promising. Big issue: everything was oversalted but a substantial amount. Most items were barely edible due to this. I came home and my heart was pounding. Avoid this place.  They seem to aim to kill you with salt.

TITLE: Extremely, extremely outdated | TEXT: The man at the front desk was very friendly, but besides that, there wasn't much that was great about this motel. I was a little scared at first, but was assured from people around the area that it's a safe place and town to stay. The motel is extremely, extremely outdated. The towels are very old and the pillows are very, very flat. Breakfast was advertised at the time of my booking this motel, but there wasn't any. This is budget friendly for sure, but that's probably the only plus regarding this motel.
TITLE: Food was mediocre. | TEXT: Food was mediocre and portions tiny. Wagyu beef and chicken skewers were chewy and very salty. Tempura cauliflower and dumplings were ok.

TITLE: Top Top Tapas | TEXT: We went with some local friends who have been multiple times and it was possibly the best Tapas I have had. Amazing knowledgeable staff who could not enough to help. Food sensational. So much flavour. We loved it.

TITLE: Fantastic San Francisco Lunch Spot with Top-Notch Hospitality | TEXT: We came here with a large group to celebrate a team member's promotion, and even though we hadn't given the restaurant a heads-up (on a busy Friday as Fleet Week was kicking off, no less!), the owner and her team couldn't have been more accommodating. The owner and her team welcomed us warmly, found space for our group, and made sure everyone was comfortable and well taken care of throughout the night. The service was attentive without being rushed, and you could tell they genuinely cared that we had a great experience.  They even brought out additional umbrellas and helped move them around to protect us from the bright sun that day. The atmosphere was lively and inviting--exactly what you want for a celebration--and the scenery, with that one-of-a-kind San Francisco backdrop, made it even better. A big thank you to the staff and owner for turning what could've been a logistical headache into a wonderful, memorable lunch for our team! We'll definitely be back.

TITLE: Barton G will exceed your expectations with Gusto | TEXT: If you are looking for an out of the ordinary dinner experience, Barton G is your place. Located in an adjacent street to Alton road. Its unassuming entrance does not give out what a gem is waiting for patrons. The reception was warm and inviting. They sat the 8 us of us fast and with a smile. Our host for the evening was Ronaldo and he was fantastic. The "experiential cuisine" was palpable and exhilarating. Every dish, from drinks, appetizers, entries and desserts we a work of art in themselves. The dishes were delicious and full of rich flavors. We were celebrating a birthday and it is a perfect place to have such celebration. Overall an A+++ experience.

TITLE: Def worth a visit! | TEXT: Well if you can‚Äôt find some food here, there is something wrong with you. All the local stuff you would expect plus bundles of ice cream, fresh meats and cheeses, and chocolate.  Well worth an hour of your time.

TITLE: Overpriced | TEXT: Wasn‚Äôt impressed with this place only went in for a drink. Had two local beers and one vodka was charged $46. Couldn‚Äôt even see receipt it was so light and didn‚Äôt get a proper receipt. Sent instagram msg but didn‚Äôt get reply. Complete rip off

TITLE: A nice cafe, a good but simple menu, not too large, and not too noisy. | TEXT: A friend went to Portland to visit family. They recommended that he and I meet at "The Observatory" on SE Stark Street. It is a small place, not at all noisy as I recall. I looked that the menu before I left to drive down to Portland. We got a booth by the front door, but it wasn't chilly (fall weather these days). My friend had an Elk Burger with cajin fries and an IPA beer. I had a Ruben sandwich with plain fries. Since I was driving home after lunch I stuck with water. I was quite pleased with my lunch, and the fries were the best fries that I have had in a long, long time. My friend praised the IPA on the first sip. He too liked his burger and fries.   We got there around 11:30 AM, and by noon all of the seating was occupied. The service was really great! There was not any kind of excess noise problem. I imagine some rowdy folks would come in from time to time, but the atmosphere was very nice during our visit.   Before we finished eating there was a small crowd gathered outside the door, waiting to get in. There was a crowd still there when we left. The servers didn't try to encourage us to leave, we left when we were ready.

TITLE: Best family style food for group brunch. | TEXT: We were here for a wedding brunch in the back and the staff couldn‚Äôt have been more accommodating. The food was excellent and we all enjoyed the brunch tremendously.

TITLE: Must try Yemeni food! | TEXT: This is a really fun place to try right in the heart of olde city on chestnut street.  Dense small dining room.  Exceptionally friendly service.  Very unusual menu and flavor profiles than any other place in Philly.  We shared all our dishes family style so got to try a lot.  Portions were very big. We had both signature chichen dishes.  Both were a bit dry and didn‚Äôt pop with flavor. The lamb haneeth though burst with flavor and the Yemeni egg and cheese might be the sleeper standout on the menu.  The hummus and falafel was a yummy app.  Prices are a bit high across the board. A must try but not a must repeat.

TITLE: More cities should have a Reading Terminal with its excellent regional food choices and great prices | TEXT: I love coming to the Reading Terminal Market with the great selection of food stalls and the sights and smells as you walk around. I love their selections and the interaction between the locals and tourists when people are ordering.   Some of my favorite places to eat in Philly are here with Dutch Eating Place, Beilers Bakery and Bassetts Ice Cream. When Carmine‚Äôs was open, that used to be my favorite place for Cheesesteaks. After a meal, I like to walk around and look at the food displays. Everyone merchandises their food so nicely.  Don‚Äôt miss a visit here when you are visiting Philly.

TITLE: Most amazing italian restaurant ever | TEXT: The pear pasta is so amazing it‚Äôs compelling me to write a good review.  This place never disappoints. The staff is very friendly and the food is absolutely delicious.  Once you come here you‚Äôll never go to any other italian spot.  This is THE BEST in Jax. 100%  Get the Pear Fiocchi.  Ur welcome

TITLE: defamation of character | TEXT: I came into station 16 today as I always do because this is one of my favorite restaurants to visit. My alcoholic beverage was watery and I sent it back. general manager RJ ( who refused to give me his real name who was rude) start talking stuff stating every time I come in here it's an issue and the last time I had an issue with the server. Mind you he was the server I complained about before he became general manager because when he was a server he had the same nasty attitude and I complained to his manager at the time and I'm sorry if a server is being rude to me im going to let upper management know that is my right and if my food comes out not good or cold as a PAYING customer I have a right to have them remake it never was rude always respectful. The fact that he stated this false accusation in front of other customers and staff badgering my character (that's defamation of character which my friend I was with recorded this) he made me feel so humiliated, uncomfortable and he embarrassed me! When I asked to speak with the chain of command he refused and stated with a smart gesture and said "he's the general manager and he's the last of the chain of command and if the owners want to call me they will and that's if the owner feels like calling me" and he will let them know it's always an issue which is very much false and I feel he's making this up to cover up his wrong doing and to retaliate against me for when I complained on him. Not only did he humiliated me but defamation of character, I will be taken this further more legally. The disrespect and attitude was uncalled for and very unprofessional and I will be taken actions all the way. Mind you I haven't been here in months because I had kidney surgery (life threatening) and was fighting for my life and came out to celebrate life and this how I'm treated. Run back the cameras and you will see how I was treated and how he humiliated me in front  of staff and customers because he wanted to retaliate. By him being a general manager he should of conducted hisself way better and professionally. He is in place to defuse any issues not make them worst and not to be rude or retaliate against me because he was complained on and now taken this personal. He approached my table with the smart remarks and my friend had me asked him again what he said so we can get it on recording and he did.
TITLE: Wine tasting | TEXT: Amazing wine and knowledable staff! Visited here with my family and really enjoyed our time here!! Highly recommended

TITLE: Outstanding in every way | TEXT: We had such a wonderful dinner at Lark.  Our server, Tessa, was so sweet and accommodating.  And the food was delicious.
