My wife and I shared the fried oysters and then we each ordered the spaghetti with crab.  Both were absolutely incredible.  We finished with the Peanut butter Panna Cotta which was also delicious.  Highly recommended.

TITLE: Cold food | TEXT: I must give up coming to this location!  They take the order so far from the pay window, approx 40+ cars in line.  By the time I get my hamburger it is COLD!  I have mentioned to order takers, no response from them.  If only, they would take orders when maybe 10 cars ahead!   I give up!

TITLE: Exquisite haute cuisine with impeccable service and wonderfully prepared dishes. | TEXT: Exquisite haute cuisine with impeccable service and wonderfully prepared dishes. The restaurant's decor is modern and chic, creating a relaxing atmosphere perfect.

TITLE: Great Food and service! | TEXT: Went by for first time last night with friends.I got the beef burrito supreme plate= excellent! Buddy got 6 tacos beef supreme= excellent! Now the other guy got pork carnitas,they werent so great.Just cooked pork, dry, most places have peppers and onions and such cooked with the pork.So my friend said next time he was getting the burritos! Lol- friendly folks- clean place- even the restrooms.I will go back!!
TITLE: Quality dining at a fair price. | TEXT: Our fish dinners were excellent and skinny bread sticks fun. The included gorgonzola salad dressing hit the mark. We like eating fish out.

TITLE: My new favorite restaurant. | TEXT: Wow! What an absolute gem. This restaurant is a total winner. The food is delicious, the service superb, the ambience perfect. Everything you would need for a wonderful meal out.

TITLE: Delicious Pasta and Great Atmosphere‚Äù | TEXT: Had a lovely dinner at Grotto during our time in Boston. We had the chicken parmigiana pasta and the pasta bolognese ‚Äî both were full of flavor and really satisfying. The atmosphere was warm and welcoming, the service was friendly, and prices felt fair for the quality. A great little spot for a relaxed Italian dinner.

TITLE: Avoid this place | TEXT: I visited Nusr-Et in Istanbul and had an excellent experience, so I was expecting something similar from this branch ‚Äî but it fell far short. The service was very poor, and the meal was wildly overpriced. The staff lacked professionalism and attention, which made the entire experience disappointing. Management should seriously address the service quality. Overall, I felt scammed. Not recommended at all. Avoid this place.

TITLE: Downtown Secret | TEXT: Local breakfast and lunch spot in town across from the old Chipola Hotel , gazebo out front , enter from the rear or the front door , grab a table , get more food than what you should pay.

TITLE: Great Brunch! | TEXT: We have gone on several occasions for brunch on Sundays. The food is amazing! I recommend the fried greens tomatoes, blue cheese chips and  egg rolls! Yummmmm! Staff is always awesome!

TITLE: Delightful historic and traditional grill | TEXT: Came for lunch. Old style grill that has been restored to former glory. Staff are kitted out in traditional French style with waistcoats and starched aprons. Greeted in a warm way. Sam took my order and looked after me very well. Started with a small cup of chowder, which was very creamy and thick. A nice small tasty starter. Followed this with an excellent seared beef tenderloin salad with delicious crispy toast covered with goats cheese. A most enjoyable lunch before leaving Portland to fly home. Recommend.

TITLE: Beautiful presentation lacks substance and taste. | TEXT: The presentation is outstanding, the food looks incredible unfortunately it lacks taste. My second time there and last. The best item wasn't on the menu,  the amuse bouche. It was a mushroom soup and fantastic. Also delicious, the Dungeness crab crepe. The Cauliflower starter was disappointed as was the diakon radish dish. Both looked incredible but didn't taste so. The pasta dish with truffle was twofold. The pasta was delicious BUT the copious amount of truffle the chef grated onto each plate not only looked disgusting but tasted disgusting. I have been to Italy,  we love truffle. My husband is a chef. We weren't sure what grade of truffle we were eating but not on par with the French Laundry. The main dish, a beef roll of sorts was tough and chewy. The desert,  a cherry cheesecake another disappointment. I will give them the chocolate chip cookies and tiny cappuccino cream puff, both delicious. The wine list is outrageously expensive and the choices lacking. I suggest you pay the corkage and bring your own wine. Spending $500 on a dinner for two that looked pretty and listening to an arrogant loud, screaming chef all night....not worth the money in my opinion.

TITLE: not my favourite | TEXT: Very crowded, tables really close together - music so loud that you could not talk to your partner - tried several appetizers but we were not overwhelmed. Would not go again.

TITLE: HArd to find but worth the effort!! | TEXT: It's all about the food-and this place has some wonderful authentic delicious food!!!   I am from the Caribbean &  most restaurants think if you put a fried banana on a plate that will make it Caribbean food...no not true!  The Caribbean is a a melting pot with complex cuisine...Spanish, French, African, Indian, Dutch, Portuguese, influences.  The Breadfruit Tree is Caribbean food.  Louis the owner was so friendly- the food was delicious.  I thought I was "home" and my grandmother was in the kitchen. We started with a rum punch...but this wasn't any old rum punch...this was a really West Indian Rum punch...tastes so good but packs a punch!!!  We had the food served family style & we ordered the sweet fish, curry, jerk chicken, peleau...OMG everything was delicious!!!! The menu changes daily so you have to read the chalkboard...I was hoping for Roti...but it wasn't on the chalkboard.  However, Louis did tell me if I call ahead he'd make sure it was on the menu the next time I came by. Service was good- drinks arrived quickly- food took a little time...but if you go with good company the wait won't matter, because it's worth the wait!!! They are open seasonally so call ahead if its not boating season...if the weather is good they may be there.  I can hardly wait to go back...I almost forgot save room for desert- the chocolate bread pudding tastes just like my granddad's bread pudding & I only like my granddad's bread pudding...Louis is an amazing chef....and I LOVE his bread pudding!!! Just remember it may be hard to find this place if you are driving in and not sailing in...but it's worth finding!

TITLE: How to ruin a great meal with bogus charges... | TEXT: Let me explain my 2-star ratings by listing the pros and cons of my experience. I dined here with my girlfriend for our anniversary and it was a mixed experience for sure.  Pros: the food and service (by Katie) were 5-star as both were excellent, some of the best tapas I've ever had. The entire 5-course meal was excellent.  Cons: 1) If you're going to order the 5-course or chef's tasting menu DO NOT make a later reservation. We came in at 8:30, ordered the 5-course option and by our 2nd course we were the only table left and the staff was cleaning up around us making us feel very uncomfortable, like we were holding them up from closing. 2) Review your bill VERY carefully because there will be odd charges on it. First off, we were charged $70 for a bottle of wine listed for $65 on the menu. Secondly, we were charged a $13 "beverage tax" on the alcohol. When I said to the manager, "so between the sales tax and the beverage tax, you're taxing us twice on the alcohol, right?" He replied "yes". The Phila. beverage tax is intended to sweetened drinks like soda, energy drinks, etc. and is NOT intended for alcohol. We dine in Phila all the time and we've NEVER been charged such a silly charge. We were also charged $8 for using a credit card (which was already on the bill before we even paid). What if we paid with cash? When I told the manager that it's illegal to charge a fee for using a debit card and showed him proof on my phone, he merely looked at me. So we basically paid an extra $25 for nonsense after dropping $250 there.   Will we go back? No we won't. As I said the meal and service were fantastic but feeling rushed when you've ordered a multi-course meal and then being nickel-and-dimed with illegal charges basically ruined an excellent meal and our anniversary dinner. This is especially disappointing given that this is a Townsend Wentz restaurant.

TITLE: Would NOT recommend | TEXT: Horrible service. Rude staff and manager. Would NOT recommend.   Additionally, my experience making a reservation was a nightmare. Book reservations with caution. I was charged $300 for a misunderstanding and a lack of clarification on Kann‚Äôs end.

TITLE: Birthday celebration! | TEXT: Read all the wonderful reviews so gave it a try. Went early as read there are always lines. Yup! Not early enough, so we sat at the bar which was perfect! The bar tender Scott was amazing, friendly, attentive and fun! Kept our wine glasses full! Food was fantastic! We were having such a great time I didn‚Äôt take any pictures until after. We‚Äôll be back!! Highly recommend!

TITLE: Not what it used to be. | TEXT: Coquine used to be great restaurant with a relaxing neighborhood vibe. After two visits in the last year, we noticed it has become a snooty restaurant, with greedy prices and portions. The last time we went with family from out of town and they couldn't believe how ridiculous the wine portions were - they barely served us 4 ounces and charged $20 per glass. The food is still great, but it would help to lose the attitude and the greediness.

TITLE: Hidden gem with delicious flavors | TEXT: The place is tiny and unassuming. I was surprised that the chef both attended front of house and the (open) kitchen. The food and wine were delicious. The octopus was tender and perfectly seasoned. The fish main was perfectly cooked, although I felt the endives were a little too bitter. Dessert was light and refreshing. Food choices are a bit limited, but everything tried was really good. Service was friendly and attentive. So why 4/5? I think some kinks still need to be worked out. It would make sense to hire at least one waitstaff to better tend to the customers. Will be back!

TITLE: Simple Fresh Delicious | TEXT: Parking is good. Property is clean. Service friendly. Menu simple. Food is hot and fresh. Noise level medium to high. Prices fit what is served. Burgers fries onion rings shakes all good. Cooked to order served hot to the table. The area is nice and relaxing. Good value

TITLE: Isolated and enigmatic- a good addition to a 'Desert Castle' tour | TEXT: Not much to see and not a lot is known about the site. It is thought it was a caravanserai. While named 'Qasr' (castle) the towers are solid and the slits in the walls unsuitable for arrows but useful for ventilation. I visited as part of a tour group- one of 3 sites visited under the 'Desert Castles' label as half a day trip.  The ride from Amman to the Qasr/s is flat desert and military sites with the occasional camel to spot and the 'castles' are easily spotted from the road. Each has their own point of interest. You can explore the many rooms of the caravanserai, peek out into the desert, imagine the travellers who may have journied here, consider how different the location must have been in less arid days. A lonely location- not something to make a special trip to on its own, but as part of a tour of similar structures it is a nice day out.

TITLE: Quality food in a down at heel area. | TEXT: Pause Cafe was a surprise highlight on our whistle stop weekend break in New York. We arrived there 11.30am we both ordered the sandwiches, me chicken & avocado salad & my son had bbq chicken sandwich, we drank their lemonade. We sat outside, it was a beautiful sunny morning, the area does not look up to much. However the food was really tasty, very nicely presented and good value. We would both highly recommend Pause Cafe as a venue with good quality food.

TITLE: Perfect American breakfast joint | TEXT: Our first experience of an American breakfast and it did not disappoint.  Great location, great food and great service and the price was reasonable for what we ordered and for the ambience of the place.

TITLE: Disappointing!!! | TEXT: I wanted a side dish of hummus & pita.  Not possible, could only order flat bread with hummus & greens on top ($14).  There was Maybe 4 tablespoons of AWFUL tasting hummus on top of DRY, over cooked, stale flatbread (too tough to chew).  I ate most of the greens & left the rest.  Took a while to get my order before I had to dash back next door to the Crest to make it to a movie.  The gnocchi was DRY (packaged? 2 days old?) but the pesto sauce was good.  The ratatouille wasn't cooked enough. Not impressed.

TITLE: Do not go here | TEXT: They are so unfriendly and so stuck on themselves. We could not get out of our RV spot because the way they did the roads and they‚Äôre blaming us because we drove over the grass. We have a 45 foot coach and that‚Äôs the spot they put us in where we could not get out. The woman came out yelling at us screaming so unprofessional. There‚Äôs a kind way to handle things and there is a bad way to handle things and this woman handle things extremely poorly. They have all these rules here and I am so unhappy with this park I would keep going. There‚Äôs other nice parks in the Durango area.

TITLE: Not impressed | TEXT: I was expecting a great French Experience but instead was served average food by people whom appeared as they rather not be there.   Waited 10 min to be seated, despite having a booking, and as mentioned, service was slow.   Approximately 9 tables of 4 inside and about 4 outside.  3 full time people serving plus someone in the bar but not a happy crew.   And when the bill came, 20% tip was already calculated in.  Not the option provided to tip what you felt relevant. And then the audacity to suggest more.   I wouldn‚Äôt go back.

TITLE: Pretentious - Trying to be like Top Chef food and misses the mark. | TEXT: The chef tried very hard to be a Top Chef style chef mixing and maxing various flavors together, but badly missed the mark. Instead of complimentary flavorings and seasonings, each dish tasted like a jumble of mess. For example my escargot was in a sauce that totally hid the flavor of the snails and even the small surprise of sweet bread cubes was barely noticeable. My rib eye sauce completely hid the meat and even the four small but lovely sweetened carrots and the mushrooms were tasteless. The deserts were a mix of flavors that did nothing for each other. Even their popcorn cheese cake which sounded great was little more than a deconstructed mess. Not a single dish highlighted its main ingredient from the rib eye to rabbit to scallops to halibut. The additions subtracted and there were no clean flavors to be found anywhere.  Now we were a party of 6 and that means service will be a little slow, but it was more than a little slow and getting 5 of the 6 appetizers at once, but waiting 17 minutes for the 6th was inexcusable. It should have been comped. Everyone else was already done as my daughter-in-law insisted we not wait.  When you're spending close to $600 for dinner the servers should know who gets what, but they didn't, although at least for the main course, all came out at the same time.  Finally, they knew we were there for a birthday, but other than the server saying happy birthday nothing was forthcoming, not even a single candle on one of the desserts we all shared.  I couldn't possibly recommend the restaurant to anyone.

TITLE: Bad mussels ruin experience! | TEXT: This restaurant is in a beautiful area of SF!!!  Gorgeous old homes and buildings!  Amazing!!!    The service was very good and we loved that it is a tip free restaurant.  Awesome that they provide a great work environment for their employees.    The portions were huge!  Especially the pork chops!!!!  Also the cheese from the selection of 3 cheeses appetizers,  2 of the 3 were huge chunks of cheese.    Most of our food was amazing and very delicious.  But my sister and I had the PEI mussels that were very off and made me almost throw up.  We couldn‚Äôt eat them.  We told our waiter at the end of our meal, as he asked how the food was.  He told the cook and the cook said they were fresh, bought that day and tasted fine.  Too bad for us!  Charged full price .  Not that we were expecting them to remove the charge but since neither of us could eat them we would have thought there would have been more than a ‚Äútoo bad!‚Äù  It left our experience less that delightful.

TITLE: Romantic Dining | TEXT: The food here is exceptional, all their pastas are made in house. Everyone enjoyed their meals. My only negative comment is that the restaurant is located in a historic house and the rooms are tight. The chiavari chairs were not comfortable. Next time I will opt for the outdoor seating which looked delightful.

TITLE: Delicious dining in a cute cafe | TEXT: This little bustling French restaurant reminds me of a European Cafe. My friend and I so enjoyed our dinner at Le Pichet. We are vegetarians:  We had a mushroom crepe, an asparagus salad, and the seasonal dessert and were very happy.  The staff was very busy and very helpful. Because the cafe is very small, the diners sit very close to each other which makes it almost impossible to NOT have conversations with the next table. As visitors to Seattle, it was fun meeting the couple at the next table who lived there.

TITLE: A food lover treat ! | TEXT: I‚Äôm not sure where to start! This is an exceptional restaurant from all aspects. Mexican food with a twist! The creativity and innovation in each plate we tried was beyond expectations.  Lots of flavor with Mexican roots mixed and combined in a creative way.  A wonderful culinary experience that explains why this gem earned one star Michelin.  Needless to say that this restaurant is located in the vibrant coconut grove area. Staff was very friendly and service was great. Strongly recommended for food lovers!

TITLE: Trying the new place | TEXT: I love Italian food, so I finally got to visit this place. Owners are great and maybe I just was a little picky on this day but the bread seemed to be soaked in butter and there wasn't much garlic taste. The Caesar salad lacked something but the saving grace was the eggplant. I'll overlook the bread and salad and swear by the eggplant.

TITLE: delicious | TEXT: As a local, J. Alexander‚Äôs is delicious, dependable brand. Today, we had Asian chicken salads, a bottle of Chardonnay and the spinach queso dip. Everything was so good: food, presentation, staff, environment, wine, noise level, temperature - everything!

TITLE: Ignore the low ratings! | TEXT: The low avg rating isn‚Äôt correct in our opinion. A few things: - This isn‚Äôt a Mexican restaurant. It‚Äôs meso-American centered around different types of corn. The head chef and all the kitchen staff are Colombian. - As expected for a Michelin starred restaurant, it was very inventive and we found almost every dish incredible. The flavors were complex and the presentation was amazing. The only exception was one dish (the catch of the day), which was too salty in our opinion, but that was an outlier of the 8 dishes we tried. The highlights were the tacos al pastor, smoked trumpet mushrooms, crab arepa, and carnitas. - The service was on point. Quick, friendly, and knowledgeable.

TITLE: A must go place in San Francisco | TEXT: Very very interesting and creative menu, great wines, good service, nice atmosphere, great place to share plates and try new food combinations, much more interesting than the average restaurant menus

TITLE: Brunch Review Only | TEXT: This review is strictly about brunch. We paid $200 for two omelettes, two juices and two coffees. The service was good and the atmosphere was nice and it‚Äôs very pretty and the view are wonderful but honestly it‚Äôs breakfast. How on earth do you pay $200 for eggs? And the sides come out massive like you are at a steakhouse and a little overdone. We are staying in the hotel and it is a very nice place but I don‚Äôt think we would eat there again.

TITLE: Hard pass, good location | TEXT: Booked 4 nights stayed for 2. Have stayed in various HIE here and in Europe and you know going in the rooms will be smaller, basic but functional and nice. These rooms were small and considering it was renovated not functional at all. There are so many ways to maximize a small space but that was not done here. They were nice to let us see 2 other rooms and choose after our initial room. Good location, Front desk lady helpful and nice.

TITLE: Consistent excellence | TEXT: This was our third visit to this always busy restaurant. The food was again excellent. Our wait person was excellent and provided valuable advice. Every dish was special and will return again soon!

TITLE: Fantastic San Francisco Lunch Spot with Top-Notch Hospitality | TEXT: We came here with a large group to celebrate a team member's promotion, and even though we hadn't given the restaurant a heads-up (on a busy Friday as Fleet Week was kicking off, no less!), the owner and her team couldn't have been more accommodating.  The owner and her team welcomed us warmly, found space for our group, and made sure everyone was comfortable and well taken care of throughout the night. The service was attentive without being rushed, and you could tell they genuinely cared that we had a great experience.  They even brought out additional umbrellas and helped move them around to protect us from the bright sun that day.   The atmosphere was lively and inviting--exactly what you want for a celebration--and the scenery, with that one-of-a-kind San Francisco backdrop, made it even better. A big thank you to the staff and owner for turning what could've been a logistical headache into a wonderful, memorable lunch for our team! We'll definitely be back.

TITLE: World Traver favorite vacation | TEXT: I expected the scenery and the sites to be amazing, but was not prepared for the professionalism and passion of the staff!  Without exception all staff members engaged with participants to educate and make feel welcome!

TITLE: Excellent Dinner | TEXT: This is a large and first rate restaurant in the heart of downtown. My food was excellent-I had the Chipotle Honey Salmon and a side salad, and my cocktail was good and strong. Service was friendly and quick.  One note: I sat outside in decent weather and it was very nice.

TITLE: Downtown Take-Out | TEXT: I'm typically downtown in the late afternoon only a couple of times each year.  When that happens, I often stop at Yasoo Yani to bring food home.  The wait time is only about ten or fifteen minutes.  Food is hot, good, and not too expensive.  If you want Greek, this is definitely a good place to go.  Kabob wraps are very good, as well as the lemon-rice soup.  They did not include feta in my order, though, which I requested and paid for.

TITLE: The atmosphere was better than the food | TEXT: This restaurant was picked based on good reviews but those people must be more interested in the atmosphere than the food.  The location is good (though there is only paid parking nearby) and there are a lot of shops and restaurants that can be walked to from here.  It was lively but not too loud inside.   However, the food was rather expensive for what was received.  The food was good but not exceptional.  We ordered a pizza and the side of carrots.  The serving size of the pizza was good but the serving size of the carrots was small considering the $15 price tag on a side dish.

TITLE: Horrible | TEXT: Horrible waitress pushed me to get the most expensive plate that I didn‚Äôt want. Very rude about it. And said couldn‚Äôt change it cause food was already making it. Absolutely never again. Food was also ehh

TITLE: Great little find | TEXT: Great little bar tucked away behind shops but sign posted well 70s 80s music very friendly bar maid .great night and right next to our hotel. Would definitely recommend

TITLE: Try the Venison Chili | TEXT: I had a wonderful experience at Haywire. The staff was exceptionally friendly and polite, making me feel welcome from the moment I walked in. I tried the venison chili, which had the perfect amount of spice and was incredibly satisfying. I ordered the smaller cup was more than enough to fill me up. They certainly didn't skimp on the venison, which was tender and flavorful.
TITLE: Fantastic | TEXT: Great location and coffee. The owner is a friendly guy who loves to host his guests. The cafe has a nice atmosphere, with great art work around.
TITLE: Gem in Midtown. | TEXT: Excellent vegan tasting menu and I‚Äôm not Vegan! Friendly service.  Vegan and non vegan menu options.

TITLE: Skip Lenoir | TEXT: Take a pass on this venue. We had real looked forward to a very special, upscale, what a big disappointment. First although they said they had a dress code all staff were in jeans. I guess it was supposed to be eclectic but the interior seemed very tired. We wanted to try one of the menu items we saw online but all the menu was the same as the price fixed,but was restaurant week and the entree we wanted was not listed. To start they offered a  half glass of sparkling wine which we declined. My husband asked for Pinot Grigio but they didn't have it. I ordered a blonde in lilet and it arrived, not in the customary highball glass with a slice of orange but in a champagne glass with a slice of lemon. New to me. The crab fingers were good. The squash salad was too spicy and oily for me . The main course tritip  steak they charge $51 for on the menu  was so  tough! The sauce was delicious. The dessert of peaches and sort of a yogurt was overpowered by the mint. Needless to say that 9over $200 dinner could not hold a candle to the many restaurants we have been to in the last month.

TITLE: A Classic San Francisco Dining Experience | TEXT: We had a memorable dining experience with our friends.  We were greeted by name as we arrived for our reservation. Sherry ushered us to our table.  The wait staff was efficient, attentive, yet unobtrusive.  The Sommelier, Aaron recommended the wine pairings for our selected dinner menus (all different choices for the four diners). All the pairings were superb.  We truly enjoyed the meal and the wine.  I highly recommend this restaurant for a special occasion evening, or any evening when you want to have a memorable dining experience.

TITLE: Fabulous Happy Hour! | TEXT: Fabulous Happy Hour with many choices and great pricing. The food was so delicious! Our server Ana was the best-very attentive and friendly. It was a great choice while on our vacation.

TITLE: Dinner at The Dutch | TEXT: Since The Dutch moved closer to my home I was eagerly anticipating a meal in this wonderful location. And I was not disappointed in the least. Nor was my ever crankier partner, who has narrowed his range of acceptable food choices to only a few items; which makes dining out a bit tricky. This is a well done nicely thought out casual menu served up in a light filled corner location with lots of windows, perfect for people watching.   For dinner, our party of four started with 3 appetizers, charred shishito peppers, some truffled Parmesan fries and small bowl of pickled vegetables. All were perfect finger food bites to go along with some really stellar cocktails- loved the Singing Fountain. For entrees, a double cheeseburger proclaimed excellent., a generous entree sized Cobb salad, zucchini spaghetti primavera, a light offering of summers best veggies and a chicken gravy - a sort of savory Dutch baby with egg sauce etc. Two desserts of a blueberry tart and some malted milk ice cream with homemade peanut brittle,  completed  the evening along with some delicious coffee and espresso.  For dinner, with moderate drinking and three courses  I would figure on spending $60 -75 per person with tax and tip. Though it would be quite easy to have a lovely meal here for half that price.   We are all looking forward to our next visit for breakfast/lunch.

TITLE: A great lunch! | TEXT: We visit Portland a couple of times a year.  Our daughter brought us to the Observatory.  Everyone had a great lunch...that is a feat when EVERYONE at our table is happy!   The price was reasonable.  I highly recommend.

TITLE: Very Nice Meal   A few small issues.... | TEXT: We met friends for lunch there yesterday and had a lovely time.   The server,  Steve,  was friendly and took good care of us.     There were some minor issues,  but we will definitely go here again.   Here are a couple of things that could have been better: We were shown to an area with booths  which is behind a divider.  Several of the tables along the wall have  very  little lighting -   I asked the lady who was seating us if we could sit at one of the other tables which was better lit,  and she was not particularly friendly about it.  I don't know why,  as there were several  available. Three of us got our drinks quickly, but one of us asked for a  Negroni.   That drink took a long time to prepare,  and  our wine orders were slow coming.    I  think this was down to the bar management,  not our server. I had flounder,  which was excellent.  My husband ordered a steak sandwich,  which he described as "average."

TITLE: Excellent but not a cheap date... | TEXT: Although their monthly menus are supposedly different, we found after checking their website for a number of months after dining that they were understandably quite similar. Nonetheless, we would expect the same high quality offerings on every menu. The dining experience, even for Seattle which has become overrated, was indeed excellent but not a cheap date. The fixed menu at $175 per person became substantially more costly after adding the recommended sake pairings. However, as you can see from the photos which we have chosen to post, that the sake selections were particularly memorable. Enjoy!

TITLE: Great lunch | TEXT: My wife ordered the fried green tomatoes for an appetizer, they were very good.  She ordered a hamburger with fried sweet potato fries, both were outstanding.  I ordered blackened shrimp with cheese grits and hushpuppies.  It was all delicious.  This was my first time eating here.  It will not be the last.  It was also served quickly.  Great job.

TITLE: The Jacksonville place for meat | TEXT: Great dinner overall very friendly wait staff, hostess, and gauchos. We have visited several different Brazilian Steakhouses in several different cities and this one ranks in the middle. The salad area is top notch with great salad options, meats and cheeses. The tableside  meats were good too although there were a couple meats that could've used a little more seasoning (pretty bland) and no one ever came around with any ribs and there are both pork and beef ribs on the menu. Other than that a good experience

TITLE: The waitress was great. The salad was tasty but they should call it asparagus salad not Nicoise! | TEXT: Their salad Ni√ßoise salad. It had no tuna. It had crumbled eggs instead of sliced boiled eggs, little olives. The only nice thing was the pickled red onions and the asparagus. They claim they don‚Äôt add tuna because it‚Äôs a vegetarian restaurant but the sell duck ragu and bergers. Go figure!

TITLE: Good value, good breakfast | TEXT: A nice business hotel near Takamatsu station and art museum that is about a ten minute walk away.   Excellent breakfast brought to your room in the morning.   Laundry is on 8th floor via stairs from the 7th. 500 for wash and hr of drying.   Just missing charging plugs for electronics.   Lobby is on second floor.   Friendly and helpful staff.

TITLE: Will definitely go again if I find myself in Marianna | TEXT: Awesome place if you are a fan of seafood. Catfish, shrimp, crab cakes and grits wete great. It‚Äôs a nice place with a chilled out vibe. Staff are friendly.
TITLE: Sunday roast dinner | TEXT: A Sunday night, few places open, so we booked on spec. Sunday sirloin roast was excellent, perfectly cooked, with good veg and Yorkshire pudding

TITLE: Horrible experience!! | TEXT: The rooms were not clean, and broken glass were collected from kids swimming pool. In addition to very impolite receptionist and catering staff. The worst food ever, and my wife fall off broken seat in the restaurant.

TITLE: Ask for my ID because my order was $53 I 48 years old and not one has ever ask me for my ID at Mc Donald. | TEXT: purchase 53 dollar in food. The store manager came up to the register and told me he need to see my I.D. I told him why do you need to see my I.d. Yandi the manager said its for my protection to see my ID. I ask if this is store policy. The manager said yes its store policy to ask for I.D. for any thing over 50.00 dollars. I said im almost 50 years old and Ive eating at Mc Donalds all my life and ive never heard of Mc Donald asking me for I.D. The manager was rude, argument, and nasty. I ask to see the store policy. He refuse. I told the manager that I bet your policy only applies to people that looks like us. 345 NE Second Ave Miami Flordia 33132 02-05-22. 10:05am number 307 Please review camera asap
TITLE: Loved it! | TEXT: Delicious food along with reasonable prices and fast and friendly service! Can't wait to go back and try other entrees.

TITLE: A great place for a celebration or a night out with family | TEXT: This is a great spot for a locally sourced, delicious meal with lots of menu options in Dallas. It‚Äôs worth a stop if you‚Äôre visiting from out of town and looking for a family friendly, reasonably priced, unique dining experience. Celebration has been a local favorite for years, and we love trying the specials as well as eating from their standard menu. Their salads are always  fresh, the tea is strong and fresh brewed, and there is a good selection of entrees providing choices for everyone. The restaurant itself is quaint with photos on the walls depicting various stages of their history. There a little mini dining rooms with several booths and tables as they have had several space add-ons over the years. Definitely recommend stopping here if you haven‚Äôt already!

TITLE: Awesome Restaurant‚Äîa Must go | TEXT: Must admit it was a little noisy but the Atmosphere is lively, busy and bustling and we enjoyed the vibes. Sat at the bar. Barrett was great bartender. Offered great menu suggestions. Food was phenomenal and included raw oysters, catfish, crab claws, capellini and crab, and tuna crudo.  Mother of Pearl cocktail paired nicely with our food. Strongly recommend and Definitely plan on returning.

TITLE: Learning at the Warren G. Harding Presidential Sites | TEXT: Great trip. We arrived at approximately 9:30 am and made our way towards the entrance of the museum. After paying the admission fee, we received a quick overview of the site and went on our way. We opted to view some of the outdoor exhibits first, which included the guard house and press house. The press house contained multiple informational plaques about President Hardings wife and her contributions to society. After viewing the press house, we made our way to the front porch of the house, where we waited for the 10 am guided hour tour to begin. There were guided tours of the presidents former house being held every hour throughout the day. The guided tour of the house was very informational, and the tour guide took us from room to room, while pointing out interesting features and artifacts out for display. The tour guide told us several personal stories related to the Hardings time at the house. The guided tour lasted roughly 1 hour.  After viewing the house, we went back inside to view the main exhibits. We opted to watch a short documentary about President Hardings life and some of the trials and tribulations he faced during his time as President. There were multiple informational plaques out for display, many of them quite text heavy, that went into detail about Hardings upbringing and roots as the owner of a newspaper company in Marion. The plaques also talked about election day, and several of the policy‚Äôs Harding implemented while in office. The last section of the museum dealt with his death and some controversial issues that surrounded his presidency. There were multiple artifacts out for display in the museum, along with short video clips that related to President Harding's time in office.  Tip: I recommend spending 3 hours here if you truly want to see everything.

TITLE: Standard | TEXT: We were seated quickly and the server was nice.  Very tasty cheese wontons, otherwise, for me the buffet was just ok...maybe I wasn't in the mood for it that day.  Husband enjoyed it more than I did, so we will return.
TITLE: Delish | TEXT: Tugce was amazing (our server). I highly recommend the garlic bread (big surprise), pizza, oysters, and shrimp cocktail. All was sooo good!

TITLE: Geat experience from now on I will call my husband Biggles! | TEXT: My husband has always wanted to fly in a Spitfire but too costly, so we booked for him to try the simulator experience. He loved every minute of it! I enjoyed just watching and filming him. It cost ¬£60 for the hour and was worth every penny. Many thanks to Colin who talked my husband through all the proceedures, I won't be surprised if we are going back again soon, it was brilliant!

TITLE: üòï | TEXT: So disappointed.  I brought my daughter here because I thought everything was fabulous before covid.  Unfortunately, nothing was amazing.   We ordered the Brussels sprouts for the appetizer and the raviolis and steak salad.    The Brussels sprouts did not have a lot of flavor.   The descriptions for the raviolis sounded amazing with the ingredients of beef, ricotta and honey.   I detected no ricotta or honey and all we received were 4 squares of ravioli for $26!   The salad was described as having blue cheese, pears, candied hazelnuts and onions.  This was a $25 salad.  The steak was very small and barely any toppings.   It's really too bad.

TITLE: Beautiful rooms in excellent location | TEXT: We spend two nights as a weekend trip and are absolutley satisfied with the friendly host, big rooms,with balconee and fridge, fast wifi and a tasty breakfast buffet.  The location in the middle of serfaus is super, and as it is not located at the main street it is also quite.

TITLE: Delicious Breakfast | TEXT: I had a great breakfast here! I got the shrimp and grits and it was delicious! It was nice and hot temperature wise! The service was also great! Sarah was my server and she went above and beyond! I can‚Äôt wait to return when I visit Dallas again!

TITLE: ‚ÄúLike a Chili‚Äôs‚Äù | TEXT: We went here because it had pretty good reviews and I would say we found it to be average. The host said that of the hotel restaurants this one was like a ‚Äúchilis‚Äù vs the steakhouse being like a ‚ÄúRuth‚Äôs Chris‚Äù. That set the tone for us to expect average. Our waiter was very good and attentive. The restaurant has several different areas for seating and we were near the outdoor bar.  I would not go back.

TITLE: Left in 30 minutes | TEXT: VERY loud with tables literally about 4-6 inches apart.  You could hear everything neighboring tables were saying but very little of your partner's comments.  I like a dry white wine with Mediterranean food but none available (excluding two bubbly options). Only one vodka brand available so you are limited to cocktails (mainly rum) or beer. While we left in about 30 minutes, flat bread pizza was overcooked by had good flavors and the octopus was tough but again, had a nice flavor.  Big crowd so appears popular, but we will not go back - too many other great options out there.

TITLE: A clean room to stay in | TEXT: I always trust Wyndham and for good reasons. The hotel was very well kept. Very clean room. The front dest staff were very sweet and helpful and they were very attentive during breakfast. Definitely recommend it.

TITLE: Authentic Greek Food | TEXT: This is a large restaurant been in Stockton for a long time. The food is always good very fresh, very authentic Greek food. The service is very fast and attentive, its only open for lunch but during the week is a very busy place with all the business around. There is parking in the back and the restaurant will validate your ticket. It is a very good value for your money.

TITLE: Most enjoyable evening! | TEXT: Loved this place. Beautiful space, efficient, friendly, upscale service, good food‚Äîsomethings were outstanding, others just ok. The menu is incredibly varied and original. It‚Äôs prix fixe, but gives you several options to choose from. Portions are generous and they keep bringing you little extras, so pace yourself!

TITLE: Conveniently near hotel | TEXT: We came here for a light dinner after check-in at the Marriott Residence Inn right across the street. Liked the clean exterior curb appeal. There were patio seatings. The interior with high ceiling was welcoming. We settled into a quiet, comfortable booth in one section of the spacious dining room. Enjoyed the draft BlueMoon. The dishes we ordered: Mac & cheese, cornbread, onion soup, Caesar, poached salmon spinach salad, mixed green salad, and shrimp scampi were all quite average. Service was good.

TITLE: Nice bar/restaurant right on Bourbon | TEXT: We really liked this place.  We didn't eat there, but it was a great bar/restaurant right on Bourbon where you could watch football without the overpowering music.  The staff and manager were great to talk with.
TITLE: Sushi! | TEXT: If you love sushi then you‚Äôll love Cocoro!  Great and Authentic sushi and Japanese cuisine for anyone who loves this type of food, can‚Äôt go wrong!

TITLE: Don't do it | TEXT: Overpriced and underwhelming! Service was ok but the food was less than mediocre.  My son and I had nachos and a couple of Philly cheesesteaks.  The bill was $100 after tip.  Yikes! Never again...

TITLE: Great food, great staff and a different experience! | TEXT: There were 4 of us and one person could not tolerate garlic and our server really helped to determine the dishes that were free of it and which ones could be modified. I knew we were in a great restaurant ! Lots in the menu to choose from and the concept was to share the plates. We decided to do that but we also chose to have one as our main dish each. All the dishes were fantastic and too many to individually comment on. My main was the black cod and it was very good. I also had a bite of the pork chop and it was rich in flavour, moist and actually heavenly.  Overall a great culinary outing ! Well done!
TITLE: Great hotel stay! | TEXT: Microtel is conveniently located near Mohegan Sun casino.  The hotel is quiet, very clean and comfortable. Staff are always friendly.

TITLE: You just have to see the sign in person! | TEXT: This is literally a small restaurant with a BIG sign! Allow 30-60 min if you plan to eat. Everyone was very friendly. Note: There is no gift shop here. Just a couple of showcases with merch!

TITLE: Delicious and delightful | TEXT: We dined outside in the courtyard which was delightful on a beautiful August night. Our waiter was very attentive without being intrusive. The dishes come out at a leisurely pace so don‚Äôt be in a hurry. My white was picked by my server and was spectacular. The sourdough bread was great. I lived the pasta duet starter. We both had filets which were so tender and perfectly cooked.

TITLE: Peace in the Hills | TEXT: A lovely place to stay for anyone wanting complete peace and tranquility. The rabbits and wallabies at dawn and dusk added to the feeling of being well away from civilisation while Kettering was just down the hill.

TITLE: Stick to the ribs brunch but inconsistent | TEXT: Came here for weekend brunch.  Right in the heart of east passyunk, it‚Äôs a popular place. Its theme is Amish influence which is nice for brunch.  On the one hand. My Amish bologna eggs Benedict with cream chip beef and was super yummy and our lattes were perfect.  But my wife‚Äôs Avacado toast was really too basic for the price.  Also the service felt young and untrained and very inconsistent.  So we drop a star for that inconsistency.

TITLE: LOVE THIS PLACE | TEXT: Its a great place, great food, great atmosphere!  I love sitting outside on a Saturday or Sunday morning and enjoy my French Toast and a cup of coffee or a mimosa.  I like to sit and watch the boats, it is so relaxing!

TITLE: Friendly Restaurant | TEXT: My wife, son and I came to Marianna for. Marathon. My son‚Äôs first. We needed pasta the night before. Not many options for Italian in Marianna.  Tried Pennelo‚Äôs and were extremely happy. Pasta sauce had a great flavor. Salad was crisp and fresh. New York Cheesecake was perfect texture. Plan to run the marathon here next year and will choose Penello‚Äôs again

TITLE: Well preserved | TEXT: A nice little building out in the middle of nowhere. It was quite complete with a ground floor and courtyard and a story above that with rooms you could go in. It‚Äôs astonishing how old it is and it is one of the best preserved of the desert castles. You can only get there by car, lots of hotels do tours from Amman.

TITLE: Excellent cocktails | TEXT: Came here around 4:30 on a Saturday to take advantage of the 4-6 happy hour. Perhaps it was the early hour or the fact that there seems to be a cocktail/brewery/wine bar on every corner but other than two other couples it was empty. All the better for us!  Our server was friendly and helpful. I had the Pine Street Sour and the Lagunita cocktails.  Both were tasty and refreshing. My husband and I shared the potato and leek croquettes and the slider. Both were delicious. We enjoy trying new places when we travel which often means repeat trips to the same place don't happen often but we will definitely return here in the future.

TITLE: Worth visiting | TEXT: We are regular visitors to the resort but had never had a meal at this restaurant before. As we were staying at the accommodation this time, we naturally tried the food.  We were not disappointed. The portions are generous and the quality outstanding.

TITLE: How to say something nice ?? | TEXT: Just OK at the Best Ordered a Beer and got Pig Ears Reordered drinks  Before dinner drinks The drinks arrived after dinner Food  Ok ‚Ä¶ Not Great Or Outstanding  Waste of time and money for a mediocre meal Will not be back Thank you for reading BobüòÄ

TITLE: Awesome Buffalo Chicken nachos | TEXT: First visit and definitely not the last. We never went here because our thinking was it was just like all the other wings chains with a similar name. WRONG. We like this place. It will be a regular place for us. The nachos were so good - with real chicken. My husband got a burger. He is very picky about burgers but said he liked it and would order again. We sat at the bar and had a good time talking with Sarah. She made our visit fun.

TITLE: Services! | TEXT: This is a must go to restaurant. The service is excellent. All the waiter and waitress‚Äôs helping each other. The food was so good. It‚Äôs beautiful place along with outstanding services. I set back and watch how everyone help each other. From taking dishes out each other hand, off tables that didn‚Äôt belong to them. It was like a well rehearse play. Great job everyone!

TITLE: Waiter | TEXT: Jake was a fantastic waiter.  We usually look forward to George.  In this case Jake was a pleasant replacement.  Food always excellent.  We have been coming here since Fare opened.  A fantastic neighborhood restaurant.  A must ‚Äúgive it a try‚Äù.

TITLE: Get the shrimp and grits | TEXT: We visited on a Wednesday evening in November and it wasn't busy.  We had the best shrimp and grits.  Full of delicious flavor and large shrimp.  Good service and live music.  I wish I had more room to try the pie.  Next time!

TITLE: Wide range of excellent wines | TEXT: One of the things my wife and I like about Herzog Winery is that they make a wide range of wines, all of which are good, and at a wide range of prices.  The range of wines allows a different tasting experience each time we visit.  On this visit, we particularly liked the Sauvignon Blanc, which is not sharp, and the Choreograph, which is a field blend of ten varietals, but the Malbec was among the best wines we've tasted -- and we've tasted in over 200 wineries in eight states.  Occasionally we encounter a wine that evokes an intense pleasurable response, and this Malbec was one of those.  It would be hard to find a better wine at the price, and it would be even harder to find a better wine at twice the price.  Note that the winery is closed on Saturdays for religious observance, but it's worth the effort to fit it into the schedule on another day.

TITLE: FRESH SUSHI | TEXT: Fabulous family owned restaurant, has been in the village for many years.  Wonderful variety of food, all of it well done and fresh.  My ONLY go to place in the area.  Highly recommend!!

TITLE: A big disappointment | TEXT: The food was acceptable, but nothing memorable. We ordered three portions of black caviar, yet what we received were small sandwiches with only a couple of grains of black caviar on each; the rest was red caviar. The staff explained that they were ‚Äúalmost out‚Äù of black caviar, but we were still charged the full price. We chose not to make a scene at the time, though in hindsight, we should have said something.

TITLE: How to ruin a great meal with bogus charges... | TEXT: Let me explain my 2-star ratings by listing the pros and cons of my experience. I dined here with my girlfriend for our anniversary and it was a mixed experience for sure.  Pros: the food and service (by Katie) were 5-star as both were excellent, some of the best tapas I've ever had. The entire 5-course meal was excellent.  Cons: 1) If you're going to order the 5-course or chef's tasting menu DO NOT make a later reservation. We came in at 8:30, ordered the 5-course option and by our 2nd course we were the only table left and the staff was cleaning up around us making us feel very uncomfortable, like we were holding them up from closing. 2) Review your bill VERY carefully because there will be odd charges on it. First off, we were charged $70 for a bottle of wine listed for $65 on the menu. Secondly, we were charged a $13 "beverage tax" on the alcohol. When I said to the manager, "so between the sales tax and the beverage tax, you're taxing us twice on the alcohol, right?" He replied "yes". The Phila. beverage tax is intended to sweetened drinks like soda, energy drinks, etc. and is NOT intended for alcohol. We dine in Phila all the time and we've NEVER been charged such a silly charge. We were also charged $8 for using a credit card (which was already on the bill before we even paid). What if we paid with cash? When I told the manager that it's illegal to charge a fee for using a debit card and showed him proof on my phone, he merely looked at me. So we basically paid an extra $25 for nonsense after dropping $250 there.   Will we go back? No we won't. As I said the meal and service were fantastic but feeling rushed when you've ordered a multi-course meal and then being nickel-and-dimed with illegal charges basically ruined an excellent meal and our anniversary dinner. This is especially disappointing given that this is a Townsend Wentz restaurant.

TITLE: Avoid avoid | TEXT: Not good. One employee is host/server/bartender and most of the time was nowhere to be found. The bar was out of tonic. My avocado toast was basically a brick topped with that avocado stuff that is squeezed out of a tube and a few cherry tomato halves. Awful. Husband‚Äôs burger came with cheese even though he ordered it without cheese. No one to ask to fix it, so I walked back to the kitchen door and tried to call to someone. No answer. A long time after that, the host/server/bartender finally emerged and took care of it. As we tried to pay the bill, we were told that the restaurant doesn‚Äôt take Visa. Wyndham can do better than that.

TITLE: Perfect Spot in Rittenhouse SQ | TEXT: Food was exceptional. Staying in Center City / Rittenhouse SQ and Google Best Restaurants near me turns up lots of options. This place did not disappoint. Fig & Ricotta salad plus their Rotolo pasta dish were just right. Certainly give them a try. Had no reservation, I just sat at a bar side table, it was a Sunday however.

TITLE: Great food | TEXT: We arrived at 5:15pm and were surprised that the place was entirely empty.  Thought maybe we had made a poor selection and that the vacant diner was a bad omen.  NOPE:  within minutes the place was so packed there wasn't a vacant seat!  Lucky to have parked when we did. We both had the Mediterranean Salad (split one between us) and the Baked Salmon with Brussels Sprouts and Roasted Potatoes.  Fabulous and flavorful!!  Then enjoyed a simple scoop of vanilla ice cream for dessert and off to the concert. I'd definitely go again!

TITLE: Wonderful dining experience! | TEXT: My husband and I dined at Contessa during a recent weekend in Boston. We stayed in the Newbury, so it was very convenient. We were seated next to a window where we had an amazing city view. Their butternut squash carpaccio was one of the best dishes I ever had. I enjoyed it so much that I failed to take a photo! My branzino was also very good and my husband enjoyed his lobster pasta. Overall, it was a fabulous dining experience!

TITLE: Unsavory Boia De | TEXT: Disappointing experience at Boia De.  We were looking forward to eating here.  My husband's parpadelle alla lepre was average, my  scallops sott-olio were tepid, not savory to the taste.  We did have a great bottle of wine from their wine list while we waited and enjoyed the chicken liver & foie gras pate, but this is not a Michelin star restaurant.   We are foodies and have had great meals here and abroad.  This was substandard, not worthy of a visit..

TITLE: Cosy and perfect | TEXT: Great avocado toast, hot chocolate to die ! The bagels too are good! We would be back again! The washroom too was very clean and beautifully decorated. Yes, we noticed ;)

TITLE: What a place!  Michelin star worthy | TEXT: The culinary experience that we had at Georgie‚Äôs was absolutely spectacular.  From the greeting of the hostess to leaving the restaurant was 5 star.  The tuna tataki and French onion consomm√© were phenomenal starters.   I had the strip steak and my wife had the tortellini and they both were phenomenal.  We finished with the tart tartin and candy bar for dessert.  The depth of flavor that Curtis Stone has developed with his dishes is better than most Michelin star restaurants I have dined at.  Keep up the good work and we‚Äôre looking forward to seeing you again in the future.

TITLE: Excellent experience and food at Spears | TEXT: Spears Restaurant is one of a kind.  The owner and cook serves the best fried pork chops we have ever had.  His fresh hand cut french fries are excellent.  We have been there 3 times and each time it has been excellent.  We make extra effort to pass thru Marianna on our way to Southern Florida and stop at Spears when he is open.  We hope to be there next Friday, March 15, 2024.  We have told many of our friends of our great experiences at Spears and recommend they go there when passing thru the area.

TITLE: Visiting Philly for first time bad experience at restaurant | TEXT: I visited Philly for the first time apparently this restaurant has a dress code. I was told I couldnt be seated because my pants were considered sporty. The hostess suggested I go shopping and purchase new pants. In terms of customer service this restaurant gets an F. The hostess could have handled the situation better. She could have apologized for the confusion and offered for me to return the next day. She was very dismissive no type of compromise. A deer without headlights. Its a shame as a black owed business and a person of color myself that is the experience I had. I would never recommend this restaurant to anyone that is visting Philly.
TITLE: Best Chain Wing Restaurant | TEXT: Always satisfied with the wings!! Always fresh, never dry, and plenty of sauce!! Custom service is also a 5 star.
TITLE: Great Breakfast Spot | TEXT: Our favorite neighborhood breakfast place has reopened!!!  Our breakfasts were delicious and service was fantastic.

TITLE: Quaint and Homey - good deal if you don't demand luxury | TEXT: The place is privately owned by the family which resides on premise. They are warm and helpful. The rooms are large, yet a bit outdated. It is well located in the center of town. It could use help with the upkeep but other than that it is a great place for the price. They also offer a good price on buffet & entertainment. The price includes breakfast.

TITLE: Clam chowder not what you'd expect | TEXT: Clam chowder was a red based chowder kind of a hot spicy stew. Not what we expected clam chowder to be  Food was good but expensive and small. Also service was slow.  Waitress was distracted just a few waitresses for a crowd. It's not a very big place. Probably only a dozen tables if you don't eat outside.   Try the palm fish camp about a mile away. It's excellent.
TITLE: Fine dining excellence | TEXT: Amazing dining experience from the drinks we had to start all the way to the decadent desert... flawless! We can't wait to return.

TITLE: Neighborhoody Sports Bar | TEXT: I like the neighborhoody feel and the large-screen TV‚Äôs to watch sports.  I was admittedly disturbed that one of the large screens was showing Fox News (this is a sports bar, for one thing!).  The Buffalo wings are okay, but I would t say great.  Service was very good late at night.
TITLE: Great place for drinks and dining. | TEXT: Great place for happy hour. Visited several times while in Portland. Great drinks, great food, great service, and wonderful views of the city.

TITLE: Mersea Magic!! | TEXT: Great tasty food, spectacular venue!!! MeeSun and staff are fantastic and so friendly!! It‚Äôs a family atmosphere. Outdoor spaces for the kids, bocci ball courts, putting green. Best view of SF, the hidden gem!! Take the Ferry from SF Ferry Building (10 minute ride) walk to Mersea. Take the ferry back to SF and call it a night or continue the party!!

TITLE: An wonderful experience | TEXT: A wonderful experience. It is very expensive, but you know that before you get there. We had the abridged menu; couldn‚Äôt eat a 10 course meal and would not want to pay the much   But the meal was fantastic and the friendliest, most helpful wait service. The wagyu was the best ever.  And the desserts were extremely good and different. If you want an excellent, interesting meal and can afford it, go there.

TITLE: Learning at the Warren G. Harding Presidential Sites | TEXT: Great trip. We arrived at approximately 9:30 am and made our way towards the entrance of the museum. After paying the admission fee, we received a quick overview of the site and went on our way. We opted to view some of the outdoor exhibits first, which included the guard house and press house. The press house contained multiple informational plaques about President Hardings wife and her contributions to society. After viewing the press house, we made our way to the front porch of the house, where we waited for the 10 am guided hour tour to begin. There were guided tours of the presidents former house being held every hour throughout the day. The guided tour of the house was very informational, and the tour guide took us from room to room, while pointing out interesting features and artifacts out for display. The tour guide told us several personal stories related to the Hardings time at the house. The guided tour lasted roughly 1 hour.  After viewing the house, we went back inside to view the main exhibits. We opted to watch a short documentary about President Hardings life and some of the trials and tribulations he faced during his time as President. There were multiple informational plaques out for display, many of them quite text heavy, that went into detail about Hardings upbringing and roots as the owner of a newspaper company in Marion. The plaques also talked about election day, and several of the policy‚Äôs Harding implemented while in office. The last section of the museum dealt with his death and some controversial issues that surrounded his presidency. There were multiple artifacts out for display in the museum, along with short video clips that related to President Harding's time in office.  Tip: I recommend spending 3 hours here if you truly want to see everything.

TITLE: Lunch break | TEXT: The food is AMAZING. It was my first time there. I got the spinach pie platter OMGOSH IT WAS SOOOOO GOOOD. The staff were on point. Greek food/Mediterranean food is AWESOME. Eat here you will be very happy you did.

TITLE: Unable to gain access to the church | TEXT: We were not able to enter the church. The campanile is historically important since it was built in 1833, the first year that Christians were allowed to replace or rebuild their churches.

TITLE: Definitely recommend | TEXT: Stop here when visiting Philly. Large variety of foods to choose from. Plenty of shop to look for souvenirs. Definitely with visiting especially if it‚Äôs your first time visiting.

TITLE: Poor business practices. | TEXT: Went in for lunch. Person behind bar told us 20 minute wait. 3/4 of restaurants empty. Ignored us. Just left. Can find another place easily. At least sit us down with drinks.

TITLE: Wonderful Happy Hour at Bellevue! | TEXT: Very elegant setting with welcoming and attentive servers.  The happy hour wine, crispy Brussel sprout medley, Parmesan truffle fries were all delicious!  Background music streaming from Spotify - various artists "Summer Barbeque"  was so much fun families of multiple generations felt compelled to jive along !  Please view the submitted photos that capture the essence of the lovely XIX BAR LOUNGE.

TITLE: Great food | TEXT: We arrived at 5:15pm and were surprised that the place was entirely empty.  Thought maybe we had made a poor selection and that the vacant diner was a bad omen.  NOPE:  within minutes the place was so packed there wasn't a vacant seat!  Lucky to have parked when we did.      We both had the Mediterranean Salad (split one between us) and the Baked Salmon with Brussels Sprouts and Roasted Potatoes.  Fabulous and flavorful!!  Then enjoyed a simple scoop of vanilla ice cream for dessert and off to the concert.    I'd definitely go again!

TITLE: If You Love Salt... | TEXT: The atmosphere?  Great!  Service? Exceptional!  Cleanliness?  Terrific!  The food?  SALTY!!  Overly so too.  The queso was the best part of the whole meal.  Could've been an off night but we were disappointed...

TITLE: Truly Outstanding Beef | TEXT: This was our second trip to Miami and our second time dining here. We greatly enjoyed our pre-dinner cocktails, served by Marshall (a delightful bar tender who shared some great information about the city). For dinner, we had the sliced sirloin Wagyu and the sliced Wagyu filet mignon. Both were some of the very best meat we have ever had. While pricey, I can honestly say it was worth the cost.

TITLE: Delicious dining experience with friends | TEXT: This restaurant was recommended by friends.  A group of us went here for dinner on a Friday night.  This is a byob so we had brought some wine with us. This is a small restaurant but we were able to get seated.   We started with the bistro southeast salad and the Thai chili and Spicy curry wings both of which were excellent.  The wings were Korean style and the salad was served with house made dressing available for purhase.   We shared the seafood combination which was crawfish, fish, clams and lobster boil served with corn and potatoes.  Overall a great experience we will be back soon.

TITLE: Great Evening | TEXT: We have been here a few times and always enjoy our evening.  This time we came for an anniversary and it was special.  Great food.  Great Service.  No complaints about the most important elements of a restaurant.  My only small issue (and cause for four rather than five stars) is the proximity of the tables.   There were two tables on either side that were extremely close so that we had to listen to the conversations of both parties all night.  Not perfect for an anniversary situation.

TITLE: Fabulous Super Stupendous | TEXT: This restaurant is nothing but amazing. There are no other words. The tasting menu was full of foods that I would not typically eat yet I ate everything, In fact I relished everything. The subtle lasting taste of each course was memorable, and the transition to dessert was also quite impressive. The food was absolutely sumptuous. We were fortunate enough to have a very experienced server and he was also terrific. At one point my wife and I were not quite sure about one of the courses and the waiter very clearly said, try it, and if you still don‚Äôt like it, we will find something else. We tried it and we loved it. Every course was better than the next. Bravo!

TITLE: Trying the new place | TEXT: I love Italian food, so I finally got to visit this place. Owners are great and maybe I just was a little picky on this day but the bread seemed to be soaked in butter and there wasn't much garlic taste. The Caesar salad lacked something but the saving grace was the eggplant. I'll overlook the bread and salad and swear by the eggplant.
TITLE: Delicious | TEXT: So glad we stopped when passing through. Everything we ordered was delicious and the chowder was amazing. Will be back for sure.

TITLE: AWFUL | TEXT: I just left Ellen's and might I say it was the worst meal I have EVER had.  I am sure this review will fall on blind eyes and deaf ears. The food came out to fast and as I was looking at it I could tell it was NOT fresh.  When I told the waitress the biscuit was cold she gave me another COLD one.  The hash browns were cold and the the I know had been sitting there for awhile.  it looked pre made. When I got the new plate they just heated everything up in the microwave and by now everything was very rubbery.  I will not be returning to Ellen's,

TITLE: Limited and extremely overcooked food | TEXT: There is little to choose from at this restaurant. The majority of the food had been there awhile or it was entirely overcooked. The only things I found that were worth eating were the green beans and the imitation crab. We will not be returning to this establishment.

TITLE: Incredible experience | TEXT: What an incredible experience! There were flavors I'd never tasted before and everything they brought to us was delicious. Go hungry, because they bring an extraordinary amount of food. Our server was well-informed and prompt, and the service was very good. The braised lamb shoulder is their signature dish and should not be missed. I'd rank this among the top five meals I've had in my life.

TITLE: Quiet Oasis on the river-front and Exceptional Service | TEXT: We stayed at this lovely, relaxing and unassuming hotel for 3 days and could not fault the exceptional service provided by all the staff, especially the main host Hemasiri who always presented with a smile, was honest, super friendly, warm and helpful. No request went unheeded and the rooms are well sized, comfortable and cleaned to a high standard.  Although a few general updates wouldn‚Äôt go astray, the hotel grounds with the river front felt like a tropical oasis away from the hustle and bustle of life. The lunch and breakfast portions were huge and delicious.   Hotel Hemadan  is outstanding value for money and a hidden gem. We hope to return in the not too distant future.

TITLE: GREAT DAME OF BROAD STREET | TEXT: This restaurant was our go-to for Thanksgiving, prior to the pandemic. Every year, we would come for the luscious all-you-can-eat buffet. This year, we returned & it was great to be back! As always, the food was outstanding. (This year, they even had a duo that provided live instrumental music.)   We did encounter an issue with seating. We asked to be moved to a different room & our request was denied. A screaming baby kept us from fully enjoying the experience.
TITLE: Best Italian in JAX | TEXT: Fresh pasta, fresh baked bread, amazing Italian wine list and delicious food!  I recommend the fresh fish prepared 11 ways, Livornese is my favorite!

TITLE: French Classic Intimate Ambiance | TEXT: We've been meaning to come here for a while and finally made the leap. So glad we did!  We figured the only way to better understand San Francisco's culinary fine dining history was to trace it right back near the start.  Chef Gary Danko was among the early wave of James Beard Award winning chefs in San Francisco and later became part of the first generation of Michelin-starred chefs in the city once the Michelin Guide began rating San Francisco restaurants.   I've read some Yelp reviews calling his food "old school". After our experience there, I'd say it's more of a throwback to the golden age of fine dining. You won't find trendy hyper-local experimental cuisine with designer eatable floral pedals in mini Japanese pottery and expensive foam that pretends to be flavor. Instead you'll find a rolling cheese cart, white tablecloths, impeccable service and sauces that use classic French techniques (b√©arnaise, fumets, velout√©s). All paying homage to classic French cooking.   The menu offers 3, 4, or 5-course prix‚Äëfixe menu with ample choices in each category.  We chose the 3 and 4.   We enjoyed every dish.   Stand Outs:  Roast Lobster with Potato Pur√©e, Edamame, Peas, Asparagus, and Tarragon Jus - Tender lobster, nicely seasoned and comforting potato pur√©e and velvety tarragon jus.  The Glazed Oysters with Osetra Caviar. So good! I could've eaten 3 more. Plump perfectly cooked oysters topped with a generous amount of Osetra caviar nestled in a silky leek fondue and a light lettuce cream. Buttery but not rich and with a wonderful briny ocean finish.   Filet of Beef with Potato Gratin, King Trumpet Mushrooms. Tender and juicy that paired perfectly with the bone marrow b√©arnaise.   The Horseradish Crusted Salmon: We had questions - how is a "horseradish" crust so airy and fluffy? Then we consulted with our server who spilled the beans. It's the Egg Whites folded in with the horseradish.  Add a tangy grain mustard sauce to balance the rich salmon, and you've got an old-school French combo. IMHO, in today's flavor landscape, mustard doesn't get enough love.   Let's talk dessert!!  Pastry Chef Killian Guillotin grew up in Brittany, France, and  cut his teeth in top French kitchens before sharing his magic here.   The Baked Chocolate Souffl√© with two sauces. Light as a cloud with just enough rich-sweetness to say dessert's in the house. And don't get me started with the vanilla bean cr√®me anglaise and Belgian chocolate sauces. Worth every calorie!!  Is Gary Danko old school? Maybe. But in the way your favorite vintage wine is old. Complex, full bodies, and full of finesse .   Happy Eating!!

TITLE: The place to Stay in san Quirico... | TEXT: By that I mean that it is the ONLY place to stay in the village. We weep on a walking tour so only stayed the one night. Rooms are quiet and big but the beds are below par. We had a terrace but the access to it was covered in pigeon poo so I don't think anyone had been in the room for weeks. On the shower there is an odd plastic plate, take this out before showering, it is deadly! We ate down stairs and it was very nice. Breakfast was "OK"

TITLE: A food lover treat ! | TEXT: I‚Äôm not sure where to start! This is an exceptional restaurant from all aspects. Mexican food with a twist! The creativity and innovation in each plate we tried was beyond expectations. Lots of flavor with Mexican roots mixed and combined in a creative way. A wonderful culinary experience that explains why this gem earned one star Michelin. Needless to say that this restaurant is located in the vibrant coconut grove area. Staff was very friendly and service was great. Strongly recommended for food lovers!

TITLE: Worth the visit!!! | TEXT: I was very impressed with the Warren G. Harding Presidential Sites.  We took the tour of his house, and listened first hand from the tour guides all about when Harding gave speeches on the "front porch".  The house is stunning and is 90+ percent original from years ago when Warren and his wife Florence lived in the house.  The tour guides can answer any questions you have off the top of their heads.  The  Library & Museum was finished in the spring of 2021 and they have a nice gift shop in there too.  They spared no expense in the construction of the building - it is beautiful!!!!  If you are a history buff, this is a must do.

TITLE: Too expensive for what you get! | TEXT: For context, we have eaten at several of the top ranked restaurants in the world.  We‚Äôre very familiar with the idea of tasting menus.  The staff at the restaurant (ie. Valet, hostess, waiter, etc.) were all very good.  The artistry of the food was good.  The food quality was good.  The menu variety was good.  Having said that, the pace was a bit too slow and not because it was busy.  The major negative critique was that the food quantity was severely lacking.  After spending a few hundred on dinner, I left starving.  The same family owns other restaurants in Jax, one we really enjoy, but I would not recommend this one.  Way too expensive for what you get.

TITLE: Very disappointed, not worth the trip | TEXT: We went for a birthday celebration and was very disappointed in the slow service and lack of knowledge of the server. order chilled seafood platter, steak and lobster and oyster rock fellows, the steak came first and waited a while before the chilled seafood plater came out and the oyster appetizer never came before our meals. the oysters on the chilled plate had lots of sand and shells in it and the steak was so so. The manager asked how your dinner was and told him of the problems and he did not say sorry or make any adjustment. All in all very disappointed birthday celebration

TITLE: Disappointment for date night | TEXT: Disappointment. Tasting menu with great wine and terrible service. One entire dish was a huge miss. Does not happen at places deemed to be ‚Äúfuture Michelin star‚Äù restaurants.

TITLE: My parents had gone there for years! | TEXT: We drive from Turlock to have a great meal! Food is always excellent!  Homemade desserts if you can order before they  run out! We always enjoy  ourselves all seasons of the year! NEVER A BAD EXPERIENCE!!

TITLE: One of our favorite spots in Philly! | TEXT: We live 50 miles from Philly. We were going to be in town for a show at the Walnut Street Theatre, celebrating our anniversary. I made reservations at Talula's Garden due to it's proximity to the theater. I believe this was our third or fourth time dining there. I had the Roasted Chicken with Gnocchi and my wife had the Handmade Ricotta Ravioli. To say they were both good would be an understatement. My wife usually never finishes her entree (she did), and it was the absolute best chicken I have ever eaten (anywhere). The only thing that would have made it any better would have been a nice piece of crusty bread to lap up the sauce, as licking the plate would have probably been in bad taste! Outstanding experience from start to finish.

TITLE: A Wonderful Dining Experience | TEXT: Enjoyed a. kitchen a number of years ago, and I recall having an excellent meal. Dined there again this evening, and was blown away by the attentive service, warm atmosphere and amazing cuisine.  Paul & Jess at the bar were excellent hosts, offering dining recommendations, taste pairings, checking in, and generally ensuring all their patrons were well-served.  The dishes were original and delicious, thoroughly satisfying. One of the best meals I‚Äôve experienced in the past decade.  Highly recommend!

TITLE: Great for crab and other seafood! | TEXT: This is a casual Vietnamese BYOB restaurant that serves very good standards like pot stickers, excellent chicken wings with different preparations, and some combination seafood/corn/sausage/potatoes dishes steamed in a bag and suitable for 2-4 people.  Of course there are also noodle bowls with various choices of meats.

TITLE: Best Bolognese Pasta Dish | TEXT: Best bolognese dish I have ever had. My young son and I were able to get a table on a Sunday night without reservations. Even though I visited the Italian North End several times Grotto on Beacon Hill was the best restaurant of the trip. It is small and quaint.

TITLE: Cheap and skimpy | TEXT: Do not waste your time coming here. They tend to be very skimpy when it comes to your food. I paid for two beef, cheese & rice burritos which the cook put about 5 pieces of rice in each burrito! I called to speak with the manager and he said it was a mistake (yeah right) and that he wouldn't charge me for rice on my next order! He should've been offering two new burritos, if that's the best you can do, I will not be back! Also, they limit you on the salsa to go, you only get one per burrito and it's only a teaspoon.  Terrible and cheap! Try other places that believe in giving you your money's worth.

TITLE: Simply amazing and awesome! | TEXT: We were very excited to eat at Carbone in Miami after being regulars of the New York City location. The ambience is very familiar also very different and unique. It was an absolutely incredible meal and everything was done with perfection. We sat outside on the patio and had a nice evening, Miami breeze and our waitress was attentive and helpful on while not overselling each other high restaurants in Miami certainly do.

TITLE: We watched a short film at the museum prior to the tour | TEXT: Our guide was Theodore, he did an excellent job sharing his knowledge of Warren Harding and Florence- marriage, campaign and presidency. The tour started on the porch where his Porch Campaign took place. The house furnishings are over 90% original. NO Pictures allowed which is sad for my personal journey ablum. The museum has nice exhibits with a couple audios. Enjoyed watching the pictures taken on the Voyage of Understanding tour to the western states and Alaska. Purchase tickets on-line because we were shocked how the first 3 tours were fully booked. We changed our itinerary to make a late afternoon tour. Large parking lot. Restrooms on site.

TITLE: [no title] | TEXT: Had  a great breakfast of eggs and a blueberry pancake. Everything was cooked to perfection. The bacon was crisp as ordered. I like going here for the food and the atmosphere reminds me of a family gathering. I also like the policy of NO animals. I'm a combat vet with PTSD, 100% permanent and total disability. I don't need a service dog to comfort my sorry ...

TITLE: Superb heritage centre river cruise with excellent commentary | TEXT: I spent a most enjoyable 5 hours on the Thames, on this year's annual Maidenhead Heritage Centre cruise, and what a treat!  Apart from a little light rain, we enjoyed good weather and views between Maidenhead and Marlow.  But what really made it stand out was Richard Poad's informative, interesting and amusing commentary.  Do you know how many bathtubs it takes to fill Boulters Lock.  I though my answer "a lot" was pretty good, but not good enough.  I'm afraid you'll have to wait until September 2026 for the next chance.
