TITLE: Commanders Okay, but Antoine‚Äôs was Astounding | TEXT: Commanders Palace was good, but it doesn‚Äôt compare with the variety and tastefully compared menu at Antoine‚Äôs.  It was our first time at both restaurants this trip, and we much preferred Antoine‚Äôs, no comparison.  Antoine‚Äôs was more pricey, but you get what you pay for.

TITLE: Peleau | TEXT: My first time eating here, the food was ok .  To much oil in the dish made it greasy.    they give a generous portion you can share with at least three people.                          The owner very nice and polite and welcoming.

TITLE: We watched a short film at the museum prior to the tour | TEXT: Our guide was Theodore, he did an excellent job sharing his knowledge of Warren Harding and Florence- marriage, campaign and presidency. The tour started on the porch where his Porch Campaign took place. The house furnishings are over 90% original. NO Pictures allowed which is sad for my personal journey ablum. The museum has nice exhibits with a couple audios. Enjoyed watching the pictures taken on the Voyage of Understanding tour to the western states and Alaska. Purchase tickets on-line because we were shocked how the first 3 tours were fully booked. We changed our itinerary to make a late afternoon tour. Large parking lot. Restrooms on site.
TITLE: Weekend getaway | TEXT: Fast friendly service. Large portions and good food. We will be back the next time in the area. I recommend trying them out. Shrimp and grits were really good

TITLE: Absolutely Wonderful | TEXT: My fiancee, Marie and I eat there all the time. The food is outstanding, the service is excellent and the homemade flour tortillas are just like abuelita (grandma) used to make. We love this place.

TITLE: No reason to go anywhere else | TEXT: If this was the only restaurant in Philly, I would be all set. No reason to go anywhere else. a.kitchen has been consistently exceptional for years. Incredibly good food. Always interesting and very good wine. And the staff and servers here are great; welcoming and always accommodating.

TITLE: Always great | TEXT: My seventh time at Suze and they never disappoint.  The meal was spectacular and the service same.  Wine list is very strong and, as they used to be BYOB, they do not gouge you on the wine up charge so buying a bottle is reasonable.   My go to place for a special meal occasion as I can count on them to deliver!

TITLE: Fun, relaxing, and pleasant. This is a great place to dine with your wife, family, or friends. It has a great ambiance feel to i | TEXT: Me and my wife loved everything about this restaurant from the atmosphere,service, and the dishes. My wife ordered calamari, which was cooked to perfection. I ordered a cocktail called the South Philly, and it was really refreshing. we also ordered their pull apart rolls with softened butter it was warm and soft. And for the main course, we ordered a couple of their seafood dishes

TITLE: Fun, relaxing, and pleasant. This is a great place to dine with your wife, family, or friends. It has a great ambiance feel to i | TEXT: Me and my wife loved everything about this restaurant from the atmosphere,service, and the dishes. My wife ordered calamari, which was cooked to perfection. I ordered a cocktail called the South Philly, and it was really refreshing. we also ordered their pull apart rolls with softened butter it was warm and soft. And for the main course, we ordered a couple of their seafood dishes

TITLE: Terrific All Around Experience! | TEXT: Birthday celebration with myself and my best friend for her upcoming 60th!   Made the reservation online, you were asked if it was for a special occasion, and I said yes for a birthday, and there was a place for comments and I requested a table instead of a booth and when we got there, they knew exactly what we were looking for and seated us accordingly. There was also a small happy birthday sign on the table with some happy birthday confetti around the candle on in the center of the table.   The staff from the hostess to the weight staff, were all outgoing and customer oriented.    We got the Caesar salad, shared a shrimp cocktail, shared lobster mac & cheese. One of us got the ribeye, and one of us got the fillet.    Everything we had was exceptional.   The flavors were spot on, and the portions were generous. The shrimp cocktail came with four jumbo shrimp, which were truly jumbo.   After the salad and the shrimp, we managed to each eat a little bit of the mac & cheese and some of our steaks. We took the rest home for leftovers.   We also ordered a piece of carrot cake to go. The carrot cake was OK and the portion was ridiculously large. The carrot cake is the only not great part of the experience, but certainly not a showstopper.    I would certainly go again.

TITLE: What's not to like?! | TEXT: We had lunch here - very nice. It's located in the heart of the French Quarter - stairs to climb if you want to view the area from above (and who doesn't? LOL) but also seating available on ground level if stairs are too difficult for you. Nice menu selection. Our server was very friendly. I had a shrimp 'po boy sandwich - it was good. My husband scored - he ordered the red beans and rice - dang - it was beyond delicious! Really enjoyed it. The bar drinks were good. Our total for the po boy, red beans and rice - two hurricane drinks was $76. A bit pricey - but you're in the center of the action and have a great view. Glad we went!

TITLE: Review of Revue | TEXT: Revue captures the imagination and breaks the boundaries of what you would expect from a traditional restaurant experience. With multiple themed areas scattered throughout you are sure to have a different ‚Äúview‚Äù each time you visit. Our family of four was seated on ‚ÄúGarrisons‚Äù family porch overlooking the ‚Äúcourtyard‚Äù bar as dusk beamed through the surrounding ‚Äútree‚Äù foliage. Needless to say the theming of the entire space was on the level of a Broadway stage. The food here is absolutely delicious! Every dish we tried was bursting with flavor and cooked to perfection. The portions were appropriate and everyone left satisfied. I highly recommend the Pea Risotto and Prosciutto Pizza. The sourdough pizza base made my partner question their loyalty to our local pizza shop! The night was made complete with our amazing server Tugce. She was friendly, attentive, and went above and beyond to ensure a memorable dining experience. She was incredibly knowledgeable about the menu and offered excellent recommendations as we navigated the mouthwatering menu. She was attentive without being intrusive and made us feel like family. Truly outstanding service from start to finish. Don‚Äôt walk, RUN to this amazing establishment inside The Fairmont Austin.

TITLE: Deserves 6 Stars! | TEXT: Our friends raved about this place, so we had to go. And we‚Äôll go back every time we‚Äôre in Portland.  My husband‚Äôs burger practically melted in his mouth, and he thought the catsup (is there bbq sauce mixed in?) was crazy good on his fries. The breakfast brisket I ordered was nothing like expected. Layers of saut√©ed kale and other veggies, tender meat, and crispy waffle topped with a perfectly fried egg. The fingerling potatoes were piping hot, sooo fresh and flavorful. My husband, a home brewer, thought the beer selection was diverse enough for hoppy lovers and brown ale fans. We were impressed with the local pilsner and ale we had.

TITLE: Very talented chef | TEXT: The dishes were all excellent and full of flavor while having a great visual element as well. The leek soup had a wonderful unctuousness. The duck breast was perfectly warm,  soft, and the fat rendered; wholly satisfying with a light glaze. The fish was a flaky Branzino with a skin just crusty to add to the earthy flavors of the foraged mushrooms. The sake selection was outstanding. We really enjoyed the dining experience. There were multiple families with active small children on a Saturday night though.

TITLE: Riff of Miami not nice | TEXT: I hope you read my review before you eat and not after as i did. Food average Told Happy hour ..but 2 beers still cost ‚Ç¨ $25 for 2 beers. Service 20% and we were shouted at tat we had to pay it. Not a good example of how to treat customers in your town AVOID AVOID AVOID. This has left a very bad impression of your town and your restaurant. Rip off

TITLE: Hmm so so | TEXT: Tamales had taken on a taste from the freezer or something, very odd not so good .  Beef meat is unseasoned just beef. Menu is misleading said it came with beans and rice too and they brought it out with a salad no dressing beans were right out of a can . Said meal was covered in cheese and it was white caso that should have been in the description on the menu. Guacamole was just avacados tomato and onion not flavored at all . Salsa and chips were great . Service was good but they failed to realize we hadn't ate our food but kept asking if we wanted boxes.

TITLE: DELICIOUS | TEXT: Food is great, service is great, our favorite date night place. The only catch is there‚Äôs no call ahead, no reservations, and no text to your phone when the table is ready so be patient (and get there early).

TITLE: Disappointed | TEXT: The afternoon staff was very pleasant, room was clean. Went for breakfast 10 min before they shut down and housekeeper had the only face and attitude, giving us the side eye. Rushing my partner and I so she can turn everything off. To me that was very disrespectful as we paid almost $275 the night to stay there for a concert at Mohegan Casino.

TITLE: Good Food, Good Vibe | TEXT: We stopped by Frog and the Bull this evening for a quick bite after an event close by...  totally picked the place off of Yelp and my confidence in my fellow Yelpers to be on point.  We were not disappointed!  Frog and the Bull is a modest sized place in a strip mall, nice vibe, folks having a good time at the bar.  Destiny was our waitress, she did a great job, attentive but not intrusive.  Thanks Destiny!  We started the meal with the brussels sprouts on the recommendation of Destiny.  What a winner that dish is!  Sprouts, apples, Manchego cheese, sherry vinegarette reduction and some awesome bacon bits... heaven on a plate!   For entrees, we opted for the pepper-crusted filet, medium rare, and the fish and chips.  Both plates were good.  The filet was cooked perfectly, spot on temperature, and the pepper-crust was a bit overpowering.  Not bad, interesting.  We're more purists when it comes to meat, so the filet itself would likely have been even more delicious.  The sides of asparagus and pasta were okay, a Basque-style potato on the side would have outshined the pasta.    The fish and chips were good.  The fish was fresh, nice batter, served piping hot as it should be.  The fish portion was modest, especially given the price tag.  At that price point ($25), the fish serving should have been twice the size.  The initial serving of "chips" were room temperature at best, but that was quickly remedied by Destiny when brought to her attention.  The truffle fries are darn good when hot!  All in all, a good meal.  A 4-star experience.  The above observations are intended to suggest options for improvements, not criticize.  The "Frog" portion of the restaurant's name is an homage by the owner (a former Navy Seal) to his fallen Navy brethren.  (Note the Navy Seal Trident above the entrance to the kitchen).  Thank you for your service!  We will be back, lots of other stuff to try on the menu.  Recommend Frog and the Bull, nice vibe, good food.

TITLE: We love this place!! We travel miles to get to OUR FAVORITE ITALIAN RESTAURANT. | TEXT: Bestie came and we introduced them to our favorite Italian place. We also go every year for his birthday.  We tried: The goat cheese ball appetizer- Excellent sauce with the bread to dip with.ü§å The food truck favorite- good flavor ‚ù§Ô∏è pesto. The limoncello "smooth & creamy"ü§§. The orange cake tastes like a grandma made it with love & the pecans were lighty toasted/ crunchy & the carmel was smooth & sweet like honey OMG! The owner suggested the chocolate mousse. WOW!! üôÉ I instantly turned into the Kool-aid man "OH YEAH" it was so good. We all give it 5 stars.ü§©üòç

TITLE: Strong Across the Board | TEXT: Based on the reviews, I came in with low expectations yet the overall space is very impressive with very high-end, unique decor. The menu is unique and comprehensive. You can eat family style or individual servings. Our server was really good. We were attended to across the board by three layers of staff, and to top it all off our table of seven all thought the food was exceptional. The calamari were some of the best we‚Äôve ever had. The bread service was incredibly impressive. The lobster risotto was delicious and the desserts were all top-notch.

TITLE: No soap in the toilets!!! | TEXT: An amazing collection of memorabilia and superb drinks, what a shame it is let down by basic hygiene standards!! A notice is displayed in the toilets instructing staff to wash their hands but how can employees or customers wash their hands effectively when there is no soap in the ladies toilets other than the disabled toilet!! Shocking!!

TITLE: Exceptional knowledge provided, kindness and a very professional crew. | TEXT: Unforgettable experience. The knowledge shared by sme‚Äôs was invaluable. The world needs Crow Canyon!   The expertise and educational opportunities provided by the center was exceptional. I highly recommend trips with Crow Canyon often.

TITLE: Excellent Tapas Spot | TEXT: Was excited to see this tapas place near our hotel, especially as my colleagues had never tried tapas before. The standards (patatas bravas, pan con tomate, croquettes) were all great. The pork belly was so good we ordered it twice. Would come back again for sure.

TITLE: Harding Presidential Sites | TEXT: We had a great visit to the Warren G Harding Presidential Library and Memorial. The Library (aka Museum) is quite small compared to other presidential libraries, but does a good job telling the story of Harding's short presidency. Tours of his home are only offered on the hour, so we had to miss that, but did take photos from the outside. We also visited the Harding Memorial in the cemetery, which was quite impressive. If you're passing by Marion, Ohio, take a break from your drive and stop by to see the presidential sites.

TITLE: Neat find!  Good food. | TEXT: This was a neat find.  There is indoor and outdoor seating.  We sat outside & the server pulled up a heater for us when it started to get a little chilly.   We ordered Cordon Bleu, & Schnitzel.  The Cordon Bleu was delicious!  The side I ordered was Spatzle & it was a little dry.   There are a ton of combinations that you can customize your entr√©e with.   We also ordered a pretzel for an appetizer, and a Bee Sting for dessert.  Both were good.

TITLE: The food is homemade, cooked fresh & is very delicious for all ages to enjoy. Welcoming environment with Great Service! | TEXT: The food is very delicious, cooked fresh and good to eat for all ages. Environment is welcoming and has excellent service.

TITLE: Beware of charges on your bill... | TEXT: First off, the food was amazing and the service fantastic which makes the rest such a shame.  1. If you make an 8:30 reservation DO NOT choose the 5 course option or chefs choice. You will not have time to fully enjoy the experience.  We weren't even at desert when the place was empty and everyone was cleaning up around us and the bartender left. The music got louder and we were told that if we were uncomfortable we could wrap up the final courses to go. If at the end you still plan going. Keep your choices Ala carte and not so many. 2. We get the bill. Now like most trusting people who aren't expecting to get ripped off we would have just paid but because our server forgot to add our bottle of wine (no problem, these things happen) I decided to look at the check to make sure the rest was right. First thing I see is the beverage tax. In Philly the beverage tax is applied to sweet drinks and energy drinks NOT alcoholic drinks. We did not have what the tax is intended for. We were also charged an $8 credit card fee. With this one-how did they know I'd use a charge card? What if I paid with cash. That aside I did use a DEBIT card. A debit card is the same as cash and cannot be charged a fee. We even googled these things when speaking to the manager to say hey, we're not making this up! When you say to a manager "you're taxing us twice for the bottle of wine?" and he says "YES", there's a problem.  He even removed the beverage tax. (The manager was great and unless the owner would prefer he lied and look stupid,  he did his job) at this point I wasn't going to argue the credit card charge, though he was aware that it was wrong, these people don't make the big money and wanted to go home. This is a Townsend Wentz restaurant. We have eaten at Townsend as well as Amano. We couldn't recall if these charges were applied there in the underhanded way they were applied here but again, we're people who trust and don't expect to get ripped off. I'm thinking the owners are putting their bets on that. Honestly, of the many, many restaurants we have dined at in Philly, this was a first. My son-in-law is a chef and restaurant owner. He'd never risk his reputation by putting a beverage tax on alcohol served or charge the customer $8 for the use of a debit card (let alone put it on the bill before knowing how the customer is paying).  Yes, the food and service was fantastic, so if you're ok with $25 in taxes-the majority of which should NOT be charged-and the knowledge you're being taken advantage of...Townsend Wentz will give you that.

TITLE: Venetian Italian Small Plates | TEXT: We were a party of 8 and did the special tasting menu for $65 pp. I don‚Äôt eat beef or duck so a few of the dishes were not for me but the group overall enjoyed most of the plates. Many items were off menu, but not all. We started with beet arancini (yum!), then a liver mousse ball, meatballs (the most traditional Italian of the dishes), followed by rainbow carrots over ricotta with sugared ginger, bacalao on toast, tuna crudo (our least favorite), clams with grilled bread, two pasta dishes and a panacotta, fig, peach tuile dessert! Yes, that‚Äôs more than 8 but we got an extra dish or two ! The service was very nice and the restaurant is great looking. Very special meal

TITLE: Learning at the Warren G. Harding Presidential Sites | TEXT: Great trip. We arrived at approximately 9:30 am and made our way towards the entrance of the museum. After paying the admission fee, we received a quick overview of the site and went on our way. We opted to view some of the outdoor exhibits first, which included the guard house and press house. The press house contained multiple informational plaques about President Hardings wife and her contributions to society. After viewing the press house, we made our way to the front porch of the house, where we waited for the 10 am guided hour tour to begin. There were guided tours of the presidents former house being held every hour throughout the day. The guided tour of the house was very informational, and the tour guide took us from room to room, while pointing out interesting features and artifacts out for display. The tour guide told us several personal stories related to the Hardings time at the house. The guided tour lasted roughly 1 hour.  After viewing the house, we went back inside to view the main exhibits. We opted to watch a short documentary about President Hardings life and some of the trials and tribulations he faced during his time as President. There were multiple informational plaques out for display, many of them quite text heavy, that went into detail about Hardings upbringing and roots as the owner of a newspaper company in Marion. The plaques also talked about election day, and several of the policy‚Äôs Harding implemented while in office. The last section of the museum dealt with his death and some controversial issues that surrounded his presidency. There were multiple artifacts out for display in the museum, along with short video clips that related to President Harding's time in office.  Tip: I recommend spending 3 hours here if you truly want to see everything.

TITLE: Good Brunch | TEXT: We came here for brunch on a Sunday.  We had the stuffed french toast, gyro omelete, crepes, corned beef hash skillet and sophia's skillet and  coffee.  4 people  and the bill with tip was $91.  Not a cheap place for breakfast/brunch, but the serving size was big and the quality was pretty good.

TITLE: Trying too hard to be something‚Ä¶ | TEXT: The ingredient list on the ‚Äúshared‚Äù plates was so overly complicated that the flavors hit wrong on the palate. Whoever cooked the steak had to have worked in a steakhouse, it was perfectly cooked, perfectly sauced and came out hot. The ‚Äúbest selling‚Äù bread with pimento cheese was deconstructed with pimento in one pile and cheese in another. Guys really? We ordered the crudo which was sauced well but the fish was bland. The noodle dish which was so embarrassingly small, luke warm and brown. This your best offering for a vegetarian dish at $14? We sent it back. We eat all over the world, the constant changing of the cutlery and dishes seemed like a cup game to dazzle.

TITLE: Service bad / food good. | TEXT: Got a reservation within minutes of arrival ( it was 11:55am we wanted and were able to secure a noon reservation without issue).   We sat at the bar, we were told 3 times we‚Äôd get water ( never arrived ).  Had it not been for a manager who I flagged down, I‚Äôm certain I‚Äôd still be waiting to place an order.    The spicy guacamole was top notch - do order this.    The steak and eggs was good.   The house salad was very good - do order this.   Spicy Bloody Mary is very spice - do order this.

TITLE: Very tasty and Great service! | TEXT: Came across the sign online and followed for a while, laughed a lot. While visiting Austin said how about El Aroyo and was disappointed to see the trip advisor rating of 3.5‚Äì especially after tasting the Cancun Avocado Plate and the Mezcalita. Great service from Laura! Unpretentious place with good food and clever wit. I‚Äôm here to lift that rating and tell you go have fun and eat good there!
TITLE: Fast and hot | TEXT: I love the cappuccino in there it always ready hot even when I order it as delivery through their phone number or presto delivery app

TITLE: Top Top Tapas | TEXT: We went with some local friends who have been multiple times and it was possibly the best Tapas I have had. Amazing knowledgeable staff who could not enough to help. Food sensational. So much flavour. We loved it.

TITLE: Commander‚Äôs Corner | TEXT: My husband and I were visiting New Orleans from Virginia. I took my husband to lunch for his birthday on November 12th. Our reservations were for 11:30 we arrived around 11:15 and we were first to arrive. So at 11:30 we were taken to our seats.  We were seated at a table with balloons as there were other tables that had balloons.  Service was impeccable and the food was outstanding but as my husband and I looked around the room we both noticed that as two Afro Americans we were seated or placed in the back in the corner while the rest of the room began to fill up with Caucasians, some regulars and some visiting tourists .  This was our second time in New Orleans and second time at Commander‚Äôs Palace.  This experience made us very uncomfortable and showed us that somethings just won‚Äôt change.

TITLE: Sad night‚Ä¶. | TEXT: Stopped in because of the reviews. The appetizer was great. But both my wife and I had ordered the Fish & Chips. The fish was way over done. So over done I was surprised they even served it. My piece was actually burnt on the end.   And the fries were dark and chewy as if they had been re-heated many times. Very sad indeed when compared to the reviews. On a positive note, we were not charged for either dinner.

TITLE: It's Educational! | TEXT: Maidenhead Heritage Centre is a small building on the edge of the town centre. It is close to the library and with the help of google was easy to find.  There is a small admission charge but well worth it. There is history of the area from ancient times and also more recently including a diorama of the railway in the area. There is also a bit of history about women politicians in the area. I did not realise that Theresa May was not the first lady politician in the area of note.  The most interesting thing to see in the centre is the ATA on the first floor. Colin shared a great deal about the men and women who served in this organisation. There is alot of information on display and it is impressive that this collection of exhibits is available to educate people like me.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
TITLE: So so experience | TEXT: Flavors are nice. Rations sizes  are tiny.  Octopus overcook and cold  Nice atmosphere in a snail place  You shall book your visit

TITLE: Consistent excellence | TEXT: This was our third visit to this always busy restaurant. The food was again excellent. Our wait person was excellent and provided valuable advice. Every dish was special and will return again soon!

TITLE: Reservation request not honored | TEXT: Why make a reservation when they don't honor your request. My husband's 50th birthday dinner was ruined.  After seeing the reviews, I am so glad I didn't waste my money on this place.

TITLE: A Hidden Gem in NW Portland | TEXT: On Saturday night, we were invited to dinner by a friend at Cassidy's Restaurant. What a nice surprise! After 26 years spending lots of living nearby in the Pearl, we discovered this place that has been there since 1979. The food was excellent, the dining room was peaceful, and the wood paneling and flooring provided a great NW atmosphere. The bar is as attractive as it looks on their website. The menu was very good and the cost was very reasonable. Try it out.

TITLE: Nice apt, friendly staff, good value!! | TEXT: The prior reviews are quite old, so we couldn't count on TripAdvisor reviews for Dunas Park Beach Club.   The reception staff (including Tania) were absolutely delightful and very helpful. The apt itself was a one bedroom on the ground floor. It was quite spacious for the two of us and had a patio/sitting area out back looking out on the garden.  The WiFi signal was good, the TV only had one English Channel (news). Never-ending hot water and great water pressure in the shower. The kitchen was nicely stocked - even w sponge and dish soap!   All 3 floors of the apt can use the rooftop terrace, which allows you to see the sunset - or just walk to the cliffs/beach trail.   We didn't use the nice pool (free) or other (paid) amenities like mini-golf, tennis, etc.   We really enjoyed the location and the apt!
TITLE: Overpriced | TEXT: Small portions, not that great and high priced.    Kind of fancy for a strip mall, and just not what I expected.

TITLE: Coconut Grove favorite | TEXT: War a spectacular restaurant.  The ambiance is fun and classy, the service impeccable, the prix fee menu ample and such a value and the food eland drinks delicious.  Such a treat.

TITLE: Best in Jacksonville | TEXT: First time. Excellent food. Best Italian in Jacksonville. Long line to get it. Had a approximately a two hour wait to get in but food was well worth it. Small restaurant with only about 12 tables which is why the wait. Staff very friendly and great knowledge of the menu. Great service. Definitely will be back. Did ask but no reservations, first come, first served.

TITLE: Never disappoints | TEXT: They always make us feel special.  We only dine here a couple times a year because it's a bit far from home, but it's worth the drive.  Our server this time was "Bow", and he is delightful - so knowledgeable and eloquent with his descriptions of the menu offerings, as well as making time to chat a little.  We love this place!

TITLE: Sooo deliciously and yet disappointing! | TEXT: I so looked forward to coming to this location, Ignored as much as possible the crazy noise that I as well as my friends had to yell at our server who could not hear our order... Loved the food but the service was truly unacceptable ! There was NO ONE who looked responsible enough to get their attention, to acknowledge our needs. At the end, our server was eating dinner and we could not get her or any one's attention ( the place was at that point pretty quiet). our friend had to walk up to her to ask for a refill...  Hate giving a small tip ( Which we did not...hope the chef got some acknowledgment) when the people responsible to do the hiring do not take ownership of this so vulnerable business!

TITLE: Never had a bad meal or experience here | TEXT: I've probably eaten here a dozen times and it's always been a pleasant experience.  The staff is always friendly and they act like they take pride in their work and product they put out.  I wouldn't really characterize the process as FAST FOOD.  More of a cook to order deal, but that's just fine with me because the wait is well worth it and I like my food hot and fully cooked (which it always has been at this place).  Eating at this Captain D's, I almost feel like I'm eating at home.  They have a home-like atmosphere.  Welcoming and like I belong when I'm eating here.  The restaurant is clean with tables bused and wiped.  The condiments are easily accessible.  When I have to travel back to Marianna in August, re-visiting this restaurant will be at the top of my TO-DO list.  We always love visiting this Captain D's :-))  Their Tarter Sauce is the absolute best on the planet and my spouse likes their malt vinegar.

TITLE: Skip the Dinner and Just have Dessert and Coffee | TEXT: Sister and I went for dinner.  She ordered veal and I ordered the scallop and pasta special.  Her veal and potatoes were very good but the "vegetable medley" was a pile of mushy vegs. The best thing that could be said about my dish were the two blistered cherry tomatoes were tasty.  The bead size scallops were rubbery, the small amt of sauce was incredibly bland, and the dish was dry. The side garden salads were very nice size, fresh and good.  The salted caramel cheesecake was amazing and strangely enough, the decaf coffee  was truly terrific.  However, a $97 meal (we ordered no alcohol) with mushy vegetables and a non-edible entree was a big disappointment.  The reason I did not send back my entree was that it took 45 minutes for our meal to arrive.  There were 3 servers and 9 tables, so that was not the issue.

TITLE: Flavor party in every bite | TEXT: One of the best restaurants ever! If you enjoy flavor and creativity and great service, this place hits all the marks! The chefs choice tasting menu was fantastic!

TITLE: poor afternoon tea for a restaurant with London in its name | TEXT: I didn't want to complain about this, because the staff members were all so great.  But our afternoon tea was overpriced and poorly prepared.  Nothing seemed to have been created in-house; the pastries were gummy and the chicken curry was unrecognizable.  The tea was made from a tea bag and only one was offered.  The view was stunning, of course, but it is difficult to have what feels like an elegant experience when the table top is so sticky.  Alas- very poor value and a big disappointment.

TITLE: Amazing craft cocktails | TEXT: I visited the Woolworth while on a business trip with my boss. We sat outside on the rooftop patio and enjoyed a nice view of the city. The ambience was nicely appreciated after a long day of work. We ordered a few small plates and some craft cocktails. Everything was delicious, and our service was top-notch and I would definitely go back if I were in the area again.

TITLE: We wouldn't recommend it. | TEXT: Casual is right...it's in a run-down plaza, very basic interior, and you have to order from the counter, although they do bring it to your table.  The "hostess" behind the counter was less than warm and cheerful, and that combined with the lack of ambiance almost made us leave.  However, they had fried oysters on the menu which I'd been craving so we stayed. I had the oysters and absolutely tasteless coleslaw.  The oysters themselves were plump and juicy, but the breading was too heavy and flavorless.  My husband had grilled shrimp wrapped in bacon and fries.  Bacon was basically raw and shrimp, which plump, were tasteless.   Prices were higher than they should be in a place like this.  If it was going for a seaside hut vibe, they definitely missed it.  We would not go back.

TITLE: WELL WORTH A VISIT! PRO TIP: THE RESTAURANT IS FANTASTIC! | TEXT: This is a great way to spend 1 to 3 hours looking at some really unique art and learning about their creators. When we were there they had 100+ wildlife ‚Äúaction‚Äù photos on loan from the London museum of Natural History and it was fantastic. As an added bonus, the on-site restaurant had really good high-end food and live music at lunch time.

TITLE: Decent Mexican retaurant caters to locals | TEXT: Nice local restaurant.  I was from out of town and it seemed like I didn't get as much attention as those who were local.  The food was pretty good and the overall experience was much better than the large chain Mexican restaurant a few blocks away.  Will visit again if in town.

TITLE: Museum and House Tour Make this a fun Visit | TEXT: A visit to this presidential library comprises three potential activities.  First, there is an hour long tour of his house.  Second, the main building includes a small exhibition of his time as President.  Lastly, a mile from the library is his memorial.  We spent just under two hours here.
TITLE: Wonderful lunch treat | TEXT: We had not visited the Gazebo in years, so while visiting Marianna, we stopped by .Our server was Kim, and she took great care of us. The food was delicious.

TITLE: Museum and House Tour Make this a fun Visit | TEXT: A visit to this presidential library comprises three potential activities.  First, there is an hour long tour of his house.  Second, the main building includes a small exhibition of his time as President.  Lastly, a mile from the library is his memorial.  We spent just under two hours here.

TITLE: Best roasted potatos ever! | TEXT: Beautiful place. Went for brunch. Food was great although my eggs could have been warmer. Service was good and friendly but as the place filled up‚Äîour reservation was at opening time‚Äîour waitress disappeared. However, really enjoyed it and would visit again.

TITLE: Waiter | TEXT: Jake was a fantastic waiter.  We usually look forward to George.  In this case Jake was a pleasant replacement.  Food always excellent.  We have been coming here since Fare opened.  A fantastic neighborhood restaurant.  A must ‚Äúgive it a try‚Äù.

TITLE: Worth the Splurge | TEXT: Marianna has almost no truly ‚Äúgood‚Äù choices for eating out. The Salt Block is a gift to this whole area of cheap eats and fried foods. The steaks are pricey but AMAZING-the restaurant is modest but clean. I am grateful for this restaurant and what they provide.

TITLE: More cities should have a Reading Terminal with its excellent regional food choices and great prices | TEXT: I love coming to the Reading Terminal Market with the great selection of food stalls and the sights and smells as you walk around. I love their selections and the interaction between the locals and tourists when people are ordering.   Some of my favorite places to eat in Philly are here with Dutch Eating Place, Beilers Bakery and Bassetts Ice Cream. When Carmine‚Äôs was open, that used to be my favorite place for Cheesesteaks. After a meal, I like to walk around and look at the food displays. Everyone merchandises their food so nicely.  Don‚Äôt miss a visit here when you are visiting Philly.

TITLE: Splendid Saison | TEXT: What a splendid meal at Saison. An innovative and tasty set menu with many standout dishes and presentation - lobster tartare, uni, white truffle pasta, duck etc. I would probably skip the wagyu supplement next time since i‚Äôm not a fan of wagyu generally   Service top notch and friendly as well  The kitchen tour was a plus  9.5/10

TITLE: Best dinner I ever had !! | TEXT: I had the best dinner I ever had. The filet mignon was tender, cooked to perfection, and seasoned perfectly. The Greek salad dressing was amazing. The lemon ricotta cake awesome. Can't rave enough.

TITLE: We weren‚Äôt expecting much judging from the outside | TEXT: But Franco the owner was sooo amazing. Ferrying us around when we needed help. He looks like an old grizzly Italian. But he smiles and is so friendly. There is a picture on the wall of his dad in 1940 working behind the bar. Franco‚Äôs son works there too. They all look alike - and unfortunately smoke! The food is good. Fresh and interesting. Our room was large and light. Loads of hot water. Nothing posh. But comfortable. And clean. Italy at its best.

TITLE: A clean room to stay in | TEXT: I always trust Wyndham and for good reasons. The hotel was very well kept. Very clean room. The front dest staff were very sweet and helpful and they were very attentive during breakfast. Definitely recommend it.

TITLE: Prime Table is the best. | TEXT: First time visit. Ambiance was very nice. Shauna was our server and she greeted us with a smile. She was knowledgeable, and kept our drink glasses were always filled. She bagged our leftovers individually, labeled and dated them. The food was incredible. We had their prime rib and it was impressed.

TITLE: A welcome surprise | TEXT: When we got to San Quirico and saw the town, the main square, and the outside of the hotel, we were prepared to be disappointed. It's a small town, there's a gas station in the center of the piazza, and if you're looking for the hotel - well, the sign mostly indicates the restaurant: Ristorante La Vecchia Fonte. In fact, you have to enter the restaurant, walk through to the back, and say you have a reservation in the hotel. The friendly and helpful (though somewhat English-challenged) staff take you upstairs and show you your room - the rooms are bright, clean, and usable, with views overlooking the piazza or the town. It's a 15 minute (or so) level walk to the historic abandoned town of Vertozza nearby; otherwise, there's not much to do in San Quirico. We had dinner in the hotel's restaurant (Very good!) and breakfast (included) in the back of the restaurant. The promised WiFi didn't seem to connect in our room - but this is often the case in Italian hotels in our experience.

TITLE: Relax and enjoy the Palm | TEXT: I absolutely love this restaurant! Every time I‚Äôm in Boston I make my pilgrimage to the Palm. The food is amazing and the staff is At Olympic Gold Medal level. I could eat there and know I‚Äôm in for a joyous occasion!

TITLE: Regular | TEXT: Very nice property to take pics lol Went for my friends birthday . We had to wait a couple minutes before being seated as it was full even though we had reservations.. Food was ok nothing over the top At the end of the night we had some good pics

TITLE: Eat better for half the price in little Italy | TEXT: On the plus side, the roof top location is spectacular and the staff are very courteous and attentive but then there‚Äôs the food. I can honestly say I have never paid so much to be so underwhelmed. The food though well presented lacked the simple subtle flavours of authentic Italian food. The essence of Italian cooking is to make a few simple ingredients sing, the overall impression of our meal at the Contessa was bland, under-seasoned and definitely not singing. If the garlic and rosemary potatoes don‚Äôt taste of garlic or rosemary, there‚Äôs something wrong. We ate for half the price, with twice the flavour in little Italy

TITLE: Note worth the stop anymore. | TEXT: This place has gone down hill since new ownership took over.  Chicken had been on the steam table until it dried out.  Peach cobbler sat empty the entire time we were there. Desserts by the salad bar we not as good as the old days. So sad.   We won't be back.

TITLE: Great food and service | TEXT: We did the food cart scene in Portland. Wanted to try something different so read the reviews on this restaurant and they were all excellent reviews. Went there and had a great dinner. We had two salmon dishes, and they were excellent our waitress was very attentive .

TITLE: The Cellar Boys on Tuesday nights are amazing; Green Mill service is lacking | TEXT: This is said to be the oldest club in Chicago! We were here on a Tuesday night to see the Cellar Boys, and it was wonderful! We were disappointed to have to share a table, especially given that it was the night of our 30th anniversary and we are both introverts, but I do get it - it is a small venue. I cannot say enough good things about the Cellar Boys - wow, they were awesome! Service at the club was not great. I went up to the bar to ask for water as I was parched, and two people were behind the bar watching the band. I am easy to miss being only five feet tall, so I waved to the lady and she headed my way and looked really angry. Alas, sorry but I really needed water badly, and my server had not been around in ages! I left a tip on the bar and hoped for better days for her. Regardless of the service, I highly recommend stopping in to see the Cellar Boys!

TITLE: Outstanding food 15% grat with no service | TEXT: I would love to come back because food was absolutely delicious and flavorful, I don‚Äôt agree on a 15% grat when I server only took our order never returned to table at all. Even had to go to bar to get to pay tab so we could leave. Hope service becomes better.

TITLE: Great food - very tasty! | TEXT: Fantastic food - we had mushroom bruschetta and steamed buns and pork belly to start. They were so tasty and the two between three of us was perfect.  Then for mains we had the raviolini, halibut and a duck special. All of us were very happy!  The chunky monkey ice cream was also very tasty.  We tried this restaurant because if the great reviews and we weren‚Äôt disappointed. If we are back in Portland we would definitely return.
TITLE: Excellent! | TEXT: The food is very, very good and the atmosphere and service excellent. I came back after several years- and found the inventiveness and quality very good still.

TITLE: Beyond Great Experience Wilder Philadelphia! | TEXT: 2/26/25 Year End Celebration work lunch in semi-private space upstairs. Exceeded our expectations on all fronts! Food, staff, service, beautiful space. Worked closely with Brett who owns Wilder with his partner Nicole. I let Brett know that is was wonderful and we cannot wait to return for another work event and to bring family and friends.  Thanks for everything Brett!

TITLE: Most amazing italian restaurant ever | TEXT: The pear pasta is so amazing it‚Äôs compelling me to write a good review.  This place never disappoints. The staff is very friendly and the food is absolutely delicious.  Once you come here you‚Äôll never go to any other italian spot.  This is THE BEST in Jax. 100%  Get the Pear Fiocchi.  Ur welcome

TITLE: Do not go here | TEXT: They are so unfriendly and so stuck on themselves. We could not get out of our RV spot because the way they did the roads and they‚Äôre blaming us because we drove over the grass. We have a 45 foot coach and that‚Äôs the spot they put us in where we could not get out. The woman came out yelling at us screaming so unprofessional. There‚Äôs a kind way to handle things and there is a bad way to handle things and this woman handle things extremely poorly. They have all these rules here and I am so unhappy with this park I would keep going. There‚Äôs other nice parks in the Durango area.
TITLE: Kings Pub closed | TEXT: Kings Pub is no longer there, closed to make way for hotel and flats, very disappointing. Visited numerous times over the years, so sad to see it has gone.

TITLE: Frog bull | TEXT: Try and try as I  may--this place just has horrible customer service. We have attempted them 3 times! Just not warm and welcoming at all, which is sad and disappointing because they are within walking distance for us.
TITLE: MUST TRY IN THE ARTS DISTRICT | TEXT: Had anniversary cocktails and apps here. SUCH amazing food and drinks. Service was EXEPTIONAL. I recommend everyone to go

TITLE: Don‚Äôt miss it!   Wonderful experience. | TEXT: Amazing service from Austin!  Great wine recommendation.  The food was outstanding.  I loved the pasta course.  Wish I could have that every day!  Not our first or last visit to this wonderful restaurant.

TITLE: Affordable Turkish Meal | TEXT: There were 4 of us who dined in this restaurant. We were the only customers which could be because it was 2 days before Valentine‚Äôs Day. I could not fault the service. The food was well presented and cooked healthily. I enjoyed my chicken shish but would have preferred to have it marinated as I‚Äôve experienced elsewhere. The price was reasonable including the wines on offer.

TITLE: They're Trying | TEXT: Some interesting sounding appetizers enticed us to check this place out. Furikake fries: unusual Japanese spices served with two uncommon sauces, quoth the menu.  Blah.  Flavorless.  Sauces seemed mostly like ketchup with a bit of BBQ sauce and a mayo.  Unconsumable. BUT...the wood oven baked Khachapuri was quite tasty, although it could have used a much bigger dose of garlic and butter.  Again, unusual, with, of all things, a soft egg yolk proudly in the center.  Now, HOW this item appeared on what is a pretty standard fare menu is anyone's guess. The "Ora" king salmon was perfectly cooked and served on a plentiful bed of mixed vegetables.  Would be enhanced with some balsamic glaze, and that could be served in a cup on the side. The pineapple crisp dessert was another item that sounded great but whose execution left lots to be desired.   Topped with a rubberized piece of pineapple that could have served well as a drain closure.  Ice cream was OK, but they left the crisp off the crisp.  Oh, well... Pleasant, helpful, and attentive service personnel. Limited and not outrageously priced wine and beer offerings; easy free parking. Restroom could use some policing.

TITLE: Went down hill with non existant service and not so good food | TEXT: Went down hill big time.  Used to make the 90 mile run many times a year but this time really was the last ever.  waited 15 minutes to order drinks and that took another 15 with no coffee refills ever.  Food wasn't what it used to be and there was no service at all.  Then we had to wait 20 minutes to get our check and another 15 at the cash register.  Sad to see a once great place slide so bad
TITLE: Top quality | TEXT: Lovely food at  fair pricing served by professional staff. Would definitely recommend instead nearest similar outlet such as Mira.

TITLE: Great service and good food | TEXT: Found this gem for our lunch. It was hard to figure out what to order because prices were a bit high.  I ordered the Tuscany panini and my husband ordered a hamburger. We thoroughly enjoyed the sandwiches. Our French fries were hot and had great seasoning on them.  Service was incredible with very hardworking servers. The only negative for us was a radio that played in back. It was a tinny and loud and got irritating

TITLE: Expecting Better | TEXT: We arrived early for our reservation and we were seated quickly.  It was not very busy as it was a Wednesday night, but maybe a bit too busy for the limited waitstaff. The atmosphere was nice.  Not too noisy but a good sound and the kitchen is visible from the restaurant.  The food was a little disappointing.  We had several sides and the pork chop and they all seemed to be lacking flavor, they would good but we were expecting a bit more.  The service was good considering the waiter was handling quite a few tables.

TITLE: Why have a reservation? | TEXT: I typically enjoy Haywire however, the past 2 times we have been awkwardly greeted by the hostess even with a reservation BOTH times.  The hostess seemed to be preoccupied and somewhat detached from greeting customers. The restaurant was maybe 30% capacity.  Slow Sunday around 1:30. The hostess tried to seat us at a tiny 2 top table on the patio. Our res was not for the patio. We asked if we could sit inside, and she hesitantly said "yes" and told us to have a seat and wait.....After waiting 10 minutes she took us past 6 open booths and 4 tables to sit us directly between two parties at another 2 top table.   We sat there for 7-8 minutes without being greeted by a server and decided to sit at the bar. When asked about all of the open booths and tables and we were told they were "reserved and for 4 or more guests".  We ordered two drinks at the bar and were handed menus.  The bartender was doing inventory and the service bartender stayed busy.   We had to flag down the bartender to order food after waiting 35 minutes.  The food was average.  My chicken was half breaded and the gravy was nonexistent which made eating it with the large biscuit dry and difficult. While sitting at the bar we noticed several of the booths were being sat with parties of 2. Upon leaving many of the tables and booths remained unoccupied.  The next time we Brunch in Dallas, this won't be high on our list.  The experience starts with the first face you see.

TITLE: Family of 6 celebrating a special birthday dinner | TEXT: We have been dining at this restaurant with our entire extended family many times over the years and the experience has generally been good. This visit was however most disappointing in terms of the food quality and service. It was a special birthday celebration and my steak dinner  entree came out barely warm so I asked for it to be redone or replaced with something else if that was easier. After a few minutes the very same plate reheated was served to me and passed off as fresh- I could immediately tell as id taken a bite of the potato piece earlier. The meat was obviously over cooked now that it had been reheated. I was so disappointed as it was not a fresh plate as one would expect from a fine dining restaurant.

TITLE: Toro | TEXT: Went for sushi which was good. Seated quickly and service was efficient. The place has a nice location across from the water with a parking lot.  We enjoyed it overall however it may be positive to tidy up and refresh the dining room.

TITLE: Good Flautas - March 2021 | TEXT: So a solid three stars for this little restaurant. Now there are only two Mexican restaurants in town. But coworkers have told me they weren't impressed whatsoever with the other place   I really felt like having some flautas. They had them on the menu but clarified that they were made corn tortillas. In my book, those are taquitos...and it was indicated on the menu. So I asked the waiter if they would make them with flour tortillas. He said no at first but then said he'd check with the cook. He returned and said no problem. While waiting I was served some salsa & chips...which were pretty average. I also had a Modelo Especial. My flautas (3) were very good and I recommend you request them this way if you order them. I even told my waiter he should suggest the option to his restaurant patrons.  Because of the pandemic, they created a drive up window, but don't know if you're required to call in your order ahead. Prices were average and the staff was nice. There's a small bar but I believe they only sell beer. There's a couple TV monitors inside. No complaints and nothing to rave about. No objections to eating here again.
TITLE: We liked it | TEXT: We got mahi in garlic sauce with yellow rice and plantains and it was delicious.  A busy restaurant but we weren‚Äôt rushed out.  Hope to go again.

TITLE: Great service but preferred food next door | TEXT: I loved my lasagna at Vespaio so decided to try their sister restaurant next door. At least I think it‚Äôs a sister restaurant - it sometimes is known as Enoteca Vespaio in articles I‚Äôve read. Service at the bar was very good and the food was decent. I had the Caesar salad (should have declined the anchovies) and the rigatoni with arrabiata sauce and pork meatballs. The menus were very similar. I just preferred my meal and the cozy ambiance at Vespaio next door.

TITLE: Best restaurant in Austin, consistently | TEXT: We eat at Odd Duck a few times a year; they occasionally miss the mark with a dish or two, but generally over 2-3 visits a year for the past 5 years, they are consistent, with delicious food and friendly service, at prices that we feel good about, for the value. Cocktails are complex, layered, and super tasty.   We've tried a lot of other hyped up restaurants in Austin and been disappointed often. We'll come back to Odd Duck again and again.

TITLE: Disappointed This Time | TEXT: So I went to Warmdaddys for the first time last year in May. Food was good enough, but I especially liked the skillet mac and cheese and the cornbread. Went back on Tuesday expecting at least the same quality or better. Sadly, I was highly disappointed. The greens mixed with cabbage was watery, mushy, and flavorless. The yams were watery, the catfish was flavorless and didn‚Äôt seem like fresh fish. I‚Äôm thinking it was bagged. And the star of my first visit, the mac and cheese was dried out and flavorless! I will say the turkey wings were AMAZING!   Another thing worth mentioning is the 18% gratuity was charged without our knowledge. There was only two of us and the bill was $65, so adding gratuity wasn‚Äôt standard. When I asked the server about this, she informed us that it‚Äôs automatically added on certain nights.    After this experience with the food I probably won‚Äôt be back
TITLE: amazing | TEXT: wonderful delicious kosher food and wine decent covid policy good service and not pushy to buy a case of wine although many guests do I would go back again as soon as I can
TITLE: peaceful place | TEXT: great relaxing place to have a morning coffee with a fresh pastries free wifi and friendly welcoming service. thanks..

TITLE: Staff Attitude | TEXT: My first and last time dining at this restaurant. Our server was great but one staff that was working at the backyard was rude and nasty. She was annoyed when I was standing by the door of the restroom which I must say they have a very small place. She kicked me out by saying "step outside!" What an attitude treating their customers. We like exploring French restaurants in San Francisco but this will be out of our list and will not recommend. Disappointing!

TITLE: Quiet pleasant two day stay. | TEXT: A lovely quiet family run hotel with very helpful staff. It's an older rustic building with a clean room comfortable bed with a mosquito net.   Nice garden a large water monitor came for a visit whilst I was having my breakfast the food both dinner and breakfast was good.  Great value for money.

TITLE: 3-star yes - but no glow | TEXT: Is Benu a 3-star restaurant?  For creativity, intelligence, dedication, flavours and sheer brilliance of the individual dishes, the answer is yes.  But I walked away feeling somewhat empty.  Reflecting on it, I think the dishes were individually brilliant but as a whole, it did not convey a sense of a journey or a story.  Modern Cali-Korean food is fine but where is it going?  And the service is not consistent and it was akin to a bistro service.  For the sort of cash Benu is asking for, the front of house needs to be improved significantly.  If this restaurant was in France, it would have lost 2 stars for the patchy service.

TITLE: Not Great but very inexpensive | TEXT: At first glance this hotel seemed to be well-located, as it is right at a busy 4-way intersection with a rotary and pedestrian bridge outside. That is, until you actually explore and find that there's nothing worth visiting around there. Yes, lots of stores and some restaurants, but really none of note. The hotel itself is pretty old, and in disappointing condition given that it is managed by a 4-star airline. My room door, wooden and creaky, had to be forced shut. Lighting in the room was laughably crooked, no minibar, no free bottled water, furniture very dated, bathtub missing stopper. Room control panel near the bed is difficult to figure out (i.e. no English), even for a seasoned traveler. The check-in staff were friendly, but when I checked out I couldn't find my key they charged me 30rmb for it. In the States I usually keep my keys but in China many Chinese hotels demand return. No big deal, but 30rmb is steep compared to the room price, which is actually the best thing about the hotel. There's also free internet and surprise surprise HBO. It was dirt cheap at under $30 a night, so based on that I am giving this 3 stars rather than 2.

TITLE: Great food and service!! | TEXT: This place is a hidden gem and I can‚Äôt understand why it‚Äôs not packed!!!  Conch Fritters, smoked fish dip, red shrimp, shrimp po boy were all amazing!!!  Service is great!  Nice laid back place with amazing food!!!
TITLE: Cheap ok food | TEXT: You pay per the weight of the food you take the more you take the more you pay.  Big choice of all kinds. Sushi. Soups. Salads. Grilled meats and so on.  Just ok not more

TITLE: Worst dining experience ever | TEXT: I have never had such a regrettable dining experience anywhere. They did nothing to accommodate my nephews food dislikes and my wife‚Äôs  dairy allergy. There was no salad option offered other than one with cheese and sardine dressing. But the real clincher was the beef dish we ordered for $65‚Ä¶.. At that price we figured it was a good quality NY strip. WRONG‚Ä¶.no exaggeration, they brought a plate with THREE slices of beef- THREE!! And the measurements were probably- and again no exaggeration- 3 Inches long  by 1 inch wide and a quarter of an inch thick‚ÄîI couldn‚Äôt believe it- $200 later, we left hungry and with the feeling we were ripped off

TITLE: Relaxed Fine Dining | TEXT: We chose Hells Kitchen for our one year anniversary. We walked in and were welcomed, escorted to our table and given a drinks and sushi menu. Soaking in the atmosphere you cannot help but notice a quantifying array of pitchforks. I asked a server how many they were but that will remain a mystery.   We then met Caesar- a brilliant server for relaxed fine dining, clearly knowing his role inside out. I would describe him as attentive, cheerful, upbeat, helpful, and incredibly on the ball which led us feeling extremely relaxed and excited for the evening ahead. He initially let us get settled, and once we had chosen the wine he suggested some food.   The wine we went for was a Sauvignon blanc 2022, in the Grgich Hills of Napa Valley, costing us $85, after checking vivino, it was only marked up $20.   We also had complimentary bottled spring water from Tuscany.   To start with we had octopus, tuna tartar, and the wagyu and pork meatballs.  The octopus had been charred, accompanied with delicious sweet tomatoes and potatoes. As someone who doesn‚Äôt like seafood and has tried octopus before and haven‚Äôt been keen, I would‚Äôve finished the plate.  The tartar was flavoursome, beautiful, and fresh. The corn chips were salty to balance the flavour.  The meatballs were the best meatballs I have ever eaten. The meat was incredibly tender and soft, and seasoned perfectly with herbs. The tomato sauce rich and deep in flavour. .   We chatted and admired the kitchen, had are drinks topped up whilst waiting for our mains. Our glasses were never empty. Our servers were extremely attentive.   They arrived, we both ordered the signature Wellington, with the potato puree, brussel sprouts and macaroni and cheese.   The presentation of the Wellington was simple yet elegant. I just stared for a minute not knowing how to tackle it.  I picked up my knife, pressed it lightly onto the Wellington and my jaw dropped in disbelief. The tenderness of the beef was just wow. I softly cut into my wellington with a smile on my face. I only managed half because of the richness, but that‚Äôs my problem, not the wellingtons.  On the drive back I ate the other half like a pork pie and it was equally magnificent.   Sprouts were very rich and crunchy, I couldn‚Äôt have sat there and smashed through a bowl of it.  The mac and cheese was slightly underwhelming. It wasn‚Äôt ‚Äôknock your socks off that‚Äôs good Mac and cheese.‚Äô The potato puree was creamy, elegant and yum.   The stars of the show were the Wellington and the starters.  Caesar kindly took an anniversary picture of us, gave us the bill ensuring there is no rush to leave.   We left just before 10 after an amazing 2 hour dining experience, and had a walk in the local area - a lovely part of downtown Miami.
TITLE: Excellent | TEXT: Very pleasant and cozy, good location, helpful staff, very good breakfast. Be sure that I will reccomend it to my friends

TITLE: Worth the visit!!! | TEXT: I was very impressed with the Warren G. Harding Presidential Sites.  We took the tour of his house, and listened first hand from the tour guides all about when Harding gave speeches on the "front porch".  The house is stunning and is 90+ percent original from years ago when Warren and his wife Florence lived in the house.  The tour guides can answer any questions you have off the top of their heads.  The  Library & Museum was finished in the spring of 2021 and they have a nice gift shop in there too.  They spared no expense in the construction of the building - it is beautiful!!!!  If you are a history buff, this is a must do.

TITLE: Intrigued after reading the reviews.... | TEXT: We were looking for a small pub not a modern, chain type place and found it! The reviews pretty much slated a barmaid but we found them very attentive and friendly especially the dark haired lady. Yes 80's music is playing but it's a fun trip down memory lane as we heard a lot of music we haven't heard for years. If I am ever in Berlin again then I would definitely visit the King's Pub again. Try it x

TITLE: We Really Like This Place | TEXT: I read some of the reviews and am sorry some seem disappointed. We have been twice and sat at the bar for drinks and dinner. Both times have been exceptional. The second time we were served by the owner. Akhil has an incredible knowledge of food prep and wines. We loved everything we ordered. If they are out of something it is because they only stock fresh for the day. I'm good with that. I do admit we went on weeknights in the winter when things might be a bit slower and there are mostly locals there who all seem to know each other so it was very relaxed. We'll keep going back. Good food, good service and pleasant atmosphere.
TITLE: Cold | TEXT: Coffee was bitter and service was ok. Anti-2nd amendment. Pastry was too sweet & just so-so. Clean & neat.

TITLE: Odd Duck Austin, at the Chef‚Äôs Counter: A Night of Personal, Palate-Driven Play. | TEXT: From the moment you sidle into Odd Duck and slide into the chef‚Äôs counter, the meal feels less like a dinner and more like an edible conversation with the kitchen. The kitchen‚Äôs intimate choreography‚Äîflame, fork, and ferocious curiosity‚Äîsets a high bar for tasting-menu storytelling.  This night, seated inches from the heat and bustle, offered a stream of inventive bites that balanced seasonal audacity with comforting textures and precise technique.  The setting amplifies the meal: you‚Äôre not just observing the plate, you‚Äôre watching how intention becomes taste in real time. The energy from the cooks, the quick taste checks, and the moment-to-moment adjustments lend the tasting a live, improvisational rhythm.  Fresh draft watermelon fresca: A refreshing opener that primes the palate with bright acidity and fruit-forward brightness. The texture contrast and cooling finish likely set a playful, summery tone for the night.  Texas pickles: Expect a bold, tangy punctuation‚Äîcrisp texture, assertive acidity, and perhaps a touch of sweetness. Pickles here are not an afterthought but a defining bite that signals the kitchen‚Äôs love for zesty contrast.  Pork belly slider: A classic anchor that often serves as the night‚Äôs emotional anchor‚Äîrich, satisfying, and balanced by a crisp exterior and perhaps a sharp pickled accent or herb pop. The slider format promises immediacy and comfort while still leaving room for technique to show.  Cast iron cheddar cornbread: This likely delivers a toasty, caramelized crust with a rich, melty cheddar inside. The cast-iron finish usually adds depth and a slight smokiness, offering a grounded counterpoint to lighter courses.  Redfish ceviche: A bright, citrusy, seafood-forward note that showcases freshness and technique in curing. The ceviche should feel clean, with a nuanced balance of acidity and a touch of brightness to keep things lively.  Thai apple salad: A bright, aromatic interlude‚Äîcrisp apples, maybe herbs, heat, and a balancing acidity. Expect a playful balance of sweet, sour, and fresh heat, lifting the meal with herbal lift.  Fettuccine shrimp: A pasta course that blends succulent shrimp with a likely buttered, perhaps slightly citrusy sauce. Textural contrast and a clean, seafood-forward core would anchor this plate in comfort while letting seafood flavor shine.  Blackened redfish with mesquite and vanilla bean scoop: This sounds like a bold, smoky main that leans into spice, wood-fire aroma, and a surprising vanilla note‚Äîan inventive sweet-smoky finish that creates a memorable, almost mischievous twist.  Final note‚ÄîMesquite vanilla bean scoop: Expect a creamy, aromatic end that complements the savory notes with a gentle sweetness, leaving you on a soft, satisfying close.  Odd Duck Austin, experienced from the chef‚Äôs counter, delivers a distinctive tasting experience that blends seasonal clarity with adventurous flavor experiments. It rewards diners who embrace curiosity and savor the storytelling arc of a well-curated menu. If you‚Äôre craving a night where the kitchen feels like a collaborative partner rather than a distant authority, this counter-seat experience is worth seeking out.

TITLE: A Great place to stay! | TEXT: Arjuna Ridge is a beautiful place to stay close to Hobart. Luxury accommodation in peaceful rural surroundings. Close to The Bruny Island ferry , there are also many gourmet dining opportunities close by .

TITLE: Nice Italian restaurant in the Fairmont | TEXT: We had a very nice Italian meal at this resturant. Upbeat vibe, good food, adequate wine list and excellent service. Attire was dressy casual.  We dined at about 7 pm on a Sunday night and it was not a problem to get a table. That said,  best to make a reservation.
TITLE: Delicious | TEXT: So glad we stopped when passing through. Everything we ordered was delicious and the chowder was amazing. Will be back for sure.

TITLE: Check your bill | TEXT: I was really disappointed with my recent visit to Sampan on 10/27. The food itself was delicious, but when I got home and looked over my receipt, I realized I was charged for two meals instead of one for several items. I double-checked to make sure it wasn't something I ordered by mistake--it definitely wasn't.  I am not sure how this is even possible since only one item of each was delivered to our table.  Is it a scam???  The total amount overcharged was $109.   I tried calling and emailing the restaurant to sort it out, but haven't been able to get a response yet. Mistakes happen, but overcharging a customer and not fixing it right away doesn't leave a good impression.   Please double-check your bill before you leave!  I hope management sees this and reaches out so this can be corrected.  Table 54
TITLE: A hidden treasure | TEXT: This restaurant is a hidden gem. It‚Äôs like a little bit of New York with wonderful atmosphere. The liver and onions is the best

TITLE: Good food and service | TEXT: We had dinner with a group of friends while visiting Boston this month.  The service was good and the food was even better.  Everything we had was delicious...the mussels, sole, filet, and desserts were all great.  We would eat there again on our next trip.
TITLE: Nice place in the heart of Texas. | TEXT: You are in the heart of Texas when you are in the city of Austin.  Many things to see and do and many great places to eat and drink.

TITLE: Birthday celebration! | TEXT: Read all the wonderful reviews so gave it a try. Went early as read there are always lines. Yup! Not early enough, so we sat at the bar which was perfect! The bar tender Scott was amazing, friendly, attentive and fun! Kept our wine glasses full! Food was fantastic! We were having such a great time I didn‚Äôt take any pictures until after. We‚Äôll be back!! Highly recommend!

TITLE: 1st Time Visit, in Love with it | TEXT: We went there two weeks ago and honestly fell in love with it. I'm a foodie, scratch kitchen guy, the food was wonderful. Salmon was tender enough that it melted like butter. Ambience was old school Little Italy. It is our new favorite.   As to the service, our service was great, but it was old school. Nothing is very fast. It seems only the owner takes orders and so you wait for him. This is an experience. If you're not ready to order a drink/ app, it was the kind of place where you might wait 10 minutes and then they will check in again-- not 2 minutes, This isn't fast casual. Dinner is the event.
TITLE: Beautiful | TEXT: Our ladies had a wonderfuk time at the Holiday Afternoon Tea!  Great service from Carlos and Jitendra!  Great experience!
TITLE: Excellent | TEXT: Excellent service, Mathew made my little boy very welcome. Food was amazing ! Best curry had in a long time . We will definitely be back
TITLE: Amazing burgers and great drinks | TEXT: Amazing goat cheese burger and great beer. The hazelnut cappuccino was also incredible. I already know I'm getting the lamb burger when I come back.

TITLE: Perfection! | TEXT: This is worth the extra effort to go.  It was perfection from beginning to end.  I couldn‚Äôt decide on the soup so our waiter brought me a trio of samples of the three on the menu.  So thoughtful.  We were there for jazz brunch on Sunday.  Great value for the price.  Be sure to walk the neighborhood afterwards.  So gorgeous.

TITLE: Best in Seattle! | TEXT: Easily the best food I have had in the last 10, 20 maybe even 30 years. No exaggeration. My wife and I each did the four courses and were able to sample 8 dishes between us. My favorite was the chilled mussels. It‚Äôs like eating a symphony of taste. The rabbit croquettes were outstanding. The cr√®me br√ªl√©e cake and the three cheese desserts are both outstanding. Service? So professional. We took our time eating and they treated us like kings. Did I mention the breads? Wow!!!

TITLE: Great date night! | TEXT: We went last night for the abbreviated menu and it was delightful.  Perfect service that was both professional and playful.  The smell alone is worth another star.  The food was sublime and the wine pairings were different but matched beautifully.  The chef came by and visited with us and he was lovely.  Beautiful room and a gorgeous kitchen.

TITLE: Very good food, service | TEXT: My husband and I made a last minute reservation. The only option on the app was outdoor seating. When we got there, outdoor seating looked comfortable even on a chilly fall evening but we were surprised to be offered the option of indoor seating which we accepted. The food was excellent, arrived quickly, and the service was very good. I also appreciated that the noise level wasn't bad. We'll gladly come back next time we're in town.

TITLE: Decent food and service, neither are special. | TEXT: Decent food and service, neither are special.   We arrived at 6 PM with a 6 PM reservation and were asked to wait.  At 6:15 we were seated.  Service was fast and cordial, but not rushed.    I ordered a Cheeseburger ($22) without mayo and my Wife had the Sashimi Tuna Salad ($29).  The burger was actually good and cooked as requested.  It is served with a plate full of fries which are probably good if hot but mine were cold.   My Wife enjoyed the Tuna which is seared on the sides so not technically Sashimi but rather Seared Tuna.   We shared a Key Lime Pie ($10) which was good but small so we should have gotten two.  All of the food is overpriced but most restaurants are these days.

TITLE: One of the best restaurants around | TEXT: This restaurant is hands down one of the best places I've ever been for a meal. The service is impressive but the food, the food is absolutely some of the best I've ever eaten. I can't say enough about the entire place. If you are within a 50 mile range take the drive there. You will not be disappointed.

TITLE: Excellent food and good service! | TEXT: We tried this cute coffee shop and cafe for breakfast. The most delicious breakfasts are served here. The TikTok Sammie was delicious with sausage and cheese. The omelets were filled with fresh vegetables and a choice of meats. The grits were delicious and creamy. Service was excellent and the food was served promptly and piping hot. Coffee was good too. We will definitely be back!

TITLE: good food | TEXT: Good food affordable prices and friendly service floors always filthy i seen a bum right out front of their door he wasnt eating so he had no bussines being there I really like their food so i give it a five.

TITLE: Great customizations available | TEXT: Stopped in recently for a late working lunch. Sat at the bar because I needed a charge. It was mostly quiet but steady due to the time.   Service was good - bartender was able to accommodate allergies easily and graciously.   I had the blackened shrimp - so good and very filling. I wasn‚Äôt able to finish all the fries which were also so yummy.   I can‚Äôt believe I haven‚Äôt tried this place yet - I will definitely be back.

TITLE: #1 North End Italian | TEXT: Best Italian food I‚Äôve ever had including Italy! Everything we had was incredible and the service was first class. I was quite worried as we couldn‚Äôt get a reservation but walked up and got there early. Will be on my list for my next Boston visit!
TITLE: Great Latte | TEXT: We ordered 2 latte's off the app and when we pulled into the store everything was ready on the counter. Super service.

TITLE: disappointed | TEXT: This place is a gem in my book, exact during my last visit. My wife gets salmon every time we go which is more than 2 times a month. The place is expensive. My wife had to send her food back 3 times. The waitress basically was too busy to take my entire order every time I asked for something. My wife had to ask for a fork 3 times because the waitress forgot. They comped our meal, but after the sideshow with our loyalty account, it will be awhile before we return (we convinced our friends and now I regret it)

TITLE: Some of the BEAT Italian food I have ever had!!!! | TEXT: Highly recommend this place, Great food,  Great atmosphere & Great service!!!! The one draw back is lack of signage can make it a little hard to find but worth looking for!!!!

TITLE: High-priced excellence | TEXT: The food here is amazing. Everything prepared to perfection. The baked potato was huge and the steak was cooked perfectly. The only issue is the price is astronomical. The porterhouse steak was $110. Table surface was superb.

TITLE: A wedge of happiness. | TEXT: My family came to this cute restaurant for dinner. The service was excellent!! The food was very delicious and the live music was very good! We ordered some fried gater. I took a bite of it and had to spit it out lol. Probably just psychological. My family liked it. I ordered the Wedge salad and I really liked it.

TITLE: Left poorer, but still hungry | TEXT: We had been trying to get a reservation here for ages and were really disappointed by our experience. There were a couple positives -- staff were lovely and Audrey's wine pairing, while poured with a stingy hand, was well planned and full of interesting choices.   The food was the real dissapointment. First, there just wasn't enough of it. We left hungry and got fries on the way home. Not what you want paying more than $500 for dinner. The food ranged from pretty good -- the rockfish, the blue cheese puff -- to pretty bad -- under seasoned and dry pork belly (like how do you even make pork belly too dry?). Nothing we ate was memorable in a good way.  We've been to a lot of Michelin star restaurants and I have no idea what happened here. Is the chef doing Paleo? Give us some pasta or a potato or something more than tiny slivers of fish and radishes for all this money. I know everything is more expensive these days but a dinner like this shouldn't leave people hungry.

TITLE: More, I want more! | TEXT: Wow I am glad I found this place.  I was in town, we were all hungry. I saw this place out of the corner of my eye and something told me to pull in. So I did and I was super happy with the quality of the food. Although the salmon could have been cooked about 2 to 3 minutes longer, the flavors and the veggies totally rocked. I WILL BE BACK !

TITLE: Skip it. Touristy and overpriced | TEXT: I‚Äôve been walking past it for a few years and my sister wished to try it on her birthday. Dirty martini was made with black olives. Huh? And for $15! Sent that back. Flatbread was room temperature. Sent that back. What I won‚Äôt do is go back. Save your $$ and go elsewhere.

TITLE: Over rated don‚Äôt waste your your hard earn money | TEXT: This was one of the worst experiences I‚Äôve ever seen in portland. There‚Äôs a fantastic food scene in Portland and I would highly recommend checking out anything else. The food is yummy but very expensive and the service might be the worst I‚Äôve ever come across. Save your money and check out anywhere else! Pretentious, entitled, and over rated! Do better!
TITLE: Birthday treats | TEXT: Delicious artichoke and spinach dip fab rib eye and brownie dessert did not disappoint our friends friends server Stephan was a joy thankyou

TITLE: Good spot for lunch | TEXT: On a whirlwind tour of San Francisco for visiting relatives, we stopped here for lunch.  It was a lovely afternoon, and we really appreciated the view of the sea lion docks and bay from the dining room.  Service was wonderful, very friendly and attentive.  Our food was good.  I had the salmon burger with fries.  It was quite tasty.  We also tried the pulled pork sandwich, very good.  Prices were reasonable for touristy San Francisco.  I would return next time I'm playing tourist in the city.

TITLE: Over priced dog food. | TEXT: Gravy with tamales? Wth... gross, over priced dog food with gravy, weirdest combo I've seen. I feel robbed I paid, and will never ever come back. To make things worse they have a comedian here that doesn't fit a nice Latino restaurant.

TITLE: Lounge Has It All | TEXT: Nicely crafted and creative drinks, delicious food served up in a historic and beautiful setting, with stellar views over the city. I enjoyed their cheeseburger as well as several other items during our stay at the Bellevue; all were excellent. They offer a sweet happy hour which includes some drinks and some food. The service is impeccable, but also very welcoming and friendly. I enjoyed the drinks, food and ambience so much, I kept going back; it was that great.

TITLE: YUMMY GREEK FOOD | TEXT: GREEK FOOD YUM: Spinach pie platter with Greek salad and Greek yogurt with honey& cinnamon. Come check this place out its so good #weightlossjourney #fitnessjourney #menshealth #fatloss
