TITLE: Def worth a visit! | TEXT: Well if you can‚Äôt find some food here, there is something wrong with you. All the local stuff you would expect plus bundles of ice cream, fresh meats and cheeses, and chocolate.  Well worth an hour of your time.

TITLE: Ok but not great | TEXT: We saw that the restaurant had good reviews so we gave it a shot. Have nothing negative to say, but not anything good either. So 3 stars as I consider it average. Had dumplings and Fried rice with mushrooms. Price a little high for average food

TITLE: Not good at all | TEXT: Ask for my cheese to be scrambled with eggs didn‚Äôt add any cheese at all. I called and the manager argued me down that he did and I took pictures. Bad experience. Everyone makes mistakes but why not try to fix as a business owner.

TITLE: Not what it used t o be.................. | TEXT: First time to the new Suze.......they did a nice job with the new location; very pleasant and one of the few places that wasn't so dang loud that you could not carry on a conversation.  The server (Perry) did a great job.   The orkra special appetizer was certainly plentiful, hot, and  fresh however the dressing (Madras curry buttermilk ranch dressing)   "dip" lacked any hint of curry. The Porcini Pappardella Pasta was short on meat sauce unlike previous times my wife enjoyed that entr√©e.  The special seared dbl bone-in Heritage pork chop would have been great had it not been swimming in jus....the broth simply dissolved the polenta, wiped out the flavor of any apple chutney and soaked away the otherwise enjoyment of any distinct flavor of the "char" on the chop.  On the positive side was an outstanding Sticky Toffee Pudding.    Wish the overall meal could have been better as all the meals had been in the past.  Price was right at $140 for the two of us but considering all the restaurant choices available there really is no reason to go back.
TITLE: In N Out is always GOOD | TEXT: In N Out is always GOOD Really good fast food And it is always fast and good Best burgers,, I always asks for them to make my fries very crispy

TITLE: Lunch at Eem | TEXT: Great friendly staff Efficient waiter Disappointing food Burnt ends white curry had very deccicated beef, and the curry was thin The Fried chicken was deftly fried, but had little flavor, either in Chicjen or spices
TITLE: Great restaurant in a new, larger, very nice location | TEXT: Another excellent meal @ Suze on New Years Eve! One of our favorite places in Dallas. Can‚Äôt wait to go back again.

TITLE: WE LOVED EVERY SECOND! | TEXT: Warmdaddys was AMAZING! The food was SO delicious, and Tanqueray Hayward + Band absolutely killed it with their performance! The Skillet mac n cheese and fried chicken were to die for. Can‚Äôt wait to go back!
TITLE: Sunday Brunch | TEXT: This is the second time I've been here for brunch and the food is pure comfort and delicious. The Cheddar Potato Cake was fantastic and the Mimosa is a must for Brunch.

TITLE: Never again, they‚Äôre lazy and lousy‚Ä¶ | TEXT: The service was terrible. I ordered my food online and I arrived after the time it was supposed to be ready. It wasn't ready when I got there and the lady from the bar was running around asking questions. She finally came to me and asked what I had ordered. I showed her my receipt. She left and came back after like 7 more minutes and let me know that it will be like 10 mins until my order was done. I asked if they just started on my order and she said yes. The worse customer service ever. She didn‚Äôt try to make up for their wrong doing or anything. She left me sitting at the bar for 20 mins and asked if I wanted a water. Crazy right? I know.. My food comes out and she hands it to me and tells me to have a goodnight‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm irritated so I‚Äôm just like whatever. I‚Äôm really appalled at the lack of customer service here. Then I‚Äôm at my car sitting and a Asian lady, whose been eating at the bar for most of the night not assisting and just answering questions, came to my car with like 3-4 more people and said the tab wasn‚Äôt paid. I said okay, let me pay it but your employee said bye and goodnight so don‚Äôt try to make it like it‚Äôs my fault. Y‚Äôall dropped the ball tonight and the only thing you could do was come to my car disrespectfully about this bill. And I told her that she should be taking money off got the inconvenience but she didn‚Äôt want to hear that. She blamed the kitchen. I told her that is not my problem because it‚Äôs not. And I told her I would not be coming back. Too much money to spend on gold where people are rude and don‚Äôt know hot to correct their wrongs.

TITLE: Convenient for Fort Jackson. | TEXT: This is a nice place to stay if you are going to some activities at Fort Jackson.    The hotel is comfortable and convenient to several of the Fort gates.     It is near the interstate and access is very easy.      The hotel staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms are very nice.

TITLE: Harding Presidential Sites | TEXT: We had a great visit to the Warren G Harding Presidential Library and Memorial. The Library (aka Museum) is quite small compared to other presidential libraries, but does a good job telling the story of Harding's short presidency. Tours of his home are only offered on the hour, so we had to miss that, but did take photos from the outside. We also visited the Harding Memorial in the cemetery, which was quite impressive. If you're passing by Marion, Ohio, take a break from your drive and stop by to see the presidential sites.
TITLE: Good but not over the top | TEXT: Food was good, but I expected much more from this famous restaurant‚Ä¶service was also very slow and not at the level it should have been

TITLE: Great Dinner! Great Server! | TEXT: Wonderful Meal, Great Server, and We Enjoyed the Outdoor Seating ‚Ä¶  Had dinner here last night, did not have a reservation and the bar area was full. However, we were seated promptly outside, which was our preference. Delightfully friendly server, Anthony (see photo) greeted us and was a definite add to the dining experience ‚Äî as he knew the menu well, made great recommendations, and was genuinely friendly and eager to please. Thanks Anthony!  Food at this restaurant was well prepared, very tasty, and portion size was satisfying. We started with the grilled artichokes which we had had before and they are fantastic, with a nice a√Øoli dip. My wife had a vegetable plate and a crab cake. She makes a great crab cake, but admitted that this crab cake may have been better than hers. All crab, no filling. Outstanding! I had a marinated ribeye and baked potato. Both were delicious. Both of us had enough food that we brought home leftovers which I enjoyed for lunch.   Had a latte for dessert which was an exceptionally good cup of coffee, and the Key lime pie was memorable.  A great meal. This is a restaurant we need to go to more often.

TITLE: Fantastic Dinner | TEXT: We loved this except for one dish.  The margarita, chips and salsa, guac, ceviche, quesadilla were all amazing.  The tuna taco was surprisingly not good.  However, I would definitely go back.  Overall, loved it!

TITLE: Farm to Table Excellence | TEXT: Perhaps the best meal I had in Philadelphia. Very large restaurant with big patio and several inside dining areas plus a large bar. Well appointed and elegant but still warm and welcoming atmosphere. We enjoyed a meal of roasted cauliflower with coconut curry, garbanzo beans and quinoa. Along with lamb bolognese Pappardelle with whipped ricotta. Their chive and cheddar biscuits are to die for.  Wine options are well chosen and multiple by the glass offerings

TITLE: Groups get overpriced quotes | TEXT: I understand that restaurants may be desperate to get ¬†people to return back to their venues due to COVID but that should be all the reason for exemplary service. ¬†I reached out to Bluebird for a group reservation for 14 professional women celebrating women's month. Due to the group size the planner mandated that we have the $75 prix fixe menu. 1st Issue: planner did not ask which appetizers, entrees and desserts we wanted to choose. 2nd Issue: if I ordered the appetizer, entree and dessert a la carte, the most expensive items totaled $67. Why is the prix fixe more expensive than ordering the same items a la carte? I informed the planner I want to sub out the meal options she chose for more appealng items on the larger menu. 3rd Issue: Bluebird priced the prix fixe with the new options I chose at $90. Meanwhile the most expensive items still totaled $67 if purchased a la carte! I complained and the planner said the upcharge is to ensure everyone's food comes out at the same time. That's bizarre! Is she implying Bluebird is not used to handling groups? ¬†And why is there a $63 administrative charge in the contract?? Essentially Bluebird tried to charge $23 more per prix fixe meal per person plus the $63 admin fee equating to a $385 upcharge. Disappointing and poor service for a restaurant that I perceived as prestigious!!
TITLE: Date night with my Bride | TEXT: Excellent staff and service.  Our meal was amazing.  Seafood tower blew our mind.  The GM and head Chef came over to thank us for our visit.  Great touch!!!

TITLE: Best part of my trip to San Fran | TEXT: Fantastic, food was incredible, but what stood out was the service and friendliest staff. I dined solo sat at the bar, and the bartender was extremely welcoming and chatted to me throughout my meal and gave great recommendations for my stay in the city, despite having a busy job of making all the drinks for the restaurant. Cocktails here were also fantastic!

TITLE: Great Burgers By The Marina | TEXT: This place is one of the best in the area not only for the burgers but for the location. It's located right along the marina so if you sit outside you get the added bonus of a great view. The cheeseburger was really good. It was decent size and had a good taste. The garlic fries were also good on the side. Their menu is fairly large with many different choices for breakfast and other types of sandwiches for lunch. Overall a great place to eat not only for the food but also for the view. A very relaxing place to eat.

TITLE: Nice evening | TEXT: Small, comfortable, a tad dark inside.  Great efficient service, nice bar selection, and we enjoyed the shrimp cocktails and prime rib. Good portion cooked to perfection. Sides were also good. You get what you pay for...

TITLE: Mouth watering prime rib and steak cooked to perfection | TEXT: We decided to try Jake‚Äôs Grill and it did not disappoint!  We were in the mood for steak and prime rib and both meals were expertly prepared and absolutely delicious!  I highly recommend a Visit if you‚Äôre in downtown Portland.  Also the interior and exterior Tartarian architecture and craftsmanship was magnificent!

TITLE: Nice and friendly staff, good clean room | TEXT: We stayed here for one week as a stop on a longer trip with two small children. The service was great and the staff was very child friendly. The food was really tasty and had something for everyone in the family. Menu is reasonable priced.
TITLE: Beautiful Venue | TEXT: The view is spectacular.  The ambiance is classy.  The Chilean Sea Bass and Lobster Risotto were delicious.  This place is great for special occasions.

TITLE: Great Group Dining Experience | TEXT: We were a group of ten on the morning after our daughter's wedding. The staff at a.kitchen were helpful from the moment we asked for a reservation, a few weeks before -- coming up with a three-course prix fixe menu that accommodated everyone's tastes and dietary needs. The service was attentive, the pace was leisurely, the noise level low enough so that we could all talk....and the celebrated natural wine list was as good as we expected. We couldn't have asked for a better morning-after meal or a more thoughtful presentation. We look forward to visiting for drinks and dinner on another visit to Philadelphia.
TITLE: Cute spot for an early dinner | TEXT: My husband, daughter and I visited for an early dinner. Staff were super friendly and helpful & the food was delicious.  We will return!
